Reviews.Title: “Sometimes people deserve a second chance.... :-)”
Reviews.Author: Pudworth
Reviews.Content: We had a really stay here back in December and had a poor experience, however we decided to give the Hotel a second chance, due to the intervention of the Hotel Manager,who personally handled my complaint personally, and made sure that everything was resolved very quickly and amicably It genuinely does look as though positve changes have been made. We had a comfortable room, which was spotless. The breakfast was also good, and there was a wide selection of both hot and cold food. Crucially, this time, our bill was correct, and we were able to settle it quickly, and with no fuss! - This really did make a huge difference; having no "hassle" on our last day. From a Customer Service point of view, I would also mention that as the last day of our stay coincided with a Train Crash that closed the railway line to the Airport, the staff were very helpful in helping us with other options. So WELL DONE to Harold and his team for restoring our confidence, and for taking customer feedback on board - And in words I never thought we'd say.... "We'll be back!"

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value - already looking forward to my next visit”
Reviews.Author: ginalovestravel
Reviews.Content: As many reviewers have already said, this hotel is strategically located, right in the middle of the action, and walking distance to great sightseeing. The service exceeded my expectations. Every time I asked for a recommendation for a restaurant, I was sent to a little gem that perfectly suited my needs that night. Contrary to reviewers who mentioned the size of the room as a negative point, my room was spacious. As I had planned to bring my laptop and do some work, I had booked a business suite, and it was a wise decision. The WiFi/Internet connection was very good. My room, located on the 5th floor was very clean, with plenty of windows that you can open to get some fresh air, quiet and super comfortable. Attention to details is what made my "temporary home" feel so cozy: scented votive candles in the bathroom, complimentary bottles of water, towel heating rack, good quality toiletries, etc. After a tiring flight from oversea, I was delighted with the fresh fruit tray delivered to my room shortly after my arrival. As a solo woman traveler, I also felt very safe in the neighbourhood, and at the hotel. For those who need access to a computer, the business centre has great computers with excellent internet connection. Above all, the friendly staff made my stay a delightful experience.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: irrene
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my second time round Great staff and as always ready to help Rooms were refurbished and loved the wine and nibbles Great location bang on dam square Excellent

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but...”
Reviews.Author: T C
Reviews.Content: This was my first experience with Swissotel. Great location, but the rooms were small (and that may be mormal by Euorpean standards). Also the carpet was filthy. Other than that it was a nice place to say, good servive and friendly staff. Outstanding concierge.

Reviews.Title: “Great for a weekend in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mintothemax
Reviews.Content: This hotel is right on Dam Square and so is brilliantly located. You can walk anywhere in Amsterdam from here. It is primarily a business hotel although we used it as a base for a long weekend of tourism. So, if you're looking for something bijou and authentically Dutch this is not the place for you. However, the staff are friendly, helpful and anglophone (of course). We stayed during the most bitter cold snap Amsterdam had seen for fifteen years. The canals were frozen and people were walking, skating, pushing prams and sitting on sofas on the canals. It was bitter. Oh what joy to have a hotel that was fastidiously clean, tidy and beautifully warm. The room was a good size and very comfortable. The bathroom was good and incredibly warm. Can't emphasise that enough given the conditions. I'd use it again.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: stuartled
Reviews.Content: Just flew back from Amsterdam - and are arms tired! Seriously, stayed three nights with my family at this Dam Square gem of a hotel. The staff was very friendly and catered to my family's every need. I heard no noise in my hotel room, which is in the heart of Amsrerdam in a perfect and busy location. You can walk ot take the tram from everywhere. Nothing but great things to say. There are two negitives. The breakfast is not great. Three small hot items and some pastries and cereal. We expected a little more choices. You might be better off getting a room that doesn't include breakfast and eating at the many places around the hotel. Also, if you come with a car, you have to call them on the way to get a third-party attendant to take your vechile. The hotel has no bell hops or attendant to take the car. You will not have access to it for the entire trip. The other alternative is to park in the department store garage across the street, which we did, for 50 Euro a night! Ouch! As for the hotel itself, it was nice and would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “A little surprised....”
Reviews.Author: milesfish
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here several time over the last decade. I've enjoyed the hotel and the staff and certainly the Dam Square location. But it is not an "excellent" hotel. It is an hotel with very average rooms/baths that has an excellant location. It's an OK hotel but it is overpriced for room you get and the Amsterdam market. Swissotel is a great chain...this is not one of there great hotels. Staff is great. Restaurant inside and out is great. Breakfast is great. Location is great. Rooms are not so great.

Reviews.Title: “Strategic Location In City Center”
Reviews.Author: GGtravelnotes
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the biggest suite. A room with big space and comfortable. Excellent feel of city life and good view from the room. Only 10 minutes walk from the central train station. Everything is within walking distance. Perfect and friendly hospitality, just ask the reception if you have any question and they could arrange almost everything for you. Hotel do provides bicycle rental. Spent a day around the city is worthwhile: museums, Anne Frank house, Madame Tussauds Amsterdam, diamond factory, Heineken experience, city cruise, etc... Must also visit to Madurodam, windmills and cheese factory. Keukenhof is the perfect place to see the garden of flowers and beautiful tulips during Spring for limited time only (20mar-22May), reserve 3 hours minimum to walk around the park, enjoy the scenery and shooting photograph. Remember to take extra clothes as it may be freezing cold when the wind blow. Enjoy Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional Service”
Reviews.Author: Liteworker
Reviews.Content: Swissotel has a name to defend. As one of the premier brands for 5 star luxury hotel. And Swissotel is certainly up for that name. What it lacks in size it makes up in service. Because it's only problem for me is exactly this location, which is quite small a building, if you are used to Swissotel in Istanbul for instance. Check in was swift, professional, we got an upgrade of our room. And the the exceptional service appeared : I mentioned an issue with the valet service, which is an extra service they outsource, so not from the hotel itself, but the issue was take in hand personally by Rob, one of the concierges and he took it upon himself to resolve the issue and an hour later an envelope was ready at reception that took care of it. The room was very spacious, very good bed, very good mattress. Very nice design and about the best and biggest choice of minibar snacks, wow ! The bar was a bit disappointing. There are many more nicer bars to go to then this one. We didn't take breakfast in the hotel, so I can't comment on that. But I would certainly recommend this hotel for a city trip to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: JanHGlasgow
Reviews.Content: Spent one night here, but would have stayed for more if I could have. The welcome from the hotel staff was great, the hot towels on arrival was a lovely touch. The room looked right on to Dam Square which was fab and the room and bed was very comfortable. On check out the chilled bottle of water again a lovely touch. I will definitely look to book this hotel again when staying in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay”
Reviews.Author: dyane_12
Reviews.Content: Just returned from spending 3 nights at the Swissotel Ameterdam and could not fault it any way From checking in with the reception staff to dining/bar and housekeeping we could not have had any better service. Location perfect, hotel room 1st class that was room 111 and helpfull staff what more could you ask for a pefect week-end..Thank you Swissotel

Reviews.Title: “Location can't be beat”
Reviews.Author: Ben P
Reviews.Content: Pros: location, location, location. Booked two rooms, and for a very reasonable price, one was a corner room overlooking Dam Square. Did I mention location? Also, the Dam Square room was big, with a huge bathroom. Very modern. Very reasonable. Cons: the "other" room, i.e. the one not on Dam Square, was tiny...almost cruise ship tiny. The bathroom was tiny as well. Felt very claustrophobic. I know you don't go to Amsterdam to spend time in your room, but you at least want enough room to stretch your arms. Overall: entirely worth it. Updated, modern, fantastic location. Advice: pick your room in advance. Get the corner rooms overlooking Dam Square. Don't stay here if they're going to shove you in a corner.

Reviews.Title: “Modern chic hotel, bang in the middle of Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Xindia
Reviews.Content: first impressions of the hotel was the great location, could not get more central, right next to dam square! When inside the hotel, its decorated to a high modern standard! The rooms in the hotel are also nice and modern and also very clean! The showers aren't very powerful but they do the job! Theres a mini bar stocked with goodys, and plenty of coffee making facilities! We also had room service which was prompt! The staff at the hotel are very friendly and helpful, and they'res also a room to leave luggage in when you check out! Overall, great hotel, will definately be staying there next time aswell!!!

Reviews.Title: “Convenient, Clean and Good Value”
Reviews.Author: euroboundtraveler
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed three nights at this hotel and would stay again. The hotel staff was helpful, friendly and efficient. The main desk is at the front door and a key is needed for the elevator. An employee seemed to be at the front desk at most times. The hotel felt safe to us. We had a classic room that was clean, fairly good size, nice bathroom, a safe in the room and small refrigerator. The hotel is just off Dam square and there is a tram stop right outside the front door. It was very easy to navigate our daily schedule. The Central train station is a short walk. When we arrived we walked from the train station, but took the tram back when we left. The connection between the Central station and Schipol airport is incredibly eas. There is an Albert Hein grocery store on the other side of Dam square, which was helpful too.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip”
Reviews.Author: liamoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed five nights here in March. The staff were all very friendly and helpful. There were nice welcoming touches in the room such as a personalised note and some fresh fruit. I made use of the small hotel gym on two days, which was basic but modern and clean. The communal areas are a very high standard, though the room was a little dated - I assume it was one which hasn't yet been renovated, but it was large and absolutely fine. Breakfast in the attached restaurant was very good. EUR50 for 5 days wifi is outrageous and I find the management response that a hotel of this size cannot justify its own internet service rather feeble. Luckily, I was able to pick up a local free wifi hotspot and avoid this charge!! With regards to the location, it was perfect for commuting as was a 5 min walk to Centraal station, which I needed to get to every morning. However, whilst being as central as you can get, the main road Damrak which the hotel is on is rather grotty. Coming back late one night, there were some very undesirable people on Dam Square, adjacent to the hotel. This is probably what you should expect of a big city, though. If I was to return to Amsterdam for business I'd be happy to stay here again, but for a personal trip I would much prefer to be in a slightly quieter and prettier area. Overall, the friendly staff and nice personal touches made this an enjoyable trip.

Reviews.Title: “Mini break stay”
Reviews.Author: LDott
Reviews.Content: Just back from a 3 night stay and I can only re iterate what all of the other reviews have stated. The hotel is in an excellent location, so easy to get everywhere, nice and clean rooms, but most importantly the staff were so helpful and accomodating. We celebrated 2 birthdays while in Amsterdam and the staff offered complimentary champagne and remembered to wish us a Happy Birthday! Cant recommend this hotel enough!

Reviews.Title: “business trip to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Natalya V
Reviews.Content: A nice hotel for a city. The location is excelent! It's in the heart of Amsterdam: 5 min. walk everywhere: to museums, shops, central station, canal station etc. The hotel is small but very cosy, the rooms are also small but include everything necessary. The personell is very helpfull, special thanks to Cindy! :-) The breakfast costs 12 Euro per person and for us it was enough till dinner. Next time I'll go to Amsterdam - I'll stay in this hotel. The only minus is Wi-Fi not for free in the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: PookieBear2011
Reviews.Content: What a great location! The hotel is right next to Dam Square and is only a few minutes walk from Amsterdam Central station. Amsterdam itself is very easy to get around - everything is within walking distance, but if you want to get the tram, there are stops just outside the hotel. The room was nice - good size, plenty of storage space, free safe, comfy beds, nice bathroom, clean etc. The room we stayed in faced the street at the back of the hotel and, in the afternoon when we checked in, it was very noisy and, being a Saturday, we were worried that it would be horrendous at night and we wouldn't get any sleep - actually it wasn't too bad and the street was pretty quiet at night. The view wasn't great - looked straight at a Burger King, but you're in a city centre, so it's kind of expected that your view will be of walls! The reception staff were great - friendly, willing to help and very knowledgeable about the local area. The hotel was safe & secure - to access the hotel at night, you have to use your room key, so no risk of just anybody walking in off the street. I'd never been to Amsterdam before and was worried the hotel would be full of stag do's, but we only ever saw couples. I would definitely stay here again if I was to return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, room was disappointing”
Reviews.Author: Mrs-Smith-jones
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel late on a Friday night and was told by the receptionist that we had a really good room - on the second floor at the back. On the way to the room we were told that it was good as it was big and the smoking balcony was right next to it, The room was big but was one of those which was still to be renovated and there was some sort of generator above it which went on and off all day and night. The room also had two singled beds pushed together rather than one large bed. They had seperate bedding on- not the bed topper that's mentioned in other reviews. We asked to be moved to a room with one bed but were told they were full that evening. I'm sure the newly renovated rooms are lovely but if you get an older one I think you will feel a bit short changed. The walls were all scuffed, the furniture had seen better days and the bathroom wasn't great. The beds were very comfy though. Generally it felt like being in a 2 or 3 star hotel. Also having people on the smoking balcony next to our room was a bit annoying. However the staff were helpful when we needed a cab. Overall it was okay. Last time I was there on business I stayed at the Parkhotel which although wasn't as central was a better standard.

Reviews.Title: “great place”
Reviews.Author: nysara
Reviews.Content: we stayed here over new year's eve 2010 into 2011. It was a great deal and in a great location. We were able to walk to most places easily and the tram stopped right in front of the hotel. Quick walk to central station. Staff was very friendly, rooms were clean. We had a few issues with the shower and toilet in the bathroom breaking and they moved us to another room. They handled the mayhem of the dam square new year's party well

Reviews.Title: “very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: dfundfun
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, on dam square. perfect service, Espresso machine in every room. the room is not too big but it clean and useful. fully equipped gym with the dam squares view in the windows...

Reviews.Title: “Great location and good value”
Reviews.Author: BaskersonTour
Reviews.Content: there cant be many better located hotels in amsterdam....on dam square and a simple 10 minute walk to the station....staff were very plesant, the rooms were excellent and for around 100 euro a night, a great business and leisure hotel...will definitely be back

Reviews.Title: “Near Royal Palace”
Reviews.Author: ITA_And_RE_a
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed very much staying in this hotel for it's great location, cleanliness and courteouse and helping staff. Perfect location in Dam Square Be careful of pickpocketers in Amsterdam big plus: location and friendly, helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel in a great location...”
Reviews.Author: HarrogateCheggers
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 nights over the New Year and was very pleased with all aspects of the hotel. It is right on Dam Square and has easy access to all the key attractions; the staff were very friendly and helpful; the rooms were spacious and clean (perhaps they could do with a slightly more modern TV though); I really liked the fresh coffee machine (free) ; the bathroom was well equiped and had a good powerful shower; excellent housekeeping service; loved the fact there was a pillow menu (which I used). Only minor gripe would be that I requested a double room and they pushed two single beds together (with 2 single duvets) which wasn't ideal when a gap appeared in the middle of the night; is this a European standard thing that I am not aware of? Overall very happy and will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Location!”
Reviews.Author: pdsh1
Reviews.Content: Perfect location, just returned from a short break. Easy walk from Central station, on the doorstep of most attractions.Excellent staff, very comfortable beds and pillows. Safe in the room which is free to use, Quality coffee machine in the room, clean and good quality bathroom. Did not eat in the restaurant butit looked good and prices not over expensive. Highly recomended, and I will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, Great service”
Reviews.Author: Frederica84
Reviews.Content: I accompanied my husband on a business trip to amsterdam last fall, and we stayed at the swissotel amsterdam. The location is great. It is so easy to walk everywhere from the hotel, and the shopping streets are right next door also. The service was great and everyone at the front desk was really nice and accomodating. We asked for our room to be ready early ( 7am) as we were arriving on an early flight and the room was ready upon our arrival. We did not eat at the hotel so I can't review the food/breakfeast. We did find an amazing restaurant closeby, "incanto" and we went there every single night of our stay. The room we had was very spacious and comfortable. I would definitely recommand this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: StephWalsh
Reviews.Content: Just back from a weekend in Amsterdam where we stayed in the Swissotel. It is in a great location being in Dam Square. 5 different trams stop outside the door, the no.'s 4,9,16,24 & 25 and nearby the 14 & 2 so you can get anywhere by tram if you don't feel like walking. The staff were extremely courteous and helpful in fact some of the best staff I have ever come across. The rooms were comfy and had everything including a nespresso machine for complimentary coffee. The mini bar was well stocked but pricey, there was also a vending machine located on our floor which also charged mini bar prices. I would stay in this hotel again and would also stay in this brand in other locations based on this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding quality of service”
Reviews.Author: yhara1224
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in the beginning of Jan. 2012. By my mistake, I had a problem during my trip (I don't go to the detail of my problem), however everyone of the hotel helped me a lot, they always took care of me, thought what they can do for me, tried to make my stay better. Attention of the hotel staffs toward the guests are outstanding, the quality of service of the hotel is extremely high, as mentioned by other reviews. I hope many travelers to stay at the hotel and experience pleasant, comfortable stay in Amsterdam. Hara

Reviews.Title: “One of our favorites in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: amltucson
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel and have stayed here many times. We splurge on the largest suite and always love the room and modern bathrooms. Great location!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Katy F
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed here for 3 nights from Saturday 14th January! After much shopping about for a hotel, we settled on Swisshotel. What can I say, other than a fantastic hotel! Right in the heart of the city on Dam Square, 5 minute walk from central station and the city as a whole is walk able from here! The staff could not of been better, the rooms were very clean and well decorated, noise was never an issue. We felt it safe to walk back to the hotel late at night. Highly recommend this hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location, great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Laura J
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here twice, last time being about 2 years ago. The hotel is in a brilliant location. You're near everything! Rooms are clean and very modern, the beds are one of the comfiest I've slept in. Housekeeping very efficient as well. Front desk staff also very helpful and friendly. Room service is also recommended. Great hotel. Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Hotel, Great Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: Rohit_CG
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Swissotel Amsterdam during the Christmas break 2011. The hotel is at a very convenient location, right at Dam Square. One could even walk up to the hotel from the Amsterdam Centraal Station, its like a 5min walk. So on arrival, I had my reservation in place. I asked for an upgrade, and I was upgraded to a suite at a very attractive price. The suite was awesome. A very large room with the front window looking into Dam Square. The rooms have a Nespresso machine, and for a coffee lover like me, that was very good. The staff were mostly very helpful and courteous and guided me whenever I needed help. One weird thing happened because of which I rate the hotel as 3/5 and not 5/5. On one of the nights when I got back to the hotel at around 2.00am (tired and a little high), my room access key would not work. Its the same key which one needs to use to activate the elevator as well. The person at the front desk checked on their system and said that I had to clear the payment for the room service, internet, etc etc for the room key to be activated, as the system had blocked my room entry card. I found that very very strange, because all this would be cleared at the time of checkout anyway, so why stop a guest at 2.00am. Anyway, I was very tired and sleepy, and just handed over my card to be swiped. I was told that this is just a blocked amount and will be credited back to my card when I make the full payment on my checkout. Next day at check out I informed the front desk manager about what had happened the previous night, and he did apologize to me. So, I made the balance payment, and was reassured that the blocked amount on my credit card that I had handed over the previous night would be re-credited to my card. Its been more than 1 week, and this has not happened as yet. This is also the reason why I have waited for a week before sharing my review here. Overall the stay was good, staff mostly courteous, but that one incident was quite a letdown, especially if you stop a guest in the middle of the night. Moreover, the blocked amount has not been re-credited as yet. I did send out an email to the hotel yesterday, but haven't heard back as yet. I would definitely recommend the hotel to everyone for its location, nice rooms, and the mostly courteous staff. But it would be great on the hotel's part to rectify their room-management system as its impolite to stop a guest in the middle of the night for whatever reasons. All balance payments can be cleared at the time of checkout. This is my point of view, the hotel may differ on this, but I believe that all readers should know about this.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: bobstuff
Reviews.Content: My wife and I recently spent 10 nights at the Swissotel in Amsterdam. The location is great. If you arrive at the Central Station you can easily walk from the train station to the hotel. It takes about 10 to 15 minutes and its a nice walk. This walk will take you along one of the main streets in Amsterdam, it is very safe. Lots of people are in the street and you will feel safe. Once in the hotel you will find a haven from your cares. This is a 4 star hotel. Honestly, it looks like a 3 star hotel but the staff and GM act as though it is a 5 star hotel. The customer service is outstanding. The employees are upbeat, smart, well trained, attentive and nice. The GM and staff are off the scale good. I highly recommend this hotel and will return on my next trip to Amsterdam. I also recommend a room overlooking Dam Square. There is some "ambient" noise from the street cars and traffic but it;s not bothersome. Actually, I liked it and the views are great. All and all, we loved our time in this fine hotel. The GM and staff are outstanding. book this hotel,,,, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: liseyy
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband have just been back from amsterdam, we only stayed a couple of days with one night in the Swissotel. The staff are very friendly and prompt. The hotel facilities are good, nice bedroom, shower etc, the TV in the room is very small, but I didnt go to Amsterdam to watch tv anyway! There is a coffe machine in our room, but it didnt seem to be working properly as the coffee was lukewarm which is a shame. We ordered some food late at night and it was very good and well presented, I was a bit dissapointed with the breakfast but I am very often disappointed with Hotel breakfasts. Overall, great value for money and would definetely go back!

Reviews.Title: “In the heart of the city”
Reviews.Author: Lozio
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a small, elegant place to stay in the heart of the city. Perfect location, well organized, elegant enough to be ok both for business and for romantic weekends. Staff was good. The only thing: I paid my room (a suite which is worth to have if you find a good deal) in advance. They were asking me for all the rate while checking out...after a while they saw that I was right and they apologize. Why these things and mistakes happen only when YOU have to pay more?

Reviews.Title: “Doesn't Get Better Than This!!!”
Reviews.Author: ArtesiaBulldogs
Reviews.Content: My partner and I enjoyed (mostly enjoyed because I was sick the whole time, but thats another issue) our weekend getaway stay in Amsterdam. It was my first time staying at this hotel and my first time visiting this city. The location can't be beat, it is right smack in the middle of the city and only about a 10 minute walk from the train station (which is about a 30 minute ride from the airport). From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, the employees at this hotel made us feel very welcome and displayed the highest level of service! Forgive me, but I am horrible at remembering names, but everyone we encountered were a delight and a credit to Swissotel. The breakfast was very good and tasty. The service was flawless. I appreciated the buffet setup as I could choose what I wanted to eat, rather than being given a set-plate. The only thing I would recommend to the staff is the juice and milk were simply set out and not kept cold. I would think that would be a health and safety issue being that we are dealing with dairy products. I did not drink the milk as I did not want to take the chance of drinking spoilt milk. But other than that, the food was great and kept warm! As for our room, I am not a fan of hardwood floors, especially in the cold weather, but thats what slippers are for. The bed was quite comfortable, the chairs seemed a bit small and very 'doll-house' like. The TV seemed to be from the 1990s and only 13 inches? This made it very difficult to watch while laying in bed relaxing. Perhaps getting TV sets from this century (example, flat-screen/flat panel and definitly at least 20 inches if not more) would be a smart business decision. Nonetheless, our room was very nice. The espresso machine was much appreciated and made some of the most delicious coffee ever! Oh, and before I forget, let me thank the housekeeper who provided me with a kettle to heat up some water to take my 'hot medicine' to help with my cold. She said it would be much easier than using the espresso machine for just hot water. Thank you again for a lovely stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: obzhora555
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Very friendly, smart and helpfull personal! Rooms are amazing! Location - couldn't be better, right in the center. Beds just amazing! Bathrooms sparkling clean and modern!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel & location”
Reviews.Author: Robesonone
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel right on dam rak. Excellent service, good rooms, would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “good location..”
Reviews.Author: missylee28
Reviews.Content: spend 3 nights in a premium room on Nov 2011. what i liked : 1) very good location . train station is just 10-15 min walk on yr left and the dam square is just a few steps away to yr right. 2) metro stop is just across the street. therefore if u have too many lugages u can opt the metro 3)if this is yr first time to amsterdam there is ticket n tour shop next to the hotel whereby u can get the HOHO tickets and maybe the country side tour .. 4) the room , bed is huge . loved the extra coat rack which is addition to the hanging space in closet. what i wished it could be better : 1) the main reason for getting a premium room , its a bigger size bathroom . for me the premium size bathroom is just average size bathroom which u can get in other hotels in europe (except paris of course..) 2) a harder pillow, the current ones are too soft. 3) inclusive of taxes n everything we paid more than 200euro p/n...therefore i wished wifi was free instead of making us pay 10 euro p/night.

Reviews.Title: “Still my choice when in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Zury
Reviews.Content: I've stayed here in 2006, just my husband and I. I wrote a review in tripadvisor about the hotel and my ratings are more or less the same. I do remember thinking that its an ideal place to stay with the kids, and this time, I did!! I booked 2 rooms, they called me a few days before the check-in dates to confirm the children's ages and made sure that the extra rollaway beds were there when we arrived. I asked for extra slippers from room service and they sent it over quickly. They also provide a pillow menu where you can choose different types of pillows! Location-wise, its really next to Dam square, and there's a tram stop just outside the hotel to take you further into Amsterdam and a tourist ticket shop next door so you can really buy your tickets there and plan and check where you want to go. The kids, who gets tired tired easily is happy that they can easily go back to the hotel for a nap when they need to. The only reason I'm not giving the hotel full rates is because I had a shocking discovery with their room service menu, apparently the vegetable soup I ordered which was marked as vegetarian had meatballs in them! Called the receptionist to confirm and pointed it out. He apologized when he realised the error, and replaced it with an alternative. All in all, the kids loved it and that's all that matters to me..!! And the next time I stay here, I'll make sure to book the special kids room that they offer, that will surely be a treat for the kids..!

Reviews.Title: “Poor service..............”
Reviews.Author: Pudworth
Reviews.Content: We go to Amsterdam twice a year, and always stay at NH Hotels. However, due to a really good price for a "Premier" room, with inclusive WiFi, we booked this hotel via a tour operator (British Airways, who we use regularly) On arrival, we got to our room to find that it was on the small side, especially the bathroom, which was tiny (so small, that the toilet roll holder was jammed against the towel rail, and didnt work!). After complaining at reception, the receptionist confirmed that we had one of the smallest rooms, and we were offered a larger room, but told we could only move the next day, as the hotel was full. So we re-packed the next morning, and went to reception, only to be told (by someone else) that we already had a big room, there were no other rooms, but that we could upgrade for E100 per night (no thanks!). So back we went to our original room..... On asking about the inclusive Wifi, we were told that it has not been included, but that they would charge it to us, and remove it from our bill at the end of the stay Having requested a late check out on Sunday (at NH Hotels, this runs until 1700hrs, and is free), we were then told (grudgingly) that we could have until 1300 free, and then we would be charged E20 per hour! So having decided to check out at 1300, came the best bit! - The Hotel tried to charge us once again for the whole cost of the weekend (500E), despite us having given them a PrePaid Voucher, and them telling us on check-in that our credit card was "For Extras Only". We then had to phone the 24 hour BA Helpline, who (Thank God!) confirmed to the Hotel that we had paid, and sent them an email, so that we could leave! In fairness to the Duty Manager on Sunday, he did his best to help us, and was far more interested than the staff we dealt with earlier in the weekend As you can see from our other reviews, we tend to mark quite highly, but I can honestly say that this was the worst service we have ever received. Had we been urgently getting a flight, the check out experience would have been even more stressful than it was So if you stay here via a tour operator, make sure that you print off your vouchers - I am so glad we did! Also, bear in mind that preferences you ask for are not guaranteed - in this case, we got none of them Really poor, and we won't be back.....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: DenisaUsman
Reviews.Content: The hotel is right on Dam Square, which is right in the center. Me and my husband visited amsterdam for the first time and we were glad that we have choosen SWISSOTEL. It was soo easy to find it from the central station, very close to everyhing. The room was lovely, staff was very nice and hellpfull. The bed was massive and sooooo soft. You get even a menu to choose a pillow. We were happy with those one which were already there but we thought that was soo cool. they have cleaned our room every morning, the bathroom was clean, every day clean towels and plus soo many of them, so you never run out of them. Bathroom was heated all day, nice and warm if you are taking the shower. The hotel was very quiet, it was an excellent choice and would definatelly return back. Lovely hotel:-)

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel & great location”
Reviews.Author: mark1961
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights november 2011. Hotel has a fantatic location right on the corner of dam square which is no longer than a 10 min walk to any of the main places of interest, central station is 8 mins on foot. When we got to our room i could hear drilling from the hotel next door, after mentioning this to the reception staff they were very appologetic and changed our foom straight away,great service. The room was a good size with a huge doule bed over six feet wide and the most comfy bed i have ever slept in. All facilities in the hotel are of a high standardas are all the staff especially the concierge during the day

Reviews.Title: “Love This Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: djhenryhall
Reviews.Content: I have been to Amsterdam many times and this is one of my favorite hotels. Rooms are very spacious, trendy and the hotel is centrally located on Damrak. It's very easy to walk to and from the train to get to the hotel. The train ride is about 15 mins from the airport. And the location is uber central to walk all of the quite essential tourist destinations. Although, the hotel is in a central and noisy area - once inside your room room's are very quite and relaxing. Of course, the staff is super friend and knowledgeable - They directed to me a few fantastic pancake and local (non-tourist) dinning spots.

Reviews.Title: “A visitor friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: jpcn17
Reviews.Content: This is a nice, convenient, pleasant hotel. Of note are the helpful staff and the pitchers of water and juice at the front desk. Most places in Amsterdam you have to buy water, same price as beer!, so the hotel water was much appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: 186338James2011
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel last week for three nights. Upon arrival we were greeted by an Asian lady with a great sense of humor, probably the best reception Iâ€™ve had in my 100â€™s of hotel visits. I saw her interact in the same way with other visitors. Our room was at the back, so it was silent, however the apertures have very low insulation and I can understand those who claim the rooms may be noisy if oneâ€™s room faces the main street. Being situated on Dam square the location is, of course, brilliant. Rooms are modern and a good size and come with a healthy welcome snack and personalized note from the manager. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Good”
Reviews.Author: mohmohsin
Reviews.Content: I liked this hotel nice friendly staff good rates and great area. Can get noisy a bit but i never mind that. The rooms are kindof old though, bearable though if all you want to do is sleep in them.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad for Amsterdam.”
Reviews.Author: avoronin
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 3 nights. Room rate was good, in Amsterdam hotels are very expensive. It is centrally localted on a busy street. Everything was good and as you would expect from a Swissotel, but next time I will stay with my family in a quieter district or Haarlem.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: RicardoAssef
Reviews.Content: the rooms are spacious, front desk staff incredible friendly and the view from the room fantastic. The hotel is centrally located, can't be better, ie. in front of Dan Square.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat the location.”
Reviews.Author: Vinny102
Reviews.Content: Perfect location! It's a nice hotel with friendly staff. I can't think of a reason why someone shouldn't stay there.

Reviews.Title: “A little dissapointed”
Reviews.Author: FordyPerth
Reviews.Content: We were on a 4 week holiday and out of the 6 hotels that we had booked through out our 4 week holiday this hotel was the most expensive and would have to be the one that we liked the least. Don't get me wrong, the staff in this place could not of been more friendlier and helpful, and when you go up the lift to the floor where your room is - you walk into the corridors which look really modern and appealing until you unlock the door to your room. We had a classic room and was highly dissapointed when we seen the room. The curtains had cigarette burn marks in them and when we opened the blinds and curtains was about 2 foot away from a brick wall - so nothing to look at outside the window, but then again we were not in our rooms very often anyhow. I have to say that the beds were comfortable and had a good night's sleep whilst there. We have stayed in another Swissotel and this is nothing like the other Swissotel that we stayed in last time. The staff had to be commended for a great job - but the rooms need to be refurbished - something along the lines of the corridors would certainly make it feel like you have got your money's worth.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but avarage rooms”
Reviews.Author: fioccadineve
Reviews.Content: I have just returned from our Amsterdam visit with my husband. We have selected Swissotel-Amsterdam because of its location and positive reviews from tripadvisor.com and we are very pleased of our stay at this hotel. The location is really perfect and very close to all touristic places (Redlight District, Leidseplein, Anne Frank House, shopping centres etc.) at Amsterdam. The staff were very very polite and kind. The bed was king-size and very comfortable. Also I have to say that the pillows and the pillow menu was a good conception for customer satisfaction. We were informed that the ongoing renovations were finished and yes, there was no more annoying noise at the hotel (According to previous comments). However our room (n.330) was narrow and old furnitured. The cupboard was extremely smelling cannabis. Besides that we do not have any negative concerns and we do advise Swissotel for a lovely and confortable stay at Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, beautifully appointed,Superb staff.”
Reviews.Author: Bader54
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have just returned from a four day visit to the city.I would commend anyone planning a visit in Amsterdam to think of this hotel as their first preference.We have stayed in many others in the city on previous occasions whilst visiting friends but in our view this hotel is in a class of its own . The Manager and his staff are trully excellent and their advice, help and guidance is readily forthcoming and trully excellent.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: travelers069
Reviews.Content: we flew to Amsterdam on the tuesday,upon landing we discovered that the the train station is in the airport. We easily bought a return ticket and were soon on our way to the hotel 15 mins approx. on leaving the train station we walked about 10 mins down the main road and came to our hotel could not have been easier. booking in was fast and efficient, room comfortable and a nice touch was a small wine and nibbles in our room in the evening, also when the hair dryer broke I phoned the reception and it was dealt with immediatly. Location excellent, we were able to walk to many of the attractions. If you go to Ann Frank house go early very long queues.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Facility, Fantastic Location, Fantastic Staff!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Charles S
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights in the Swissotell....the best location possible.....right off Dam Square. Within easy walking distance of most of the big attractions. Rob was part of a very special staff that helped us make our stay almost like home. Free internet access in a newly equipped business center. I will definately return on my future visits to Amsterdam. Very nicely decorated and tastefully furnished.

Reviews.Title: “Great City - Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Dwayne S
Reviews.Content: Our first trip to Amsterdam was made special by our stay at the Swissotel. Lovely hotel with a great location and the staff extremely friendly and helpful. Rob was very helpful getting us settled and with recommendations within the city. Special thanks to Rob. We enjoyed our visit so much we will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “clean, comfy and friendly”
Reviews.Author: deewall
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swissotel, Amsterdam for two nights. Very comfy beds (memory mattress) and choice of pillows. Room was clean. Tea/coffee maker. Reasonably priced room service and vending machine. Staff friendly and helpful. Stored our bags for the day free of charge. Free internet access. Close to central train station on a main road, but room was very quiet. Would book again.

Reviews.Title: “My home in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: yhara1224
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the hotel many times in the past few years. Although there are plenty of hotels in Amsterdam, I believe that it's the best and there is no other choice for me. Of course the location -- in the heart of the city -- is pretty good, you can get anywhere easily, and the rooms are quite comfortable, but the thing I would like to mention is the high-quality services provided by the staffs. All of the people who participate in the hotel are friendly and helpful, satisfiable stay is always guaranteed. However I do not want to recommend the hotel to others, because I'm not happy if so many people want to stay at the hotel and it gets difficult to make a reservation ;-) Please keep a room available for my next trip! ... Anyway I hope everyone who visits Amsterdam has a pleasant stay and enjoy the city. Goede reis! Hara

Reviews.Title: “First time in Amsterdam? This is the best place to stay at!”
Reviews.Author: Peter L
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was EXTREMELY friendly and helpful!! They really made my first visit to Amsterdam comfortable and safe. I highly recommend this hotel! Too bad they are sold out during my extended stay.... Room: The room was quite smaller than I'm used to back in the US however, the bed must be equivalent to a california king mattress. Also, you get a selection of different pillows that fit your need which is pretty cool. This is by far the most comfortable hotel bed I've EVER stayed in...even when compared to those high-priced Vegas hotels. Service: I really can't say enough about how friendly and helpful the staff are. Top notch customer service! Mr. Lee #628

Reviews.Title: “On the DAM”
Reviews.Author: sam69-73
Reviews.Content: Modern hotel with good amenities. Location is great, if a little congestion due to the mall traffic. Excellent concierge service especially from Rob C. He made great recommendations matched to our taste, gave good directions and followed up after our experience. down side was a crowded check in area. Brunch at the hotel was a good value, but the DAM PLAZA was a disappoinment. Convenient, yes but not nearly the caliber of the hotel brunch for breakfast, and certainly not as nice and atmospheric as many places in proximity to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Monalisa777
Reviews.Content: The best part i liked abt this hotel room was the coffee maker... Some well brewed fresh coffee choices. It also has a business centre wit free internet access. The room was fairly spacious and the location is the best bet u can get for a hotel in the heart of Amsterdam central... Close to trains, trams, restaurants, day trip operators :-) simply fantastic

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, pleasant staff, a small kink”
Reviews.Author: pvtryan25
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for 3 nights, and got a Deluxe Room initially. The fittings are modern and functional - its location next to Dam Square and being near to the Old Side of Amsterdam (where the red-light districts and numerous eating outlets are) is a plus point. It also has many trams stopping right in front of its entrance and a 10-15 min walk away from Amsterdam Centraal station, The staff are almost always responsive and willing to help with queries. Kudos to the two hotel managers Albert and Maudy for making our stay memorable. There was, however, a late development that runied our stay. On our second night we realised that one of our suitcases was broken into. The suitcase was found in a strange position, and the zip was pried open, almost unnoticeably. Some foreign currency was lost (we were lucky that we took all the Euros with us on that particular day). We reported it to the Hotel Manager but he couldn't trace the perpetuator after checking all the room access timings. Since it was highly unlikely that an outsider entered our room without any security access, we assumed that it was probably an inside job (but not jumping to conclusions as to who did it). The perpetuator probably did it many times with other guests without them even noticing that their part of their cash is gone. To the Hotel Manager's credit, he upgraded us to the Junior Suite on the last night and instructed housekeeping not to enter our room. This was the only kink that ruined our otherwise very enjoyable and memorable stay at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location, Functional Room”
Reviews.Author: Steve8010
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a terrific location - right in the heart of the city with transport options galore! We managed to walk from the Central Station (after alighting from the Eurostar) and this only took about 10 minutes. Front Office staff were very inviting. We didn't realise until our arrival, that we had come on Amsterdam's busiest weekend - the Queen's Birthday. Needless to say there were people all over town as the population swelled. The room itself was quite large - almost like a one bedroom condo. It had wooden floorboards with lounges, separate bedroom and large bathroom. The only thing about the bathroom was the open nature of it - with glass panels dividing the bathroom and the bedroom (not very private). All in all, a pleasant hotel and would recommend due to the location.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Wonderful Location”
Reviews.Author: DINKS521
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights. Hotel location is very close to trams and not far from the Central Station. The rooms were small, we had a room overlooking the "Chinese Massage parlor", but it was quiet, and not overlooking the main street which was noisy until about 1:00 a.m, and then started again around 4:00 a.m. The Hotel staff were wonderful, gave us great suggestions on how to navigate the tram system, and get where we wanted to go in the least amount time.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Alexandra051
Reviews.Content: I am returning home tomorrow after a wonderful city break in Amsterdam made all the more enjoyable by staying at the Swissotel. I am so impressed with the high standard of service provided and the helpful staff that I wanted to write this review before I leave. The hotel could not be more central and the tram stop is in front of the hotel entrance. Reception staff are very knowledgable about activities in the city, and which trams will take you there. The rooms are spotless - fruit and mints left in your room, towels changed daily and also sheets if you wish. All staff are more than courteous and could not do enough to help and I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel,highly recommend!”
Reviews.Author: bigtoeWales
Reviews.Content: Just returned from the Swiss hotel in Amsterdam from celebrating my 40th birthday and wedding anniversary. On arrival, we found the reception staff to be super friendly and helpful. They upgraded us to a suite which was a wonderful surprise, and after being in the room 10mins, pink bubbles turned up which was another wonderful surprise from them! Excellent hotel and very professional staff attending to your every need.nothing was to much trouble My husband and I are well travelled and this hotel truly knows how to look after you!! The rooms were spotless. Location is spot on, right in the middle of dam square with the trams just outside the front door. Well done to the swissotel for providing such wonderful service and high standards!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: jammiee
Reviews.Content: Don't think you could do any better as far as location was concerned, but they were under construction so it was up to what I would have expected from a Swissotel...they should have disclosed this when I made the reservation. That said the staff worked very hard to make sure our stay was as enjoyable as possible....and thx esp to a girl named Sylvana it was!

Reviews.Title: “Close to attractions, friendly staff, clean”
Reviews.Author: lauragp
Reviews.Content: Overall, great tourist hotel for seeing the city. It is right on the street tram lines, and within walking distance to many of the sights. The front desk staff was very friendly and helpful, and there are 3 computers in the business center. The room was simple and clean. If you are just looking for a home base for a couple of nights with easy access to the sights, this is a very good choice.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Stay. Value for money!!!”
Reviews.Author: AndresContreras
Reviews.Content: This hotel offers you precisely what you need. The best possible location- just in the main square of Amsterdam Dam Square- and a reasonable price. The service is very good. they welcome you very nicely and the rooms are quite spacious. I recoomend it 100 %. When we tavel again to Amsterdam, we will stay here for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: BrainDedNed
Reviews.Content: We stayed 2 nights at the Swissotel while were traveling around Europe for our honeymoon. The hotel is located smack dab in the heart of the city with views of the main square. If your taking the train into town from the airport, it's within walking distance from the main station if your young and dont mind a walk like me.. If your older, you might want to catch a cab from the airport or at least from the train station. The hotel is within walking distance to other public transportation if you want to leave this area of town. If your in Amseterdam to party and have enough scratch for a nice place, this is where you want to be. It's not in the red light / party zone, but just a few blocks away. The streets of Amsterdam are not the safest place to be after midnight, but the hotel kept the lobby doors locked at night and required a room key to enter. This is not a knock on the location, just the reality of Amsterdam.. Lots of shady people trying to sell you hard drugs are looming the city streets at night. The room itself was large for European standards and very clean. We had an amazing view of square and there were no complaints about the quality. When we travel we don't spend very much time in the room, so my reviews are normally based on location, safety and service. If there is something to complain about I will, but I'm not picky and this hotel more than met my standards. One warning.. We were told that the room included breakfast. We went to the establishment connected to the hotel for this breakfast. When we went to check out, we found out that the buffet was somehow not what was included and had a bill for 70 American Dollars. Yikes. If your an American traveler your going to despise the food in Amsterdam, so paying $70 for runny eggs and fruit was not pleasant. In short, be sure to ask where the complementary breakfast is so you do not repeat our mistake.

Reviews.Title: “I' ll be back!!”
Reviews.Author: eliakou
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is located at the very heart of Amsterdam, the ideal basis for visiting all parts of the city, as almost everything is within walking distance. Dam square is always crowded and you feel safe to come in and out any time of the night. The room was very comfortable and very clean, though quite smaller than the one shown on the photos (or maybe the bed was gigantic!). It was at the back, with no view at all but on the other hand we had a great night sleep because of the complete silence. The pillows were too soft for my taste, but of great quality, as was the mattress of the bed. There was some restoration undergoing in the public areas of the hotel, which didn't bother us at all. The nespresso machine was very convenient, we bought waffles and croissants from the nearby supermarket and had the best and cheapest breakfast. They did have an offer of 12 euros per person for breakfast (instead of 20) but Amsterdam is quite expensive and we preferred to spend the money elsewhere. The only problem that we had to deal with was that the business center was out of order and there was no free internet access anywhere in the hotel. Overall we had a good stay at Swissotel Amsterdam and I would recommend it both for the location and the quality of services.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel is well located and staff are efficient”
Reviews.Author: DohaRandP
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights in this hotel and found it convenient for the trams and walking around the city. The hotel staff were most obliging and efficiently liased for a fast recovery of lost luggage due to KLM inefficiency. Breakfast was buffet style and would satisfy most people. We were upgraded and the room was large with a comfortable bed and smart modern bathroom. All in all I would recommend this hotel as good value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Hel1982
Reviews.Content: I stay in this hotel regularly for business, and always find excellent service and spacious, comfortable rooms. Close to the train station and all major tourist attractions, but can be a bit noisy due to the proximity to the main street

Reviews.Title: “Super Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Colin F
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the hotel around 10 am after an international flight and they were more than happy to get us a room early! Located walking distance from the train station, as well as many attractions such as Anne Franks house and the Red Light District, we thought this hotel was great! The neighbourhood was safe as we arrived back at the hotel late at night. The only complaint I would have would be the noise from the renovations being done, but hey they will end sometime!

Reviews.Title: “Sorry but we'll not be back!”
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: We arrived and were given a room on the second floor. The corridor was like a building site! Sheets of plasterboard, paint tins, tubs of plaster and general trip hazards lay everywhere!! Only one lift operating and that was like a service lift. When we complained we were advised that the hotel was being renovated and we were moved to the 5th floor. Although this was a bit better the builders were using a foul smelling adhesive to line the hotel room doors. The room itself was ok but the sink was badly chipped and the walls were a bit battered. There were no towels, iron or ironing board; these had to be requested. The Hotel restaurant was not good, the service slow and unfriendly. The food was hit and miss, don't order the pasta as it was tasteless and my wife couldn't eat it. We only ate there once! On the plus side the reception staff were polite and as helpful as the circumstances allowed. Our main grumble was that had we known about the renovations at the time of booking we would have gone elsewhere. It may be better when everything is complete but I have severe reservations about the restaurant!!

Reviews.Title: “You can find as good but cheaper one”
Reviews.Author: skolo
Reviews.Content: Some good details about the hotel were mentioned already so I will mark my comments only pros: - great location , close to central station and dam square (as any other things to see in Amsterdam) - nice, clean and spacious room (standard option) - nice stuff, friendly people with quick response to any question - good breakfast, multiple choices, nice atmosphere, clean and tasty cons: - noise coming from outside - trams just under your window (if you pick wrong) - elevator and some walls in the building were like "under construction" time. scrached and dirty - price!!! come on! ~~260 euros with breakfast company special price? come on! I know Amsterdam is crowded and there is always not enough hotels but I live in Rotterdam and you can get a hotel room with half that price (+return train ticket to amsterdam) and its still less! - bad business center with only three computers with free internet access, very small room (printer included) in my opinion its overpriced

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Red_Sox_Lovers
Reviews.Content: Pros: - Perfect location next to Dam Square; easy 10 minute walk to Centraal Station - Excellent workout room with hand weights, two ellipticals and treadmill - Unsurpassed responsiveness/friendliness by knowledgeable staff (Rob at front desk provided superb assistance) - Good business center with three computers with free internet access; at least one was typically available - Rooms nicely decorated; bed comfortable; housekeeping immediately brought firm pillows and extra blanket upon request - Despite location next to Dam Square, room was quiet; heard no outside noise - Entire hotel impeccably clean - Apples, water with lime and orange juice always available for guests; fruit kabobs in room at check-in - Reasonable price - Currently being renovated; will be even better! Con: - Would have been nice if breakfast was included in room price, but even with additional cost, stay was good value

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, best location.”
Reviews.Author: Kamema
Reviews.Content: We picked this hotel because of it's location and we weren't disappointed. It was an easy walk from the railway station and anywhere else you wanted to go. There wasn't free wi fi in the room, which is quite poor for the cost of the room and the general areas are very shabby - they are working on these, but you do have to wonder how they let them get to that state. The room was fine, the location great so we were happy

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: travelingcats14
Reviews.Content: We had a 16 hour lay over between planes and decided to go into the city for the night. We booked at the Swissotel because we had stayed there several years ago and loved the place (also very close to train station). But this visit, we were disappointed. The elevator and halls were messy. I realize this is due to a remodeling but it seems that this hotel has been in a hall and elevator remodeling for a long time. Having read through some earlier comments, I thought the remodeling would be completed by now. We were given a much larger room than we had booked and we actually remembered the room from our prior stay. This time, however, the room looked seedy and very tired. There were no throw pillows on the sofa, minimal pictures on the wall, no niceties that seemed to have been there before. We actually agreed not to sit on the sofa as it just looked too tired (and perhaps not clean). The bathroom was clean with all amenities. Hate to give this place a less than good review but I really was expecting more. Hopefully the remodeling will take care of the tired look.

Reviews.Title: “Urgently requires renovation, but superb location”
Reviews.Author: thesheikhfromdubai
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 2 nights and found the hotel a but tired. Staff was great. Helpfull and very efficient, but there USP is there fantastic location. Right in the heart of Amsterdam and next to Madame T's museum. Very close to shopping,dining and the culture Amsterdam is famous for.

Reviews.Title: “The center of Dam”
Reviews.Author: JohnMalcomLondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed there only 1 night, like the place, like the room, like the people and really like the location, right in the center of Amsterdam with plenty of things to do.

Reviews.Title: “A little bit of Swtizerland, in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Beanbag109
Reviews.Content: How wounderful to see the Alpen horns outside for their 25th ann. I loved the professional staff and service. Reminds me of the time I spent in CH!

Reviews.Title: “Terrific hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ontheroadman
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed 5 nights at the Swissotel in Amsterdam. We really loved it. The rooms were very modern, clean, comfortable, well equipped and on the large side. Even by American standards they were fair sized. The staff at the front desk was continually cheerful, helpful and available, they were a real plus. Breakfast was excellent and reasonably priced. The exercise room had good equipment for a hotel, I was able to do a surprisingly large part of my normal gym routine. And the price was very reasonable. At the time, they were renovating the public areas, so part of it looked like a work in progress. Perhaps they lowered the rates a bit for that, altho it really didn't affect anything. The location is worth mentioning. It's right at Dam Square. This means it's very conveniently located and you have immediate access to the square and everything around it. It also means that it's pretty young, crowded, and back-packer oriented. The energy around it is pretty positive and happy, not threatening in any way, but if you're looking for a genteel or upscale environment, it's not that. Think of Times Square in NY.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, worth every dime!”
Reviews.Author: Giorno22
Reviews.Content: This a great hotel right in the epicenter of Amsterdam. I go to this hotel for two main reasons: the location and their very friendly and helpful staff. Me and my wife booked a premium room and upon check in received a free upgrade. The room was very clean, as well as the bathroom. Our room was also very spacious. We had a view overlooking Dam Square which was perfect. We had no problem with noise unlike other comments below. The hotel is also very close to the train station, different museums, department stores, shopping streets and so on. We will definitely visit the hotel again when we pass by Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Not up to other Swissotel standards..”
Reviews.Author: nubra
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 4 nights and must say it was rather disappointing.. Very drab and no character what so ever ! The corridors felt like one was walking past a prison cell! ..The breakfast was rather mediocre . They need to price up big time !!!

Reviews.Title: “Dependable hotel, good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: LeoIrakliotis
Reviews.Content: Located right on the Dam square this hotel offers some nice and quiet rooms -- try to get a room not overlooking the busy and noisy Damrak. The staff are friendly and helpful. The location is superb, an easy 10 minute walk from the central train station. Several tram lines stop outside the hotel and you can hop on any of them to explore the city. The rooms are spacious and clean, with comfortable beds. The hotel charges for internet access -- which at this day and age is kind of backwaterish. Guests have access to the business center on the 1st floor with 3 rather outdated slow PCs. That's not a problem as KPN, a Dutch telecom, has various WiFi hotspots through out the city and they offer 30 or 60 minutes per session free. I gave the hotel an "average" rating, because at this day and age only such hotel insist on charging for internet access. Otherwise this is a good hotel in Amsterdam, for the particular location.

Reviews.Title: “Surprised with the low quality!”
Reviews.Author: Saima11
Reviews.Content: I've always thought that Swissotels are fancy and something special than an average hotel stay. But I was quite disappointed that the room was small and really old-fashioned with fitted carpet and yellow curtains. Breakfast wasn't included in the price so I can't tell anything about that. There was a business room where you could use internet free of charge and the hotel's gym was quite new and nice. Location is excellent but it's not worth of the price what you have to pay for the rooms.

Reviews.Title: “third stay - just as good as the first”
Reviews.Author: TravellernotTourist7
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay in Amsterdam and at this hotel. Location is very central & easy to get to from the station. The staff are very friendly and helpful. On our arrival our request for a high floor was not available.The Duty Manager - Rueben - advised that the hotel was fully booked and we had been allocated a second floor room, but offered to move us the next day. While we were out, the staff moved our bags to an upgraded room and settled us into a new, higher floor. For Amsterdam, the room was large, light, and very comfortable and clean. Without a doubt we would recommend this hotel for it's convenient, central location, and high standard of service.

Reviews.Title: “Needs updating! I'd pass on our next visit.”
Reviews.Author: JayJayTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is an inexpensive hotel which is right in dam square. So it's a pretty convenient location to the different sections of amsterdam and close to central station. The hotel itself is pretty dated and worn out. They were doing repairs so loud that you couldn't even hear what the front desk person was saying and she was only about 3 feet away. The hotel seemed to be in repair. The carpets are worn and dark. The tiled stoned floors looks like they haven't been polished in years. Some walls have dirt marks on it and I once saw something on the floor in the elevator for about 15 hours before it was cleaned up. The hotel room, sheets, and bathroom are clean. But the carpets are worn to a point where a shampoo wouldn't do anything. Our glass side table had a chip in it. The doors were banged up and the television and fridge were pretty old. If you get a room in the back, you'll be facing H&M. So they're may not be much privacy if it matches their window. If you're looking for a clean cheap place in the center, this is a good place. But if you're looking for a newer hotel and you actually care what the common areas and room furnishings look like, I'd pick a different hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very mediocre”
Reviews.Author: ehny33
Reviews.Content: The location is ok being across from Dam Square and only 5-8 minutes walk to the main station. However the place is dated, the rooms are extremely small, the internet is expensive and the staff were generally not very helpful when it came to providing information about local stuff like restaurants and dry cleaning. Most annoyingly, our access card deactivated about 6 times over the course of three days which was very frustrating. The staff were unapologetic and kept blaming us for keeping the cards next to other cards or next to mobile phones - which we did not. There are plenty of much better places to stay in Amsterdam for the money.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Trompe_Le_Monde
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights and had a very enjoyable stay which was marked by excellent service from staff who really went out of the way to make your stay pleasant. I was very pleased to have my room upgraded and to receive some snacks and a small bottle of wine on arrival! The hotel is currently being renovated in the common areas but this was not an issue. The room was big and very lovely with a nice view - no issues with noise. The glass wall of the bathroom was a little weird, but the bathroom itself was great. Nice breakfast buffet in the morning and the location can not be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Liggy_99
Reviews.Content: The service at the hotel is very good, the staff were great always very attentive and friendly. The hotel was under renovation during my stay but I didn't have any problems with noise or with some protective tape on the elevator. The room was very spacious and I liked the decoration. The view was beautiful, I could see the Dam Square and the Bijenkorf (shopping mall). They have a coffee machine in their room which was really nice. The bathroom has a shower separated from the tub and it was all very clean. The bed was very confortable and even though my room faced the Dam I didn't think it was noisy or had trouble sleeping. The location was terrific, only a few minutes from the central station with many tram lines right across the street. Very close to shopping locations, deBijenkorf is across the street and also close to a few streets with shops like Damrak. On the street of the hotel there are a lot of options of restaurants and shops. What I liked best were the: 1- Location 2- View of the room 3- Staff What I liked least was that: 1- Breakfeast wasn't included in the price of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Avoid until renovations are finished”
Reviews.Author: ErwanLondon
Reviews.Content: This is a relatively noisy hotel as it faces a busy street. But the main problem is that the hotel is undergoing extensive renovations. I was woken up by builders drilling and hammering. I was planning to do some work in the morning but couldn't do so because of the noise. It was impossible to concentrate. I moved to the restaurant on the ground floor but this was equally noisy as they are also renovating around there. Room was nice and comfortable but I wouldn't stay again until the work is finished.

Reviews.Title: “Beware: hotel under renovation”
Reviews.Author: ChilliRod
Reviews.Content: The hotel is a solid C IMO. The location, albeit central is not really charming. Your next-door neighboors are McDs, BKs and money exchange stores. It is very central and roughly a 10 minute walk from Amsterdam Centraal. The Hotel looks old like the 80s. Bathrooms need serious renovation: my sink had 3 stain spots like it was used to light out cigarettes. Adding insult to injury, the hotel is undergoing heavy renovation. Elevator halls are filled with duct tape. I guess this should be mentioned when youÂ´re making reservations. Next time IÂ´ll try to stay in a hotel close to the Jordaan neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “very central location and good hotel but bring earplugs”
Reviews.Author: fluffybinks
Reviews.Content: I just spent 1 week in this hotel. Overall its a nice central location with trams connecting to anywhere in front of and behind the hotel. We were immediately upgraded to a larger room on check in, and this was a good size suite. The bathrooms are nice with both bathtub and seperate shower. There is a small nespresso machine in your room so you can make nice coffee. The breakfast is pretty good especially if you like the German kind of cheese, bread and hams/schinken etc but there is also fruit cereal eggs etc.... the service was freindly and great. Good price for the internet in your room. What I didnt like which makes me not want to stay again... The restaruant serves a terrible terrible meal in the eventing! Just awful preprepared stuff! The rooms facing the Dam are so noisy 24 hours a day, even with earplugs its a struggle to get to sleep, pity becuase i like the hotel otherwise.

Reviews.Title: “Nice looking suites, bad business ethics, moldy standard rooms”
Reviews.Author: hector077
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with my wife on our honeymoon. The first room we had had mold on the ceilings, especially in the bathroom, and was dirty overall. We decided to upgrade to the city view suite, which was very nice. Unfortunately, upon checkout, we found out that the staff had decided not to honor the 20% off deal that was going on at that time, despite the fact that we had stayed there over twice the amount of time required to qualify for it. Swissotel corporate also refused to do anything about it, instead suggesting we contact the hotel again (they did nothing). The suites here are great, as is the location of the hotel, but I think we'll be staying elsewhere on our next visit to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but quite noisy”
Reviews.Author: ECL100
Reviews.Content: This is a clean and friendly hotel, right in the middle of Amsterdam so it is a really busy area, and quite noisy at night,. We didn't find this a problem as the double glazing is good. Although it seems quite expensive, in comparison to other Amsterdam hotels, it is quite good value. Breakfast was plentiful with both hot and cold options, and served until 11am which is great if you don't want to get up early. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Just okay”
Reviews.Author: pinkpanther8
Reviews.Content: Booked a Business Advantage room which was smaller than expected based on the photo on their website. Very small/narrow passage way past the bathroom to the closet area which was cramped and dark. Everytime you opened the closet door it would hit the overhead lights which sometimes worked and sometimes didn't. We asked for a quiet room since there was elevator work going on and received a dark room whose view was an alley overlooking Burger King. The hallways are drab and dreary. We did like the location for sightseeing and the staff was polite and helpful. The bed was comfortable but very low. When we arrived by taxi from the airport, the driver was not able to drop us off directly in front of the hotel because cars are not allowed there, so we had to be dropped off across the street and pull our luggage across a main street and the tram tracks.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, best staff!!”
Reviews.Author: carsenault
Reviews.Content: Worth the visit. Good value for money. RIght downtown on Dam Square, Rooms are small (as they are all over Europe) but always clean and confortable. Staff here is the outstanding factor, most helpful I have ever encountered!

Reviews.Title: “Welcome Break”
Reviews.Author: JohnB076
Reviews.Content: Spent 4 nights at the hotel including 4th & 5th May when commemoration days were held in Dam Square. We had a junior suite overlooking Dam Square so had excellent views throughout. Despite what some have said about the Swissotel, we found our experience to be quite wonderful. All the staff, be they on the front desk or with the housekeeping team were pleasant, helpful and courteous. The suite we had was fantastic, lovely comfortable bed, well appointed bathroom, a pillow menu which was something we'd never come across before and best of all, the views of Dam Square. The Dam Plaza restaurant had some indifferent previous reviews but we found it to be a welcoming well run establishment. Plentiful breakfasts, helpful staff and on the 2 nights we ate there, faultless food and service. Some have complained about the pricing of breakfasts and food generally. You couldn't fault the amount of food on offer at breakfast and the cost of evening meals was no more than what we paid at other establishments on the other 2 nights. All in all we had a wonderful experience and look forward to returning to Amsterdam and certainly the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Staff at front desk as good as ever. Some building work”
Reviews.Author: tubbydammer
Reviews.Content: I stayed during a very busy week. Queen's Day was the day before I arrived and there were two major events in Dam Square during the week. Despite this, I think the staff were friendly and helpful as ever. My main issue with this stay was that the Internet access is very poorly configured. The first issue is that the system kicks you off at 5am. This means that if your laptop was open overnight, it will have a huge number of error messages about invalid certificates when you look at it in the morning.
