My other issue is that the network seems configured to block access to a lot of benign web sites. Frankly, hotels should not be monitoring my Internet usage and should certainly not block access to Internet locations unless required to do so by a court. None of the web sites I found blocked fell into that category. The network is run by GANAG and apparently GANAG is being replaced by The Cloud, according to the login page. Hopefully this will fix these two issues.

Reviews.Title: “So noisy...while very pleasant and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: drinkmilo
Reviews.Content: Ttrue the staff is very friendly and efficient, true the location is great, true the rooms are nice and comfy and well equipped...but is is so amazingly noisy (room 415 at least)...and housekeeping does not answer the phone...

Reviews.Title: “Was tricked by Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: negvon
Reviews.Content: We are very frequent travelers both for business and for pleasure, and we have seen everything, however, we were never felt as tricked as we feel right now in Swissotel Amsterdam, and hence we decided to write our first negative review ever. We booked a room for 4 nights, at the city-view, and received a rate of 203 EUR / night (after 15% discount of booking a 4-night stay). There was no mentioning that this is a minimum rate, no From..., etc. so obviously we assumed this is the average rate per night like in any hotel we ever booked in our lives. We finished the reservation and received confirmation email. The confirmation email has the different rates per night, but just after it mentioned the 15% discount - and the priced seemed reasonable after the 15% so it made sense. However - when we arrived to the hotel - they calculated when we checked in the total after taxes of 1100 EUR, and after we questioned it they showed us that 203 EUR / night is the MINIMUM rate - this 203 EUR / night is the only number they show during the reservation and even on the reservation summary this is the only rate shown. We have attempted to speak to general manager and deputy manager, but they both told us there is nothing we can do and that we should have checked more carefully the rates and all sort of stupid excuses... later when we spoke to our friends they mentioned this place is known to be a tourist trap and they are known for the way they trick tourists. BE WARNED.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location with Super Friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: FamilyGalOakPark
Reviews.Content: Just had to write this review. Stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam on Spring Break with my teenage children. Fabulous location - 10 steps from the Dam and all the action. Pick up the tram right outside the front door. The staff at the hotel (Rob at the front desk in particular) were FABULOUS. Helpful, pleasant, always remembered your name. What a great crew. The hotel had tickets to all the museums and perfect directions to everywhere we needed to go. I would recommend this to anyone wanting to stay in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, excellent service.”
Reviews.Author: iajsdg
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 5 nights. The hotel was in an excellent location, the hotel staff exceptional, special mention to Louise and Suflian who were always at hand to help us. One slight point but which did not affect our stay was that there was no wifi available free, free intetnet yes but computers were always in use. Thanks for a wondetful stay in amstetdam, will recommend this hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: irrene
Reviews.Content: we have just come back from amsterdam, and this hotel has been excellent, especially the reception staff, always on hand to help. special mention to Louise and Suflian for helping all the time and being so nice, excellent location, and safe.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location - Value for money”
Reviews.Author: Bengtib
Reviews.Content: Ultimo March me and a colleague was attending a conference held in Amsterdam (the West Indische Huis) with two nights at the Swissotel Amsterdam. As many of the reviewers mention the hotel is very centrally located just a stroll away from every sights and business locations - very nice. Upon arrival the front desk was very friendly, and the check is was smooth. As one of the prior reviwers just have mentioned (tails 009) currently the lifts are under maintenance/construction (which off course is very nice, since safety does come first) - however, if you stay at a high level floor it can take some time to get down when only one lift is in operation (I took the stairs once, however, this is not recommended if you are in bad health - luckily when you arrive in the lobby, there are fresh water :-)). As pointed out, the rooms were incredibly hot - and the A/C does not work (I guess it is seasonally adjusted) - however, it was furthermore not an option to open the window, since a very large and incredibly noizy fan was just outside the room at the ground level (I stayed in room 522). I can't imagine how noizy the fan must be for rooms closer to the fan. Otherwise, the rooms were very nice, clean and with good beds (and with my windows closed I could hardly hear the fan outside). The sleep quality, thus, was very good, except for one night were a maintenance guy was walking the halls around midnight or even later with a ladder. I don't know whether he was checking light bulbs or if he was somehow connected to the maintenance work, however, this was quiet annoying. Otherwise, I would strongly recommend this hotel to people who wants to stay in the central Amsterdam, with high quality service and a very nice breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable central location”
Reviews.Author: jayemtee
Reviews.Content: We arrived early for check in as we had arrived on the early morning ferry from Hull with coach to Amsterdam central station. After a short walk down Damrak we were given a friendly welcome from reception. Our room wasn't ready but there was no problem storing luggage whilst we went exploring our surroundings. When it was realised that it was my husbands birthday that day a small gift of wine and snacks was left in our room and our luggage taken to our room. Room 201 was spacious, clean and quiet. The view was of a central yard but had been decorated with plants. There is refurbishment going on around the hotel but it didn't affect our stay as work didn't begin until 8:00am. We had not booked breakfast but were given the offer of a reduced price when we checked in which we decided to use on our first morning out of curiosity and third and last morning for convenience. This is an area which could be much improved by a little better organisation. Dishes were not replenished at regular intervals, coffee (by the mug) was not brought until requested more than once and we were given the bill for signature before we had even been given coffee on the second visit (which was never signed but charged). As we sat eating breakfast on our second visit a young lady came from the hotel entrance, put 2 large bags down at the next table, helped herself to the buffet and ate it in her outdoor coat and walked out again without being challenged by any of the staff or asked for a signature. There was also a large influx of people came in off the street for some kind of refreshment which left residents with little or no service. The hotel is a comfortable central location but there are many other options for breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel but unfortunate timing”
Reviews.Author: tails009
Reviews.Content: As we were staying at the hotel for one night only on our trip home, I booked a Junior Suite. Upon arrival the front desk staff were very helpful - the room we should have been staying in wasn't ready as we were about an hour early but we were given another room on the top floor. It was obvious that there was building work going on, one of the lifts is out of order however, I wasn't notified of this prior to arrival which would have been nice. Having said that, I'm not against building work being carried out during the day (It does have to happen at some point after all), and I would still have kept my reservation. The room was very well presented (see pics on their website), lovely bathroom with glass sliding doors between it and the suite, the bed was enormous and extremely comfortable. Unfortunately there was also building work being carried out in a maintenance room next door to the suite (again this is just one of those things). Due to this, my partner and I decided to go out for a look around Amsterdam where we realised how excellent the location is. As noted in previous posts, the hotel is right in the middle of everything! On returning to the room, building work was done for the day and a selection of cheese, grapes and olives awaited us which was a very nice touch. After then going out to dinner we returned to find the room a little warm and so switched the air conditioning on before going to bed, however, around 03:00 woke up to find the room incredibly hot. On checking the air con, the fan seemed to be working but the thermostat did not? In the end we settled for opening the window which cooled the room down but due to the location was quite noisy so unfortunately from that point on we didn't get a lot of sleep. Unfortunately, the building work re-started again around 08:00 in the room next door with some kind of cutting taking place which filled the room with a burning smell. Since we were checking out, we checked out early and noted our concerns with regards the air conditioning and the burning smell to the front desk who assured us something would be done. (The burning smells lay solely with the builders rather than the hotel as I'm sure this kind of cutting requires proper ventilation to be conducted). In summary, I'd say that on most days, this hotel would be 5/5 as a lot of people have stated. Unfortunately, with the timing of our stay it not really possibly to do so. I would definitely recommend this hotel however, as all the positives by far outweigh the negatives.

Reviews.Title: “Value For Money”
Reviews.Author: lhreye
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located on Dam Square about a 10 minute stroll from the central train station. The rooms are large and comfortable with an excellent collection of bath products. The breakfast was nice and wholesome. There is lots to do around the hotel. So after a days work take a walk in one of the most beautiful cities of the world or if you happen to have a day free rent a bike from the hotel desk and explore Amsterdam on your own

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location for exploring Amsterdam with friendly, high quality service”
Reviews.Author: CarolineR22
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel Amsterdam is located right in the heart of Amsterdam and provided an excellent base for exploring the city and the surrounding areas. Just a couple of minutes walk from Central Station, beside Dam Square, the Royal Palace, many other sights, restaurants and bars. Warm friendly greeting on arrival and top class unobtrusive service for the duration. It was our 30th wedding anniversary during our stay and the management left us a complimentary bottle of bubbly, some snacks and a card to help us celebrate. It is the attention to detail that makes this hotel stand out from the rest. I would highly recommend it and would certainly use it again

Reviews.Title: “A great place to stay with outstanding customer service”
Reviews.Author: asif_moh
Reviews.Content: This hotel is my home away from home, I have spent 2 to 3 days a week staying here over the last year and I keep coming back. The facilities are good especially the gym room and the business room which are 24/7 and free of charge! The hotel is well located if you like being bang in the middle of the city, convenient for transport links and only 20 mins from the airport. Rooms are comfortable and clean with an iron & ironing table located in the room. Staff are friendly and always willing to help in anyway they can, when they know I am coming they even put fruit and complimentry snacks in my room, all in all a very satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location!!!”
Reviews.Author: dededa80
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located 10 minutes away from Central station. We arrived and literally walked over to our hotel. At first glance, it was right in the middle of Dam square and I thought that boy this is not a good sign. I was wrong. The staff was friendly, our rooms were spacious and they provide a free business center for internet usage. I am pretty happy that I chose this hotel. The location is fantastic, you can access to the rail, train, canal tours, bus tours, trams and almost every single mode of transportation you can think of in Amsterdam. I am a big fan of this hotel and would highly recommend it to anyone . I would definiteyl come back here again.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location and very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Melb-4
Reviews.Content: I arrived on train and walked the 10 minutes to the hotel. Given I arrived early the room wasn't ready but they happily looked after my luggage and provided me with a map and suggestions for things to do for the afternoon. Room service was very quick and the bar/restaurant downstairs are very good. The breakfast had everything one could want. During my stay there was only one lift working but this wasn't a big issue. The business centre offers free internet which worked well. The hotel is in an excellent location and was any easy walk to everything I needed. The museums are great and I spent most of my time wandering around and visiting them. If I didn't walk it was because I caught a tram which arrive at frequent intervals. The van Gogh and Rijks museums along with the Anne Frank museum are absolute must dos and are all easy to get to from the hote. All up a great stay and I would definitely select this hotel if I return to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal location, professional and helpful staff.”
Reviews.Author: paulas1001
Reviews.Content: I spent 3 nights at the Swissotel Amsterdam from 6th March to 8th March 2011. On arrival at the hotel we were presented with refreshing hot towels while the receptionist proceeded to check us in. The receptionist was particularly professional and helpful. He inquired if we had visited Amsterdam before and when we mentioned it was our first visit, he produced a map and some guidance to getting around the city which was very gratefully received. The location is ideal just on Dam Square with access to tram stops just outside and behind the hotel. The room I had reserved was a twin and was quite small but was adequate for our needs. The welcome snack of a fresh apple each left in the room was appreciated and was, in my opinion a defining touch as many hotels do not provide this level of thoughtfulness. The beds were incredibly soft and unfortuantely not to my companions taste as she prefers a harder mattress, but I found the mattress to be very nice. The pillows however are probably far to soft for my particular preference. The facilities provided are the usual, coffee and tea making, mini bar which was left empty for our personal use, which I prefer. The bathroom is fine, the shower pressure was perfect. However if I do have any negative criticisms it is of the restaurant attached to the hotel, which I am very aware is not affiliated to the hotel, but is over priced and incredibly disappointing in both service levels and quality of food served. We had the misfortune to go for breakfast there one morning and I regret it wholeheartedly. Inferior food, slow almost grudging service and the prices were astronomical for the rubbish we were served. My advice is to steer very well clear of the Dam Plaza Restaurant. Also on our way home on the last night we wanted a couple of bottles of water which cost â‚¬5.50 at the bar in the resturant. Absolutely incredible! My suggestion is for the hotel to provide a couple of bottles of drinking water for their guests - build it into the price of the room, but don't leave it for the guests to be ripped off in that restaurant, which its fair to say would colour any recommendations I would have to make about the Swissotel. Unfortunately there was some noise pollution in the form of drilling while the hotel renovates their new lift, but it wasn't unbearable. And be sure to put the do not disturn sign on the door, I forgot and the eager housekeeping staff entered the room while I was still in bed at 9.30am on Sunday morning! Its one way to get me up out of bed at least. Despite all of this, the staff were all very solicitous and clearly enjoy their jobs, that is the best advertisment a hotel can have.

Reviews.Title: “A very friendly and clean hotel in a perfect location.”
Reviews.Author: paud_2
Reviews.Content: Hot wet towels to freshen up on arrival at reception. The service here was next to none and the staff just were very accommodating and friendly. We had arrived 5 hours before check-in time but were able to get the paper work out of the way and free ourselves of our luggage. (This was also the case when checking out as we were able to leave our luggage in the hotel until we were to leave Amsterdam). Our room was massive with the most comfy super king-size bed. The en-suit bathroom really clean with a large bath and overhead shower and warm towels. Also in the room was a proper tea/coffee making machine, lots of storage space for clothes, etcetera and a secure safe which was free to use. The location of this hotel was perfect as it was only a 10 - 15 minute walk from central Station, and about the same to the heart of the red light area and coffee shops. A word of advise though, watch out for the cyclists and the trams when crossing the Damrac!! We would recommend this this hotel to anyone looking for a pleasant stay in a central location. Many thanks to the staff of the Swissotel, Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay there !!”
Reviews.Author: travelerIsrael
Reviews.Content: We stay there for 7 nights from 21.2.2011 , we have a prepaid voucher for a premium room . We get a very nice room on the first floor 109 . The problem is tha they built a new elevator and drill with a jackhammer in the lobby !! You can not immagine the noise in the room , we did not try to change the room because when we arrive they told us that this is the only room I can get. I FEEL THEY CHEAT ME BECAUSE THEY MUST WRITE IN THEIR WEB ABOUT THE NOISE , we could not go to another hotel because we paid for all the nights .

Reviews.Title: “At first glance NO! but how wrong was I - fantastic staff, rooms and area”
Reviews.Author: pamelapjp29
Reviews.Content: I would like to start this review by saying we was recommended several cheaper hotels but decided to pay a little more and how pleased we were. I traveled with my husband and another couple and on checking in at 11.30 our rooms were not ready until 2.00pm BUT they provided us with hot towel to refresh our hands and a secure room for our luggage but just after checking in one of the rooms were ready so we were able to leave our luggage and get changed in our friends room. The hotel reception and reception toilets were having some work done and at first i thought 'what have we come to' but the fact they had lovely fresh flowers everywhere must mean they are making the effort. we went in a lift that was very quick and into our friends room, the bed was awsome it was massive and very comfy, the room was very hot and clean, after messing with the air con we sorted the tempreture out. We set of on our travels and had an amazing time!! myself and husband returned back to the hotel to check into our room and due to delay they had upgraded us, we had a pillow menu, dressing gown, fully stocked mini bar - it was clean, warm and comfy, the bathroom was spotless, showere good and soft fresh towels. They offered us a reduced rate for breakfast, this was also very good, plenty of choice and eat and drink all you want which set us up for the day. We went to the sea palace and paid Â£200 for a meal that should have been Â£100. very over rated and would not go back to this. Over all i loved my time in Amsterdam, its VERY VERY expensive and very casual and ladies do not take heels. I normally dress up but here anything goes and the casual the better, the red light area is a must!! so are the coffee bars!! everyone is very helpful. The shopping and sightseeing is also great. All i can add is, go with an open mind, take plenty of money, dress comfy and stay at the Swissotel, the location is spot on and only a stone throw from all the action. enjoy your visit :)

Reviews.Title: “Central Charm”
Reviews.Author: minky35
Reviews.Content: A superb hotel right on Damrak overlooking Dam Square. You couldn't ask for a more central location. It's very busy out there on the street but once inside the hotel there is a pleasant and professional air of tranquility. Standard rooms are good with excellent storage and facilities. In this day and age a flat screen TV would have been nice as well as free wi-fi. The coffee making machine was a waste of time. I'd have preferred a kettle and coffee / tea bags etc not this fancy Nescafe machine that didn't work properly. The bed was massive and extremely comfortable but the huge soft pillows were just too soft and kept slipping over eachother during the night. Being on the 6th floor there was also noise from the plumbing system and air conditioning throughout the night. Not a problem if you roll in drunk but I wouldn't like it if I had work the next day. Overall, a good hotel and the â‚¬125 a night price was justified by the location but there are other hotels of a good standard in Amsterdam that I will check out in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FitzRoyLLC
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent ten days at this hotel, recommended by a friend. This was for a business trip combined with a few vacation days. Going to what matters the most, I have to say that all the personnel in the hotel was truly helpful, professional and friendly (can't ask for more). The room was unusually quiet, something very important to a light-sleeper like me. Also, the room was perfectly clean, every day Clearly this is a well-run hotel, so no doubt we are recommending it to friends and family.

Reviews.Title: “Exquisite home away from home”
Reviews.Author: grace2011
Reviews.Content: Location of this fabulous hotel is where one wants to be when visiting Amsterdam. Money's worth in the rooms you get - great fresh sheets, very white, fresh and clean towels in the bathroom, espresso maker (coffee, cream sugar and tea provided) is just to start the list..Now we get to the best service any hotel can provide in town - WOW - the concierge/ front desk is there 24hrs and service with a sincere smile -PRICELESS!! Now, shopping is just across the street (more like across the tram tracks) really. The Dam Square is a few steps away. The Madam Tussaud's wax museum is a few more steps away, literally. The Centraal Station is just 3 to 4 blocks..meaning walking distance to the Swissotel (can't beat that for convenience). There are small stores on or around the Damrak Street (frites, cafe, souveniers, photo opps) that will make your dining experience an adventure and memory of a lifetime. We got a room that gets just the right amount of sunlight in the morning yet it allows a nice nightime glow when it starts to get dark. Can you tell I loved the Swissotel, its location, comforts it provided and the stunning/stellar staff that made our stay in Amsterdam sweeter than any Belgian chocolate I ever tasted there. A shout out to Louise, Rob (2 of them), Cindy, Sylvanna, Lita and Grisel. We are coming back for sure...soon.

Reviews.Title: “very convenient for all purposes”
Reviews.Author: oldtraveller294003
Reviews.Content: Never seen so friendly staff as in this hotel.Also ,never used any mean of transport as the hotel was close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “disappointed, this is not the same standards of the others swissotels...”
Reviews.Author: FGobbo
Reviews.Content: I've booked this hotel when i was at the swissotel the bosphous, wich is really a top hotel!! i've stayed 5 nights in Istambul, and it was excellent, so i decided to book a hotel from the same group in amsterdam, but when i arrived i was disappointed cause this hotel is very inferior the swissotel standard , in fact this is more for a 3stars hotel. there is no place to stop taxis in front of the hotel, and i had to wait for almost 1 hour for my room, and it was around 4pm!! but i would recommend this hotel if you doesn't have too many expectations, the staff is friendly and the location is very good.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location, nice room”
Reviews.Author: nikbaz
Reviews.Content: Very helpful staff in the reception and nice clean room. The best of the hotel was the location of it (Dam square).I suggest the hotel, unless you want something more exclusive!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location on Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: GoodyRa
Reviews.Content: We were in Amsterdam for four days, we found this city very extravagant and extremely fascinating. We found a highly discounted rate of 40% for the Swissotel by prontohotel.com and have thus been able to book this very elegant hotel. The location is the best in Amsterdam, just a few meters from Dam Square and all the attractions of this wonderful city. We recommend this hotel to all those who want to be comfortable for sightseeing.

Reviews.Title: “Swiss Hit”
Reviews.Author: Jakeylad
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, lovely staff and the ajoining diner was great for a quick snack. The room card had to be used to access the lifts which made it more secure.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location & excellent standards”
Reviews.Author: fabiensf
Reviews.Content: stayed here for a weekend with a friend on my 2nd trip to amsterdam. The location is perfect, just off Dam square. We had asked for a quiet room and slept soundly thanks to the room being at the back of the building. The rooms are nicely decorated but could do with a bit of daily maintenance such as patching up black luggage marks off the wall. Otherwise everything we needed was provided for including a Nespresso machine for making coffee in the room. We bought some pastries from albert heijn next door & had breakfast in our room. Internet is available for free in the business centre, however you have to pay for WiFi. All the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. Our only setback was that they had run out of umbrellas to lend us when it was pouring outside.

Reviews.Title: “Prime Location”
Reviews.Author: starrynights
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 4 day break. Excellent location, easy to walk from Central Station and right next to Dam Square. All staff were very helpful and friendly especially our breakfast waiter Midal? Rooms were spacious and clean - we were on front of the hotel. Trams stopped right outside hotel but found it easy to get around on foot aswell. Would return again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Great location but not up to other Swissotel standards”
Reviews.Author: niknak1234
Reviews.Content: We've stayed in a number of other Swissotels (in Geneva and Zurich) and loved them. This one didn't live up to the standards of the others (possibly because its only 4 star?). As others have mentioned the hallways are exceedingly bland and utilitarian (definitely in need of a coat of paint and some sprucing up). The restaurant is exceedingly average and the service there substandard; getting the waiters attention at breakfast was difficult and the cups and plates dirty. The breakfast buffet itself was also average and even though we had it included in the price we decided to pay to eat elsewhere most of the time. The mini bar only contained water, 2 beers, a coke and a chocolate bar. To get any additional items required a trip to the first floor and the use of a vending machine. The room was clean and the bed comfortable. If you're looking just for a place to sleep in a good location; this is sufficient but if you're looking for any of the usual Swissotel polish I'd suggest going elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and great service!!”
Reviews.Author: susan19800508
Reviews.Content: I was here together with a friend for a few days and we had a wonderful time. The hotel has an excellent location and all of the staff were friendly and helpful. Our room was spacious and clean. When I come back to Amsterdam I will definitely stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location then very average”
Reviews.Author: NSmith1985
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a couple of nights. Great location - easy access to the main sites and the station with links to the airport. Once you get to the bedroom levels however it's grim. Bare white finished walls make the corridors appear more like a prison - devoid of any character. The room we had - with a lovely view straight into the fashion shop window opposite - a mere 4-5 metres away was also devoid of any ambiance. The wardrobe and desk areas looked like they had come in a self assembly pack. The TV went out with the ark. The walls were a little grubby. On the plus side very nice bed and quality bathroom. We had to ring housekeeping for coffee pods for the expresso machine - as none were provided on our arrival day. The hotel offers a range of pillows plus if you want them silk pillow slips - which is good given that housekeeping couldn't actually provide any of the latter. They didn't replace the shampoo either on the second day of our stay. Overall it was okay that's all and without the location it's nothing great .

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Moderate Amenities”
Reviews.Author: CML_2009
Reviews.Content: Location The hotel is centrally located meters from Dam Square, many restaurants and the Red Light District. The city's major attractions, i.e., the Van Gogh Museum, the Rijks Museum, the Van Gogh House, the Anne Frank House and Amsterdam Centre, are easily within a 10-15 minute walk along canals or shopping streets. Hotel The staff was friendly and eager to help. They were able to accommodate an early check-in (11:00 am) without additional fees and provided good dining advice. The hotel has a business center equipped with computers with internet access and a decent sized aerobics room. Room My wife and I stayed on the fifth floor facing away from Dam Square. Although the decor in the room was dated, it was comfortable and clean. The room was also very quite in the evening considering the proximity to Dam Square. Internet reception was reliable and the television offered several English/American news stations. I would reccommend this hotel to couples and business travelers alike.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Amsterdam hotel”
Reviews.Author: Buckslady13
Reviews.Content: Just spent a long snowy weekend in Amsterdam and after reading many reviews, stayed at the Swissotel. The location is excellent - looking at Dam square and is 5 mins walk from Central station. Reception staff were quick and helpful, the rooms were spotless and although not huge, had everything you needed, including a proper coffee machine! Bar staff were friendly infact, so was everyone from the cleaners to the Deputy Manager. Only thing that could be improved, the shower hose leaked so pressure wasn't huge. We had a room at the back of the hotel so no street noise but the air con can be a bit noisy so ear plugs an idea. I would happily recommend this hotel and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “Best Central Hotel in Amsterdam!”
Reviews.Author: Bluejayxxx
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this hotel 3 times now over the last 4 years and it never dissapoints! We always go for the junior suite and you get 5 star accomadation with Fantastic views.This time we got room 507, which is basically a Loft apartment! Loads of space,king size bed, massive flat screen and a fantastic glass fronted bathroom suite with jacuzzi bath and separate shower.We had a great view of Dam Sq and the bustling street below. I would reccomend always booking the junior suite, it's a bit extra but so worth it and has the WoW factor!!

Reviews.Title: “Way below Swissotel standard”
Reviews.Author: tjdnewyork
Reviews.Content: There's nothing horribly wrong with this place. It's clean. It's central. But if you are used to staying at other Swissotel properties, at least the ones I've stayed at, this place will definitely be a disappointment. It's really a severe stretch to call this a four star property. The hallways are shabby and the carpet seriously needs to be replaced. It's cleaned regularly but stained and nearly threadbare in places. The rooms are totally generic looking, almost hospital-like. Room size was good, though. The mattresses felt really bad, as if they had put some huge foam rubber on top of the mattress itself. Really cheap. There's really no lobby to speak of. The breakfast room doesn't allow hotel guests having their included breakfast to sit in the nicer area near the windows--that's only for paying customers off the street. The front desk staff knew pretty much nothing about the city. Upon arrival I asked about three different areas of Amsterdam and the front desk clerk pulled out a map, circled one small area and said "They're all right here." Wrong. They were also big on saying "I'm not sure, but you can google it" if they didn't know something, even something quite basic. They were, however, polite. The attitude seemed to be that providing good information about the city isn't their job.I don't think there is a concierge or if there was I wasn't able to find him/her. The location is very very central but be warned: this is the most extremely touristy part of town and you will have to go elsewhere to find restaurants or bars that are not exclusively catering to mostly foreign tourists . Think Times Square. I'm not going back.

Reviews.Title: “Professional staff and excellent location”
Reviews.Author: carole088
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a weekend at the Swissotel to celebrate our friends and our own wedding anniversary. The check in was quick and easy even though all our rooms were not ready,(early arrival) we were able to leave our luggage secure with the hotel. The rooms were very clean and spacious with a lovely king size bed, we were also very pleasantly surprised to find complimentary wine , nibbles and a lovely card in our room. The staff were very professional and nothing was too much trouble for them. The location was excellent right in the middle of Dam Square. I would higly recommend this hotel to anyone staying in Amsterdam. We have been to Amsterdam quite a few times and this is the best hotel we have stayed in. We are already looking forward to going back there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fine but felt it was too expensive for what it was”
Reviews.Author: TippMunster_Ireland
Reviews.Content: Generally fine with good professional staff. Obviously it has a fanatstic location right in Dam Square. Had checked prices online and they were more expensive when we went in. To be honest we were so desperate to get out of where we were(get lucky guesthouse/bedandnet.com) we just picked the first clean, comfortable hotel we could find. Rooms were clean and comfortable with nice bathroom (couldn't get heated towel rail to work though) and really deep bath. Bed was really comfortable and big. Don't think I could justify â‚¬219 a night with no breakfast though. Bit OTT

Reviews.Title: “Good if you want to be in the Heart of the City”
Reviews.Author: paulio
Reviews.Content: On check in we were greeted by a member of staff who checked us in and provided awet paper towel to freshen up. Our room was on the top floor (6th) not much of a view from the window, just roofs and the church in the back ground, i would imagine this would be quieter than overlooking the square. The Room was quite compact and so was the bathroom, otherwise clean & comfortable. A large King sized bed fills most of the room, looked like 2 twin bed bases with a king matress on top, my partner commented that herside of the mattress sloped, sure a few weeks of dieting would sort that out! There is a coffee machine in the room and mini bar which has a few things in but enough room to fill with your own drinks/beer if desired. One thing i did notice was the walls seemed quite thin as you could here the next rooms phone and the people talking. Maybe a problem for light sleepers like myself. The Trams stop right outside the hotel to take you to the station or other parts of the town, walking to the station is a leisurely 15mins or so.

Reviews.Title: “High standard of comfort and service in all areas”
Reviews.Author: mahylaes
Reviews.Content: A very good room, clean comfortable with an excellent view. High standard of furnishings and facilities. Very pleasant and friendly staff. A very enjoyable experience. Very good food.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Friendly Staff”
Reviews.Author: rnuge10
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from a 3 night stay at the Swissotel and loved it. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary, which they thoughtfully acknowledged with a card and fresh fruit. The room was large, quiet and spotless. The hotel is in a great location, central to many things. The staff, Lex in particular, was very friendly and gave us several great restaurant recommendations. This hotel was a great value!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, pity about the lacklustre management response to their cock up”
Reviews.Author: MRDIITD5
Reviews.Content: Arrived at this hotel at around 1pm to find the room not ready and that there was a problem with my girlfriends card which she had booked the room with. The problem was rectified and we were advised to go for a coffee whilst the room was made ready. On our return we were told that a hold of 500 euros had been put on my girlfriends card. This hadn't been authorised by my girlfriend and we said that we would use my credit card for payment rather than her current account. We were told that the hold on her account would take a day or so to be lifted. Five days later and my girlfriend cannot access the funds in her account due to Swissotels incompetence. When we brought the fact that my girlfriends account was still showing the hold of 500 euros we were met with indifference. My credit card had a 900 euro hold put on it as well. That makes 1400 euros of our money we couldn't use but was told this is what they do. What happens to the interest on the monies that they put a hold on?? My girlfriend has stayed here 8 times previously due to its good location. However we won't be staying there again. There are several other hotels which are better value with an equally good location. Personally I feel that 750 euros for 3 nights accomodation in a small room is nothing more than robbery, something the Swissotel seem accomplished at

Reviews.Title: “Just returned from a weekend stay...”
Reviews.Author: JeneferAH
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a weekend stay, disappointed that they 'held' 500 euros of my money from me in my current account without my prior consent! Left me a little restricted for spending money as my partner was going to pay the bill on checkout. The most unfortunate thing of all is that when we complained about this it fell on deaf ears. I have stayed here around 8 times over the past 6 years, mainly due to it's location. They do have a few nice rooms but I'm not sure how they decide who get them. I will not be returning and having looked there are cheaper, better quality hotels with good locations

Reviews.Title: “Top location if you want to be in the heart of it all”
Reviews.Author: PerthLaura
Reviews.Content: Loved Swissotel for it's location, we looked out onto Dam Square itself....room was squeaky clean and the bed and bathroom was huge....expect a little noise from the street, you can't be in the heart of things and not have some noise but it was so good because we were able to just keep popping into our hotel between activities to freshen up and drop stuff off etc..were able to walk everywhere, like Anne Frank House, the Red Light District and the canals.

Reviews.Title: “Convenient and centrally located”
Reviews.Author: Hagenger
Reviews.Content: Modern and clean room. And the best, a Nespresso machine in the room. Tip: Order breakfast in advance and save 8 euro. Within short walking distance to central station. I had a quiet room facing a side street of Damrak. Not sure if every room is quiet, since the hotel is facing Dam Place. Friendly staff and very good breakfast. The LAN connection in my room didn't work though. And a softer pillow would be grateful. All in all, nothing much to complain about.

Reviews.Title: “The location of this hotel is excellent...”
Reviews.Author: magellan74
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is excellent, although it can be quite busy directly outside the hotel during the day. The staff is friendly, helpful and patient. The room was clean, pleasant, but nothing spectacular. Comfortable bed. My only complaint is that the hotel should offer free WiFi. It was the only hotel on my trip to the Netherlands and Belgium that did not and it was rather expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding”
Reviews.Author: regahmn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the hotel was wonderful. The staff was attentive, kind, and spoke English very well. The restaurant and bar were really nice, and the room was clean and spacious. We loved it and will strongly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but beware of what room you get”
Reviews.Author: elviatger
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for its location in the town center and close (10 minutes walking) to the railway station for day trips to other cities. It is also close to the unpleasant (for us) atmosphere of the Damrak and surrounding area, but being at the Dam end of the street you can easily avoid it except to get to/from the train station. The hotel has some nice features like a Nespresso coffee machine in the room with 2 free daily doses, a free Internet access center with 3 terminals (WiFi at extra cost), and specially the fact that the restaurant is a regular street one. i.e. with "street" prices instead of "hotel" prices. On the minus side I would mention the needlessly enormous bed that occupied too much room space, the too narrow bathtub and specially its very high edge that makes really difficult (and even dangerous for short or aged people) to get in and out. But the main disappointment was that our "classic" room was too far from what you can see in the hotel web site: the window was very small and placed in a recessed corner, opening to an also recessed corner at the very bottom of an inner courtyard, so we didn't have any day light at all: we were forced to permanently have the lights on, so after a couple of days we already felt really claustrophobic, but a comment to reception got only a "yes, I understand" and a "I'm really sorry" very polite answer. If I were the hotel manager I would make sure that guests staying 9 nights at my hotel don't get such a cave... All in all, a good hotel, but only if you manage to get a regular room :-(

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: LinLin28
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated right next to the Dam Square, overlooking some of the square and the Damrak street. Everything we wanted to accomplish on a weekend away in Amsterdam was made possible by the Location of Swissotel Amsterdam. Everything was within walking distance: Museums such as the Anne Frank House, the Red Light district, the shops, restaurants and cafes, etc... Aside from the great location, the staff really stood out.. from the reservations stage to the time we checked out, the staff were very attentive and courteous. The concierge in particular was great; he took the time to map out every must-see in the city. All his suggestions were exactly what we were looking for during our short time in the city. The room itself was very comfortable, with a nice view of the busy Dam Square. I loved the Nespresso Machine with the complimentary coffee pads! The only slight disappointment of the hotel was the restaurant. The food has a good for the price, but the atmosphere and interior could have been better. I'll definitely stay at the Swissotel again when I'm back in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and even better Staff”
Reviews.Author: jftoronto
Reviews.Content: I just returned from a week long stay at Swissotel. The staff are all very friendly and go out of their way to make sure your stay is pleasant. Special thanks to Luigi for trying to help my girls with internet access. You can't beat Swissotel for location. It is a five minute walk to the tour operators and canal boats. There is a grocery store, currency exchange and several restaurants are close by so your choices for dining out are many and varied. I have read complaints about noise, lighting, room size, housekeeping and would like to say that I found the room to be of good size. I was there World Cup weekend and it was loud when you opened the window, but, when the window was closed and the draperies drawn, the room was fairly quiet and no night time light creeps in. You will hear the tram bells if you face the front of the hotel but you get used to it. Housekeeping makes the rounds early so make sure you put out your do no disturb sign and you will be fine. The housekeeping staff is very helpful and always provided us with extra coffee pods etc. when we asked. We had a connecting room with our daughters and it worked out very well. My husband made use of the fitness facility and was satisfied with the equipment, space and 24 hour availablity. We made use of the business centre and found the internet connection quite quick. I would stay here again. I was happy with the fact that you need a room key to access the elevator. I also witnessed staff not allowing visitors to the rooms until it was confirmed that they were expected. Very secure facility. Just ask for what you need and you will find the staff more than willing to get it for you.

Reviews.Title: “This is excellent!”
Reviews.Author: zonnenberg1
Reviews.Content: Arrived late and my welcome was super! The hotel is centrally located and the rooms are really spacious for European understanding. My company arranged it but I will for sure come back here. Thanks to the super attentive team! Well done!

Reviews.Title: “Quite impressed”
Reviews.Author: santos1977
Reviews.Content: Staying in Swissotel as we speak and I must admit itâ€™s quite good. A little disappointed at first cuz Iâ€™d been staying in swissotels in the Far East and Turkey before and theyâ€™re pretty large and upscale.The Amsterdam property looks more like a guest house. Nothing wrong with it though. Staff is very adequate and friendly. My room is not huge (again not as big as its Asian peers, but hey, this is medieval Europe). Itâ€™s obviously been refurbished only recently. Nice decorum. Very clean, that is till we took over. Itâ€™s been bloody hot in Amsterdam over the weekend so thank God for the airco. Need to keep the windows shut to make it work though, but frankly keeping the windows open isnâ€™t really an option in this part of town; you canâ€™t get more downtown than this. Thereâ€™s a constant rush hour going on outside, although it gets less noisy after 11pm. Could go for a room at the back of the hotel of course but then youâ€™d miss the view, which is really amazing. Actually the roomâ€™s pretty quiet with the windows shut. To say the hotelâ€™s in a good location would be an understatement. This is A+ prime spot weâ€™re talking about, right at Dam Square, which is the Amsterdam equivalent to, well letâ€™s say Time Square or Piccadilly Circus. Kinda expected internet to be included in the rate these days but it certainly isnâ€™t. Thereâ€™s a business centre offering free internet access, so thatâ€™s where Iâ€™m now. Didnâ€™t bring my notebook anyway so this is actually even better. Thereâ€™s a gym next to the business centre, which is quite large given the size of the hotel. Not planning to use it though; Iâ€™m on holiday! Breakfast is okay but at 20 Euro a little expensive to my opinion. Thereâ€™s like a breakfast eatery on every street corner in this part of town offering far better deals. Sometimes itâ€™s hard to tell why you like a hotel. Thereâ€™s really nothing spectacular about this place. Still when you enter the building everything feels right. Kudos to the people at reception, they certainly added zest to our stay. I was quite impressed that after only one day every one of them addressed me by my correct name, which is one of those overblown Spanish triple surnames. This may appear as a minor detail, but itâ€™s not. It indicates professionalism, which is a rare phenomenon among hotel staff these days.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: Ann1978
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed in the Swissotel for 3 nights. Everything you need for a leisure trip is here. The hotel is very centrally located. It's like a fifteen minute walk to Anne Frank House. Trams stop right in front of the hotel and go directly to Rijksmuseum and Van Gogh Museum in only 10 minutes. Staff was very friendly and helpful. The room we had was very spacious and facing the shopping street at the backside of the hotel. We were welcomed with a small bottle of wine and cheese platter. We want to return to Amsterdam on a yearly basis and I will certainly stay at SwissÃ´tel Amsterdam again.

Reviews.Title: “Typical city hotel”
Reviews.Author: Pixie1979
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Amsterdam is located in the heart of the city, so if you're looking for a place in the middle of the hustle and bustle, this is the place for you. All the main attractions in Amsterdam are within walking distance from the hotel, which is often a good thing but if you intend to wake up late in the mornings, forget it, it's impossible to sleep in your room after 8 a.m. because of all the noise coming from the streets. Especially at the time of the holidays, the noise will drive you insane. The hotel is an average city hotel, nothing special about it. The rooms are ok and the staff was generally helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely & cozy”
Reviews.Author: AnonymusLondon
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel because of its great location. Taxis are rather expensive in Amsterdam and I did not want to risk getting lost on trams, since I was there on business and on a tight schedule. I had a nice room, overlooking Dam Square. The hotel is clean, well kept and the staff is really friendly. The only criticism is that the restaurant does not have a great selection of vegetarian dishes. On the other hand, their concierge recommended a really nice suitable Italian restaurant nearby, which more than made up for it. All in all, I found this to be a really nice 4* star hotel, with a great location, clean functional rooms, and a rather cozy atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable stay!”
Reviews.Author: travel_diva_4126
Reviews.Content: My husband, toddler (2 years old) and I had a wonderful stay at the Swissotel Amsterdam from May 21-24, 2010. From the moment we checked in to the point we checked out, everything was perfect. The location is unbeatable and all the staff were knowledgeble, friendly and full of friendly advice. True, the rooms were not very big, and the double bed had two mattresses pushed together, but that is common for Europe, so one cannot judge against that. The hotel was within walking distance to most tourist destinations, and we appreciated the central location in relation to the train station (an easy commute from the airport, even with a toddler, large suitcase and stroller). The central location also made it easy to make short stops through the day for the little one to rest (and enjoy the ice cream from McDonald's next door!). The cold juice and water in the lobby were a nice treat too! We can only say that our experience with Swissotels globally has always been positive, and we can always depend on the Swissotel quality. We have no doubt we will stay here again during future visits and look forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: JackyFlower
Reviews.Content: I spent three days on business in Amsterdam and I can only conclude that this is a great hotel with superb staff. The only disadvantage I can think of is that this hotel does not have its own parking space. However the concierge recommended the parking across the street, which worked fine (but expensive). Nevertheless very satisfied, and I will surely come back here either for business or on a city trip.

Reviews.Title: “A bit rundown”
Reviews.Author: seismik
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam is a tough place to find a good hotel at a reasonable price. Swissotel seemed good and based on the reviews and photos I'd seen before I went, I hoped for better. The location is excellent, just off Dam Square and an easy walk to the sites, and you're right in the middle of the action in Amsterdam. The staff was friendly and professional. The rooms were rather dated and shabby and the whole floor seemed a bit rundown. In contrast to the lobby which is shiny and polished, the rooms are dull and boring. It was clean and quiet but pretty basic accomodation, and for the price (160 euros/night) I expected more.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Location, but this is 3*”
Reviews.Author: Nodnoltravel
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a brilliant location, as Amsterdam is a fairly compact city you are able to walk everywhere. If arriving by train at the central station, the hotel is a 10-minute walk away. The museums and Anne Frankâ€™s house etc are within easy walking distance of about 15 or alternately get a tram from outside the hotel. The area is very busy, but noise is not a factor, with windows closed and the air con in use. The use of the internet is free to all guests. The buffet breakfast is priced at a STAGGERING â‚¬20, (Â£16), each, per day ! ! ! This explained why it was very empty. It is far better to find a local place that has a sensible pricing policy ! ! ! The staff are pleasant overall, except ROBERT VAN HENEKE, who gave the impression that you were bothering him with your questions ! ! I thought that was his job ! The hotel is three star premises, despite its 4* claim. The rooms are roomy and adequate, except for the coffee stains that covered two of the walls. In addition to coffee, tea-making facilities, there is a small fridge also. The bedding seem a little two small for the bed and kept slipping off whilst you slept. I would recommend this hotel to all travellers, but DO NOT buy the extortionate breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Good and bad - but staff are wonderful.”
Reviews.Author: Writerincognito
Reviews.Content: This is a mix of good and bad - it depends what you're looking for in a hotel, I guess! We had warm, personal and super-efficient service from all of the front desk staff, which made us less likely to notice other things that would otherwise annoy us! Nothing was too much trouble, and they recommended a fantastic restaurant to eat rijstafel, which was probably an unusual request. I heard there was valet parking, but actually, it is done by an outside agency - the front desk staff call a guy who turns up and takes your car, parking it 7km out of the city. It is certainly cheaper than the parking across the road (50 euros a day, anyone?) but with pick-up fees, special fees, etc, it was still a fair whack. I would recommend unloading your luggage nearby and then parking it round the corner elsewhere instead - we saw parking fees in the 20s per day round the neighbourhood. The hotel itself is in an unbeatable location. It's clean enough, it has snack machines rather than a minibar which works out well on the budget side of things, it has a restaurant and room service available, it does the job. On the negative side, the bed had a plastic sheet or something straight underneath the normal sheet, which sounded plasticky and didn't make for a good night's sleep - it left a bad impression on me, I have to say. Also, a couple of lightbulbs were out, although equally we were too busy to report them. The staff in the restaurant downstairs couldn't have been less interested, which was a contrast to the hotel staff. We were happy considering the good price we got through the 30% off Swissotel website deal, and the location and front desk staff are a strong reason to stay again, but as I said, it's a mixed one.

Reviews.Title: “Very average.”
Reviews.Author: Baldrian
Reviews.Content: Me and a friend stayed at Swissotel, Amsterdam during a long weekend in May. We took advantage of their 30% offer for celebrating their 30 years jubilee. I'm glad we did not have to pay full price, because this was disappointing and not what I'm used to from Swissotel. I'm aware that this is a 4 star hotel, but even tough we found it just on the average of what to expect.

Reviews.Title: “Location location location!”
Reviews.Author: simpie
Reviews.Content: This hotel is the best located ever! Right in the middle of everything that is Amsterdam! Everything was withing walking distance or reachable per tram that had a stop right in front of the hotel. The central train station was 5 mins walk from the hotel and from there the entire country was within a 2 hr train ride. The room was spacious (we had a corner suite) and clean. The only staff we saw was the front desk staff and they were pleasant and their English was perfect. The told us all about the places to see.

Reviews.Title: “Location is ideal and rooms are ok”
Reviews.Author: nyujay2010
Reviews.Content: The location is pretty amazing - tram right in front of hotel, train station about a 10 minute walk away, red light district about 10 minute walk, museums 10 minutes away on tram. The room size was typical European - small and somewhat tight but I'd say it was clean and not too old looking. All in all, a good experience that permitted a great holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Looks better on photo than in real life”
Reviews.Author: rapture_23
Reviews.Content: My room was dirty, the sheets not changed, the breakfast was gross. The maid basically kicked me out of my room because she was in a hurry to clean. Not worth the 240 dollars. The only good thing about it is the location (central) and the friendly staff :) :)

Reviews.Title: “Great spot, just noisy!”
Reviews.Author: welovequeenstown
Reviews.Content: Great spot, but very noisy. We were only on the 3rd floor and felt like we were sleeping in the street. Great if you like feeling part of things and like night life. The hotel itself is in a great position, close to everything. Not really a stones throw from the train station as their website suggests. It is quite a walk with heavy luggage. The trams run straight by, so it is very noisy. There are also very bright lights just outside the windows so it would be very hard to sleep here without a mask and eye plugs. I did like the atmosphere though, and it felt great, drawing open the curtains and watching the city go by. Great restaurants nearby and lots of night life. I would probably stay here again but will remember the ear plugs!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place!”
Reviews.Author: MaximillianAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam for 3 nights in March. The hotel is located at Damsquare, next to the Royal Palace. Central station and the mainshoppingstreets as well as the Red Light District are just a few steps away. ThereÂ´s a tramstop in front of the hotel with connection to all the major lines and stations. The area around the Dam is touristy, you have to keep that in mind, if you like a more quiet area without noise at night I would go for a hotel in the Southpart or near Museumsquare. The hotelrooms are good size with a comfortable bed with lotÂ´s of pillows. The rooms are equipt with a large desk, a deskchair and a comfortable chair. The bathroom is average but there are large fluffy towels. At some points you can see that many people have slept in the hotel before, stains on the carpet, mold in the bathroom etc, but it doesnÂ´t look decrepid. On the first floor you can find a gym and a businesscenter with free internet and printoptions. At my first night there was a couple in the room next to mine , that were having very very loud intercourse with an open window. Fortunately the staff fixed the problem by asking them to shut up. If the couple from 329 reads this, I do hope that the both of you catched a nasty cold! Overall a good place to stay, excellent location and good rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Didnâ€™t meet expectations, but ok for a weekend trip”
Reviews.Author: juliet298
Reviews.Content: You couldnâ€™t wish for a better location. The hotel seemed very nice, however when we entered the room it was a bit disappointing. Although everything was fairly clean, decor was very tired and desperately needed some work. Air conditioning didnâ€™t work properly, so both nights were a bit restless because there was too warm and not much ventilation. View from our standard room was non-existent, all we could see is another 3 walls 1-2 metres away and a big air conditioning unit. Despite all of this, Iâ€™ve seen worse before, so overall hotel was ok. It wasnâ€™t exciting and didnâ€™t meet my expectations at all considering all the good reviews I read before, but neither did it ruin my holiday and was ok for a weekend trip. Although, I would not recommend it to a friend.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: Finncitytravellers
Reviews.Content: We just arrived from Amsterdam and Swissotel. If we ever go to Amsterdam again, we choose this hotel again with pleasure. Unfortunately there was a lot of noise during night time. There was some construction work on street, but this wasn't hotels fault. The service was excellent. Every staff member we met was so polite and helpful. Location... it couldn't be better. The hotel was very clean and the rooms are really cosy(we stayed at classic and junior suite 2+2 nights). We would definitely recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “4 Star Fawlty Towers”
Reviews.Author: Derrybhoy
Reviews.Content: There are positives about this hotel the primary one is location. Very central or within a short walk (10-15mins) of most other places of interest. There are regular trams that stop nearby. The reception and welcome was fine. Then the problems started. I had booked a twin room - the room was intimate (small) - 121. You could not open the bathroom door if the room door was open or if anybody was standing at the door: I was away with a group of friends. The twin beds were joined together so we had to do a bit of re-arranging the furniture to separate the beds and relocate the night stand. The floor underneath the bed was ffilthy. The view was of a side wall of another building maybe about 5-6 away. The room was dark. We unpacked and then met up with one of our group who said our room was like a suite compared to their "shoe box". His room was even smaller (128). The three of us decided to go to the bar for a drink: we ordered 3 large Heineken beers and they were delivered promptly together with a bowl of nuts. We joked about the size of the rooms then we saw the mice. YES the mice. Two of them joyfully playing running around under the table about 15 feet away. This was in the bar/breakfast /dining area:beside the kitchen. I reported it. Oh my God. The Dutch may be laid back but they were not too fussed about these rodents. Eventually a bar man went into the kitchen and came out wearing gloves and looked around the area that I had pointed out. The beer was quickly finished and we left. No explanation no comment no report. It struck me that we may not have been the first to report this. Our deal did not include breakfast so we did not go back to this area. We did not have another drink in the hotel. The room was quiet because it was not to the front of the hotel but was very warm so we opened the window which allowed every noise in. The bed was comfortable and I slept well both nights though the noise from the alleyway to the side iwas intrusive . The hotel does not have free wif-fi access but 2hr can be bought for 6 euro:it must however be used up all at the same time. The gym was good as was the business centre.The check-out was ok. the room cost Â£132per night there is definitely better facilities and value elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable hotel in a Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Mateo303
Reviews.Content: This was the perfect hotel for a stay downtown. It is right in the middle of everything going on and close to the red light district. It was also easy to get to and from the hotel by tram from the train station. My room was small but typical for Europe. The decor was nice and the room was a perfect tranquil break from the chaos outside. The front desk staff was increbily helpful and friendly. I had an issue with my power converter and they went out of their way to help me find one that belonged to the hotel that I could use. If you are looking for a comfortable hotel in the middle of everything this would be a perfect option.

Reviews.Title: “Good location but not so good product & service”
Reviews.Author: diminlondon
Reviews.Content: Despite its great location hotel did not offer anything remarkable. It was below standards and definitely far below my expectations as far as the service and the cleanliness of the room was concerned. Being given a room where it was overlooking the busiest street and the noisiest tram station ever possible despite being arrived quite late at night for one night stay wasnt really clever, we couldnt sleep at all.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: MorgansBlackpool
Reviews.Content: This was our first time in Amsterdam and we were delighted that we chose Swissotel. We cannot praise your staff high enough for our stay. From the moment we arrived and met Diego at front desk we were given all the advice and help we asked for and in a caring and professional manner. The hotel is ideally situated right in Dam square and is very close to the station and canals. Our room was perfect and the standard of cleanliness was very high. We own a hotel ourselves in England and we are very aware of standards (and the fact that you can't please everyone all the time!). We are both looking forward to our next visit already. A special mention to Luigi (concierge) who was so helpful to us and is a perfect representative for the hotel. Thanks Luigi and thank you Swissotel. Mark and Kim.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed service with problematic rooms.”
Reviews.Author: rowaninx
Reviews.Content: I returned last week from the Swissotel in Amsterdam. Whilst I did feel that in general the staff tried to be polite and said the right things - they were less than adequate when things went wrong - polite but totally unhelpful. I arrived in the evening and was put in a room that was incredibly noisy on the 1st floor. It was also extremely hot even though the windows were open (the heating system seems to be faulty in some rooms) - I had to close the window because of the street noise, and went immediately to ask reception for another room due to the noise. They said they were full - I went back to the interenet and tried to book another room of the same price - there was availability - at the least, they had nicer rooms available I discovered the next day. That night I struggled to sleep between the noise and the heat - I used earplugs. The next night the heat was so bad, and I could not open the windows. The air conditioning was broken - they must have known this which is why the windows were open when I arrived. So I was in an incredibly loud room (on the street), with a faulty heating system that just kept heating it to get hotter and hotter. I called an attendant just before 6am to try and sort it - he said there seemed to be a problem with 3 other rooms - this was the 4th now - (I later discovered there were more). There was nothing he could do but bring me a ridiculously large and roaring fan that was worse than the noise outside. He said to speak to the manager the next day. I finally fell asleep at around 6.30am and woke at 11. I spoke to the manager. She was polite but offered no compensation for my two nights of poor sleep. No upgrade, no free breakfast (after I slept through breakfast), just a half bottle of wine and some chips appeared in my room I noticed. She simply moved me to another room and checked that I was okay with it. I said yes - it was the same size - facing a brick wall. I opened the window, this time to be greeted to the noise of a loud boiler, and guess what, the air conditioning in this room wasn't working either - it boiled up. I only had one more night so grinned and beared it. The room service food was very average for the price (though not extotionate) - the pasta was poor, the sirloin adequate though a little burnt for medium rare - the portions were always too small though. The worst was when I phoned during the night menu and got through to reception (who double as room service it seems) to be told there was no ice cream left- so I had a cup of soup - he seemed a little curt that I had asked for food past 22:30 at night (though the late night menu is on display). I only did this because my original meal was not big enough - and I am not a big eater. The location is excellent and so is the business centre. The staff are generally very pleasant - but alas my stay here was unpleasant due to the faulty heating systems and noise of the hotel. This could have been amended with some sort of compensation or sincere apology - neither came (nor was asked for) - I have a slight gut instinct with this, perhaps I'm wrong, but I do not think this hotel cared too much for me because I am in my mid twenties - maybe if I was older with a family - they would have compensated or done something to make up for putting me in a totally uninhabitable room for two out of my three night stay.

Reviews.Title: “In the middle of everything,impressive staff caring all your needs”
Reviews.Author: luxury06
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the hotel for 3 nights. My husband was on a business trip, and me and my 10 year old son was on a leisure trip. yunus from the reservation advised me to stay in the business advantage room for our comfort, which he was definetely right. When we entered the hotel, the room was ready for us with an extra bed opened beforehand for my son, and the m2 of the room was convinient for our needs. The location of the hotel was perfect, and the complimentary waters, and candies for the kid was enjoyable. The housekeeping was working very well, and the breakfast was in a boutique style that you can reach everything easily, where everything was fresh., so I would definetely thank the hotel management, and recommend this hotel to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Home away from home in the heart of Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: skipsterNewYork
Reviews.Content: This is my second review of this property and my second stay in 12 months. My partner and I made our 2d trip to Amsterdam, this time with our 10 year old son. Having loved the Swissotel one year ago, we returned and were not disappointed. As stated repeatedly, the location on the Dam cannot be beat, so don't underestimate that. Others have expressed some hesitancy about the property and I think I can elaborate a little having stayed there twice. This is upscale lodging with an informal ambience of hospitality. If you are a business traveler on company budget or leisure traveler who goes upscale rather than rock bottom, the property is excellent. Comfortable, quiet clean rooms with all the amenities you would want: room service, coffee maker, minibar, business center with internet. It is not, however, 5 star luxury with a formal air if that is what you seek or expect. That's fine by me. Note that with advance booking, particularly in off season, you should be able to get a very reasonable rate. We paid about 125 Euros per night for a premium room (one level up from run of the house room) including all VAT/taxes. For those of you in the know, that's a very fair rate for a hotel this nice in the dead center of a European city. The staff is friendly and engaging and all one need do is ask and they cannot do enough for you. If we return to Amsterdam again (great city), there's no doubt we will book Swissotel. Shout out to Sam (female) in reception who thought our son was the best kid ever! Why then only 4 dots this year, when my Jan 2009 review had 5 dots? I will agree with other reviewers that it's time for a makeover/upgrade/renovation. There were faults in the furnishings of the room that showed wear and tear, but had no impact on cleanliness or wonderful atmosphere. I think the property manager has already remarked that renewal is pending. Can't really hold him accountable anyway. I suppose corporate must see comments like this to get the project going.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad but far from Swissotel standards”
Reviews.Author: superalpi
Reviews.Content: We had a short visit to Amsterdam after staying in Rome as a part of our New Year's trip. The hotel is 10 minutes walk from the railway station and is easy to find. It is located in a good spot just a few steps from Dam square - the central square of Amsterdam, The Royal Palace, Red light district, etc. All other major points of interest are not far either. We practically did not use public transportation though the tram stops are close to the hotel. The staff at front desk was very friendly. But still we were overall disappointed by the hotel as it did not meet our expectations of Swissotel standards which we had a chance to happily experience previously in other countries. We did not like that the hotel reserved an amount of 150 euro on my credit card. It is not understandable because the minibar was ridiculously empty containing only Heineken and some soda. Also the visitors to Amsterdam should be aware of the city tax amounting to 5 % of accomodation cost which is not included in total price of stay and additionally charged at the time of check-out. We were not informed about that at check-in. The bed was comfortable, the room was big but it really needs renovation and more light. The white walls had many staines. TV set was old-fashioned, the coffee maker Nespresso was complicated and uncomfortable to operate. You can use only the supplied coffee "tablets" (1 per person per day) which made it impossible for us to have some more (even our own) coffee. The bathroom did not produce the impression of neatness either. It was definitely cleaned but still looked shabby with scratched marble floor and old towels even with a hole in one of them. The bathroom door did not have an inside lock and the handle was broken. The good thing about the hotel is that it provides free internet access from the 3 computers and free printing at the hotel's business center. I would recommend this hotes for an unpretentious traveller looking for a good location.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay - Excellent Staff”
Reviews.Author: RockinRio_Lisbon2010
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam hotel for 2 nights in early January. We were travelling with our 18 months son and we were a bit worried about the cold weather that was being felt in Amsterdam and about the room facilities for him. All our worries were unfounded mainly because of the caring Staff working at the Swiss Hotel. The whole package was excellent. We were particularly impressed with the wonderful staff who were warm, friendly, knowledgeable and were willing to help anyway they could. There are several good restaurants within walking distance as well as neighborhood groceries where one can buy wine or a few breakfast supplies. There are coffee and tea supplies in the room as well as a small mini-bar refrigerator. We were able to store a couple of cartons of yogurt there. We would recommend this hotel, mainly for itâ€™s location and the staff !!! Our Son felt very very comfortable there and every one in the hotel made us all feel extremely welcomed. Definitely a very nice four star hotel !

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel in a perfect location with fantastic staff . . .”
Reviews.Author: Chrisanddave
Reviews.Content: We know Amsterdam really well and have always been happy with the different accommodation places we have stayed at while there but have to say that this is probably the best so far. The location is right on Dam Square and though it is very central, it is not noisy. The hotel is contemporary, spotless, airy and very comfortable, our room was lovely. All the staff are very friendly, cheerful, efficient, dealt with everything promptly and always checked that we had all we needed. We were delighted with all aspects of our stay there.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: IscoreNordland
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice room, clean, staff was very nice, breakfast good. I had a very pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “It really is a good hotel”
Reviews.Author: Falkenburg
Reviews.Content: A little bit sceptical of all the good reviews for this hotel, but I booked and went. I have to say it really is as the reviews say - Very good! :-) - It's just off Dam Square in the centre - 5-10 min walk from the train station past loads of (somewhat tacky) gift shops - Staff were excellent - Rooms clean and bright It ticks all the boxes really. 2 reservations: - If you open a window, some of the rooms can be noisy. This is because some of them face onto the square or a side road. When you check in, mention this and they will try to put you in a room you prefer. If you don't open the window, it's not a problem (A/C is in the room). - Wifi is in the hotel, but very expensive. Overall, a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “absolutely great hotel”
Reviews.Author: scrutineer44
Reviews.Content: Very very nice hotel, right on Damrak st. about 7-10 minutes walk to the centraal station. in the heart of amsterdam, the trams are right in front of the hotel

Reviews.Title: “And I thought Swissotels were REALLY nice...”
Reviews.Author: LIVEINHOuSTON
Reviews.Content: The only other Swissotel I have stayed in is the one in Lima, Peru, and it was beautiful. This one in Amsterdam, not so much. I'll echo all the comments you read here about the location - it's excellent. Trams 4, 9, 16, 24, and 25 stop right in front of the hotel, and a bunch of others one block behind the hotel. It's a 10 minute walk to Central Station, or the next stop on any of the trams headed north. The staff has been nice, no complaints there. The gym is adequate (open 24/7); actually that was one of the reasons I chose the Swissotel was so that I could use the treadmill and not many hotels in Amsterdam seem to have a gym. The three computers with free internet access 24/7 was very nice as well. I booked my room through Orbitz since they had a $40 off coupon for 3 nights or more, so it was cheaper than the rates being offered directly through Swissotel's website. It was a non-refundable rate, booked the day before arrival - $697 for 5 nights - Monday - Saturday, plus 5% city tax which the hotel will charge me for (I already paid Orbitz the $697). This was a great rate, and would have been even more disappointed if I would have spent more money than this. The hotel has ZERO character. The hallways looks like a cheap cruiseship. The first room I was given had stains on the toilet, used soap by the sink, and an almost empty water bottle. It was an ugly room, very uninviting and sterile. I returned to the lobby and was provided a different room right away. This room was clearly a newer, more updated room.
