It actually had wood, so some contrast in the room and exactly as is shown in the previous reviewer's pictures. Clearly some rooms are much nicer than others decor-wise, however the room was still pretty skimpy. So if you want some character in your room, don't stay here. Otherwise it was adequate, but did not meet the expectations I had of Swissotel. The last hotel I stayed at in Amsterdam was a modern B&B called The Weber and I loved it, very cool minimalist place by the Leidseplein. I would stay there again, while I would not at the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good Choice in Amsterdam but not as Nice as Your Typical Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: KR-ORD
Reviews.Content: We chose the Swissotel primarily for its location and the fact that we can depend on the chain for decent service and rooms. The hotel did not disappoint us there but, as mentioned before, this branch of the chain is a notch below the others when it comes to decor and available services. The location is very central and you can walk almost everywhere in the city, even the art museums if you are willing to spend the 30-40 minutes. It is across from De Bijenkorf, one of Amsterdam's top department store with an excellent food hall on its top floor - a good choice for some of your meals. The Kalvertstraat shopping street is directly behind the hotel and the Nieuwe Kerk and Royal Palace around the corner. Many of the city's tram lines stop in front of the hotel and most of the rest stop two blocks away near the big Albert Heijn supermarket where you should be able to find almost anything you would need during your visit. One of our rooms was ready the morning we arrived and we stowed our bags there before heading off to get some brunch before checking back to see if the other room was ready. My room was not clean when we checked back but the desk clerk found me a clean room without any prompting on my part. Most of the rooms overlook 'streets' on the sides of the hotel that are about six feet wide. The only ones overlooking anything but other walls are those on the short sides of the hotel at the back on the Kalvertstraat or the expensive Executive rooms overlooking the Damrak and Dam Square. Windows are double paned and it was surprisingly quiet given how noisy the neighborhood is. The rooms might be described as modern? Very while and blue and somewhat sterile. I did not mind it at all but anyone looking for character will be disappointed. Everything worked well and there was the usual impressive Swissotel espresso machine. The beds were quite comfortable, the TV had English language channels so you could keep abreast of world news and it was easy to keep the room at the desired temperature. This hotel really has the atmosphere of a small hotel. There is a small work out room and a room with three computers for guests to use on the same floor. The lobby is tiny and the desk staff double as the concierge. One bellman on duty. They were all very good and they gave you the impression that you were staying in a more upscale hotel with very personal service. The restaurant was okay - not great and not horrible. We paid just over $200 a night for our room and I would definitely return to the Swissotel if I could find rooms at that price again.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located - excellent”
Reviews.Author: Thomas07364
Reviews.Content: Located beside Dam Square you won't get more central than this and yet it was quiet so no problem sleeping. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Room was average size and kept clean. Excellent restaurant attached to it. If I return to Amsterdam I will have no hesitation staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: Irishchelle
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Swissotel from the 23rd to the 26th October 09 with my boyfriend. I looked it up on Tripadvisor before booking it & was happy with the reviews so i went ahead & booked it. On first impressions the hotel looks plain & small. On entering the lobby it is small but welcoming. Luigi, the reception was very chatty & welcoming to us. We arrived in the hotel about 10am even though check in isnt until 2pm, they allowed us to check in. The room was smallish compared to what Im used to very clean & tidy. The bed is very comfy. The bathroom is small with a bath & overhead shower. I would of liked a handrail to help get into/out of the bath. Light fittings around the bathroom mirror was very nice. The hotel is located right next to Dam square & though there was a funfair on the square, noise wasnt a problem. Our room backed out on to a lane way, but we'd no problem with this as we didnt book into the hotel for the view! Bedsheets/ towels can be changed everyday if you place a card on the bed requesting it, or leave the towels on the floor. On our first morning there though, house cleaner knocked on the door at 9am, which i considered way to early! The location is excellent, the staff are friendly. The cost of the 3 nights stay was â‚¬407 which is a little bit high for considering its location I would stay here again. Its within walking distance of all attractions, ie red light district, canal tours, wax museum etc. I would definetly stay here again, and wouldnt hestiate in recommending it to my family/friends.

Reviews.Title: “What a excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: IvoDusch
Reviews.Content: We visited the Swissotel Amsterdam last weekend. We booked a junior suite and this was amazing! We could see the Dam Square from our room and all the attractions of Amsterdam are within a couple of minutes walking. This hotel offers an excellent service and really has friendly personnel. Even the cook was really friendly and asked several times if he could do anything. This hotel deserves a good recommendation!

Reviews.Title: “Great location for exploring the city; Not quite 4/5 stars but good choice”
Reviews.Author: LeftCoastTravelGirl
Reviews.Content: The only reason I did not give this property a "very good" instead of "good" is it just seemed a bit run down to be a Swissotel...Stains on carpet and curtains, a few cracks in bathroom tiles, just looked a little dated. However, the location is excellent, just next to Dam Square (our room even had a view of the Square) -- very convenient to all the major attractions in the city and close to the main train station. The room was large and comfortable -- it was quiet once we managed to get our window shut properly. We got a good deal on hotels.com booking last minute; I'd recommend that and also the Swissotel Web Site had some posted specials. Not as nice as other Swissotel properties I have stayed in, but excellent location. Wireless Internet was available for a fee; Business Center was free but you had to use their computers. This was a bit of a bummer for a property that is supposed to be aimed at business travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but disappointing compared to other Swissotel properties”
Reviews.Author: mark_mclaughlin
Reviews.Content: As others have noted, the location of the hotel can't be faulted. However, having experienced other Swissotel properties - such as the one in Tallinn - the hotel in Amsterdam is starting to feel a little tired and dated in places. The rates aren't cheap for this hotel and it's clear you're paying for the location more than anything else; my room had the standard decor of every other hotel chain you've stayed in ever (yeah, you know *that* blue carpet) and was topped off a disappointing view over a dark alley. That said, the bed was comfortable - despite some fan vent noise outside - and the bathroom was immaculate. Internet access is available through both WiFi and Ethernet, but beware that they're billed separately by two different providers and subject to the usual colossal slowdowns as everyone starts using it in the morning. Breakfast was extra and is shared with a neighbouring cafÃ©; shockingly overpriced as most hotel breakfasts are, but some decent coffee saved the day - you'll still do better heading outside to a nearby bakery though.

Reviews.Title: “Just can't beat the location!”
Reviews.Author: Ari_LA1
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay at the Swissotel Amsterdam. My wife and I had just come from 5 nights in romantic Paris and didn't know what to expect in Amsterdam. The Swissotel is in an excellent location, just steps from every attraction we wanted to see in the city. In fact, we only walked around the city for 3 days without taking public transportation once! Wonderful place to rest your head in the city center. With so much going on around you we didn't need it to be much else. Good internet connection to keep in touch with the office when we needed to.

Reviews.Title: “Good Location”
Reviews.Author: Holidays_HappyTimes
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Swissotel for 2 nights in September. This was our first visit to Amsterdam and this hotel was in a perfect , central location as we arrived at Central Train Station at 7pm and just had to walk the 10 / 15 min walk down the Damrak to get to it. It is situated on the corner of Dam Square, next to the Palace. The Hotel staff were friendly and informative. I can not comment on the hotel food as we did not have breakfast or evening meals, there are far too many places to eat out at in Amsterdam to stay in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very Decent and Central”
Reviews.Author: ansofitsi
Reviews.Content: A very decent hotel having its greatest asset in the very central location and its very friendly and helpfull staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Biogeog
Reviews.Content: Although this hotel is in a very busy and noisy area, we had an room facing an interior courtyard and it was VERY QUIET. You don't get the view of the crowds on Dam Square in the interior rooms, but you don't get the noise either. Our room was very nice and clean and the staff were extremely attentive. If you want to be close to the action, train station, etc. this is a great option.

Reviews.Title: “Central Location, walking distance to all atractions”
Reviews.Author: BRYNSI
Reviews.Content: Having stayed in the Swissotel twice, we have found this Hotel the most perfectly located Hotel, on the corner of Dam Square, next to the Palace. The Hotel is small (as most are in Old Amsterdam), the hotel stylish, maybe not to every taste, but clean and modern. The room we have had both times, looks out onto the main street (The Damrak), opposite the Department Store. Most complain about the noise, especially from the constantly running trams, although this did not bother us, having lived in London for so long, we must be immune to noise. The restaurant served ample, typically Continental Style Breakfasts, the restaurant of an evening served good food in an ambient setting, perfect for a couple to relax and unwind. The reception staff were always very helpful and would suggest good restaurants, clubs, pubs and sightseeing, off the usual tourist circuit, (or as they often told us, "This is where the Beautiful People go"). Our room, which was front facing on the second floor, with a large bay window, was always clean and well aired. The location was perfect to suit all tastes of tourist, from leaving the hotel lobby, turn left for Tat, Sex and the Seedy side of Amsterdam, turn right and cross the square for Culture, Museums, Shopping and the Restaurant District, best of both worlds and set perfectly between the two. Everything we wanted to see on both visits, was within walking distance from the Hotel, which was great especially when you have shopped too heavily at the Flower Market. We would recommend this hotel to anyone on either business or leisure in Amsterdam. It's in a perfectly safe location in the very centre of Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: C0starican
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were looking for a boutique hotel in the center of Amsterdam, and Swissotel exceeded our expectations. It is a small, but trendy hotel, right on Dam Square. Its location is absolutely perfect: next to the red light disctrict as well as to the main shopping area of the city and nearby plenty of restaurants and cafes. The concierge at the hotel was really helpful at finding excellent eating places. Our favorite cafe of the area: Luxembourg Cafe. The rooms at the hotel were a bit small, though normal for European standard. And the downstairs cafeteria was a bit expensive, but you have the option of choosing both Ã¡ la carte or the buffet. Swissotel is definitely a good choice for couples and small families. We highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “On Dam square”
Reviews.Author: Shanehoustonlittle
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel because we were travelling with our parents and needed a wheelchair accessible hotel. The room wwas of adequate size. The decor was kind of 70s international style circa James Bond. The room was of adequate size. The bathroom was too small for two adults to use simultaneously but adequate for one person. The layout of the hotel is constrained due to the confines of the building footprint. My parents room across the hallway was enormous and had a courtyard view. We had a view of the neighboring building which is under renovation. The staff was attentive and seemed to especially get along with my parents :) Dam square is very central. The whole city is very beautiful and if we ever return we would like to sample some of the non city central neighborhoods. The locatino is great for a first visit until you find the neighborhood that you really like.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: ams-ibz
Reviews.Content: The location is excellent and its surprisingly quiet in the rooms, which is not common in Amsterdam. I like the staff; they are happy to answer any requests but at the same time will leave you to yourself. I would recommend this hotel to anyone on business or leisure in Amsterdam. It's a safe haven right in the heart of Amsterdam and 100 meters from the RLD. A little pricey but look where it's at. I've tried several other hotels in the area of the same class and this is the by far the best choice for the Area. You won't be dissapointed.

Reviews.Title: “location, location, location”
Reviews.Author: SIDSKID
Reviews.Content: Couldn't be in a better spot for access to anywhere in the city. Superb front desk staff--the concierges are very knowledgeable. The lobby and rooms leave something to be desired but are clean, neat and comfortable--just a bit dreary. There is a restaurant in the hotel that fronts on the street. We didn't try it--there's a great bakery down the street where a continental breakfast is very reasonably priced. I filled out the hotel's questionnaire and got a reply back from the manager--that's great service!

Reviews.Title: “Good location, shame about the beds!”
Reviews.Author: HalosiyMalchik
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay in the Swissotel Amsterdam after having stayed in the Swissotel Istanbu, which was a great hotel, very comfortable with excellent service and amenities. The location of this hotel is very good, right on Dam Square and within walking distance of all the main attractions of Amsterdam. Unfortunately when we got to our room, we found that our "king size" bed was actually two single beds pushed together. Returned to reception to request a proper bed, and was given an alternative room on the first floor overlooking a very noisy side alleyway... And later discovered that this too was a pair of single beds masquerading as a king size! Too tired / lazy to argue, we gave up, and stayed put. There was no bell-boy or any offers to assist with our luggage on arrival, and overall the service was well below par for a four star hotel. The rooms, although fairly clean, were very dated looking, probably the height of fashion in the 1980's but not now. So to summarize, top location but let down by the rooms, service, and the apparent lack of double beds!

Reviews.Title: “No Major Complaints”
Reviews.Author: GilFennerty
Reviews.Content: First, a few positives. The staff is helpful. I arrived with a group of coworkers after a long difficult night a travel. We were well before approved check in time. They were attentive and appeared to do their very best to get us into room as soon as possible. Location is top notch. Especially if you're a tourist, which i was not. But centrally located, walking distance from everything. Inches from public transportation. As for the rooms themselves, mine was decent but nothing special. A little cramped. Small, older television. Bed was actually above average. Room service food was pretty awful actually. Too me, probably a little closer to a 3 star room than a 4. The lobby is quite nice, but the hallways are an ugly yellow, and a little beat up. If I could, I'd give the place a 3.5 rating. Overall, it was a fine stay. It all comes down to price. If you're paying 4-Star money for this place, you're likely to be a little disappointed with some things. But, its clean, pleasant, and appears relatively well run, so you could also do far worse.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabuleous location, in the middle of everything”
Reviews.Author: IrishCanadian1947
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for a week, it was great. The front desk staff were friendly and very helpful, they always had a smile to greet us with. The locatoin was perfect, walking distance from everything in the core of this wonderful city. The hotel is also directly on several tram lines, linking us with everywhere. It is a few minutes walk to the train station and canal cruises as well as directly across from wonderful Shopping. We'd like to thank Swissotel for helping to make our trip to Amsterdam a wonderful experience. From B & N - Moncton, New Brunswick, Canada

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place!! and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: hrdclck
Reviews.Content: room was very nice, clean and very large. after hearing about how small every room is in europe, we expected the worst and were very pleased. the staff was helpful and friendly. our room overlooked Dam Square. if you dont want noise of street and trolleys, dont face the square and stay higher up. we were not bothered by it but could see how others would be. bed was so comfortable. great water pressure and FREE internet in the business center which was just large enough and you can print things in color for FREE there! try finding that in other places. we loved this hotel, great place to eat right next store in the AM, great restaurants and bars right across the street and the best money exchange place right next store. the location cant be beat unless you are looking to stay on a canal/canal view, this was a great place in the middle of it all!

Reviews.Title: “Business hotel, great location, but not particularly friendly/helpful”
Reviews.Author: australianlawyer
Reviews.Content: I was a bit disappointed with the "premium" room - definitely not worth the upgrade. The room was a bit noisier than I'd expected.

Reviews.Title: “Just perfect.”
Reviews.Author: elikofl
Reviews.Content: Nice hotel and friendly staff (concierge Rob). Only problem was that next to our room there was construction site. Breakfast was excellent. Location is just superb.

Reviews.Title: “Best location in Amsterdam and ultra friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: nkwok
Reviews.Content: Very pleasant stay here. The location (for a tourist) is great!! It's an easy walk to the trainstation, has trams right outside, right near the Dam and Magna Plaza, and 2 blocks away from the Red Light District. As a tourist, it can't be better situated. Lots of amenities - free use of the business center - you can print out train tickets etc if you are doing day trips, and there is an excellent gym. It's also close by to the Marnixplein ( a 10 min walk) and you can go to the ozone pool for only 3.60euros. The staff are right on top of it, and so willing to help.

Reviews.Title: “Great home base hotel !”
Reviews.Author: GSR70
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the swissotel May 5-11. Great home base as you are in the center of everything. Front desk was very nice, they were able to confirm a reservation for us at De Kass restaurant which, btw, everyone should go to. Its in a greenhouse and has all fresh food. Our room was good, nothing fancy, but beds were comfy and bathroom was nice, free nespresso which was great. Free internet in the Bus center too. Room looked out over the back and was not noisy at all. Overall it was a great time in AMS. Our fav section of town was the west and the jordaan district. Two amazing restaurants were vlaming http://www.eetcafevlaming.nl/Brass/brasserie.html and Envy http://www.envy.nl/ Vlaming had the best sticky toffee cake which the owner himself was world famous. We were like yeah right and then ordered it and he was right! It was amazing and really has to be experienced. A good high class coffeeshop was amnesia, very nice place and nice staff if you are into coffeeshops. Overall Ams is one of my favorite cities now. Its like a storybook place and is not to be missed, so much to see and do and to take in. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Room service could be a bit intermidating.”
Reviews.Author: Luitje
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for a weekend. It is indeed centrally located. I booked a junior suit and it was a nice room all in all, with a great view; though central window frame is a bit loose and flooring is a bit shabby. What was not nice is their room service. I went for a walk on Saturday morning (at around 10 am) and came back at around 1 pm to catch up on my e-mails and take a shower. My room was not made, which didn't bother me a bit. I've been in the shower when maid knocked on my door. I asked her to come back later. So she did - in around 30 minutes. When I opened the door she gave me an attitude for still staying in the room and urged me to get out because, as she explained, my room was the last on the floor and her shift was ending in 30 minutes. That was quite intermidating. Never been in a situation like that before, so I just grabbed my laptop and went to a cafe nearby to finish things I was doing. Apart from that - everything else was fine. Though I have to warn those booking a junior suite: bathroom has a glass wall and door. So if you are not coming alone, beware taking a bath with someone in a room could be a bit difficult (unless you don't mind them see you naked).

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location, fantastic staff”
Reviews.Author: pamboBolton
Reviews.Content: Four of us stayed at this hotel for one night only on a mini cruise to Amsterdam. The Hotel is wonderfully situated on Dam Square, just 10 mins from Central Station. I am a very widely travelled person but I have never encountered such friendly, helpful staff. Nothing was too much trouble for them. The rooms were a bit variable. My friend and I had a large, modern room complete with ensuite, television and coffee/tea maker, my two other friends' room was slightly smaller but still very good. The room cost approx. Â£154 per night (without breakfast) so it was expensive but if you are looking for a great base to explore Amsterdam, I would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in a Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: Ealing09
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at Swissotel Amsterdam for 3 nights and it was perfect. I did a lot of research and booked based on comments here on TripAdvisor and I was very pleased. You can't get any better as far as location and the staff was extremely helpful and courteous. Most of the main sites were within a 5 - 10 minute walk, and the main train station is only a five minute walk which runs directly to and from Schipole Airport. And due to a mix up with our original reservation, our room got upgraded and we ended up having a view of Dam Square and the National Monument.

Reviews.Title: “Close to everything”
Reviews.Author: Westshore
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a week 4-11 to 4-18-09. We paid extra for a superior room which was still a bit on the small side. Room was clean and well serviced each day. Front desk staff was helpful. We never even considered using public transportation as all attractions were easily walkable. When we checked out there was an inaccurate charge on the final bill which they quickly removed. The hotel is in an extremely busy area. Lots of people and activity directly outside the hotel. Overall a nice stay in a unique city. Internet is free in the business center. The charge for internet access in the room is much too high.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location - hard to beat”
Reviews.Author: CJ0
Reviews.Content: I looked on Trip Advisor before booking a Hotel in Amsterdam. One title stood out for this Hotel. It said 'Location, Location, Location'. It was spot on. This Hotel is so central to everything and overlook the main buy square. Breakfast was not included in our package and we found it extremely expensive to have Breakfast in this Hotel, but it was very good food. Our room was at the front of the Hotel overlooking the square which was perfect. Our friends had rooms at the side. Their rooms, although large and comfy, overlooked a brickwall. Not so nice, but then who wants to spend their time in Amsterdam looking out of a Hotel window!!! The staff were very helpfull and friendly. There is an excellent steak House - Gauchos - around the corner. Best steak we've ever had!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, shame about the rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Loobslou
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel was fantastic, 2 seconds away from Dam Square and just far enough from the red light district. Rembrandt Square and Leidesplein easily accessible, either by taxi or by the bicycle taxis or a 15 minute walk. When we arrived at the hotel we were told that the hotel could not keep to the room rate that we were originally given and we were to be charged an extra Â£60 per night!!! The room we were given was supposed to be a premium room, it was really small with 2 single beds pushed together (apparently a kingsize). Our window looked out onto a building which was under construction so we had no sunlight at all. On a positive the room was cleaned everyday and we were given clean towels everyday. The room was very well sound proofed, once the window was closed you couldn't hear any noise from outside. All in all, the hotel location is fab but definitely not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Amsterdam - not as good as expected...”
Reviews.Author: reggy123
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel on business in late March. As the other reviews say it's about as central as you can get in downtown Amsterdam. About a 10 minute walk from the station. Right next to Dam Square and the main shopping area. As my review title says - I expected more from the Swissotel based on other reviews I read on Tripadvisor prior to my trip. It claims a four star rating but to be honest it felt more like an upmarket youth hostel! The lobby is small with few facilities, you must swipe your key to use the lift and stairs, the 3rd floor decor was rather tired and really could do with modernising. The room itself was fine, a very comfy bed but again a bit tired around the edges. All the staff were all very friendly and welcoming so nothing to worry about there. The room rate was quite cheap for a city centre hotel but I left after 3 days rather disappointed by my experience. My biggest issues at the Swissotel were generally price related - â‚¬25 euro for breakfast, â‚¬9 for a beer in the bar and a whopping â‚¬22 euro a day for internet access! I would also urge caution on eating around Dam Square as some of the prices are hiked for tourists...I think â‚¬7 for a glass of fresh orange qualifies! I forget the name of the place but it is next to Europub on Dam Square! I recommend walking a few streets away and you will find a good selection of cafes and such like offering far better quality at cheaper prices. The best I found was an all you can eat Japanese place about 5 mins walk from the hotel..SUPERB! Enjoy Amsterdam and maybe my expectations of Swissotel were to high based on other reviews? I wouldn't put other travellers off staying there, it's just my opinion and that's the end of my review of Swissotel Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best possible location and really nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: GusJJM
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and i stayed at this hotel during our first stay inamsterdam. As said in many reviews the location of the hotl is perfect. it is right in the centre of the city on Dam square near loads of shops restraunts and attractions. There is entertainment and street performers in summer at dam square which is good. The hotel staff were friendly upon arrival and check in (as well as check out) went without any problems. We were shown to our room which unfortunatly didnt have much of a view (a narrow shopping street at the back of the hotel) but we couldnt complain as we did go for the cheapest possible room. The room itself was a very good size. We had a huge double bed and had a lot of floor space. There was a tv with plenty of channels and a brilliant 'dolche gusto' type coffee machine which was refilled daily. The bathroom was modern, clean and generally nice with plenty of shower gels and shampoos etc. The bar/restraunt downstairs was very modern and very nice to sit in however the prices are very expensive. 2 vodkas and cokes came to about 14 or 15 euros!!! One morning also, we got 2 medium tomato juices and it came to 9Euros. We did not sample the food, but from what I saw on other peoples plates it looked the sort you would get in a top of the line restraunt. We liked every aspect of the hotel apart from the prices of food and drink, but it is to be expected as it is a 4star in the dead centre of a capital city. Right outside the hotel there are dozens of places to eat (chip stands, chinese noodle bars, steak houses, italian restraunts, indian houses, japanese places, burger kind, kfc) and drink which would not stretch your budget. Drinks can be expensive so look out for bars that have 2-4-1 promos which will make your money go further.

Reviews.Title: “Be careful using your credit card here”
Reviews.Author: MBIRE
Reviews.Content: I had booked this hotel for next week the hotel has charged my credit card twice and i have spent ages trying to get the second unauthorised entry returned i have still not had the money put back on my card. I am still waiting for the money to be returned to my card and it is over a week ago now. I travel regularly and have never had this problem with a hotel. It has left a bad taste in my mouth.... the booking was made through easybook.com MY ADVICE TO ALL IS DO NOT GIVE YOUR CREDITCARD DETAILS TO THIS HOTEL OR THIS BOOKING AGENT

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel in a Fantastic Location”
Reviews.Author: jayjaybell
Reviews.Content: Swissotel Amsterdam was superb in everyway. Great staff and location, everything went very smoothly over the 2 days we were there. Will definately return to Amsterdam and would defineatly only stay at the Swissotel. My only suggestion would be that they could do with some Maxebars instead on ther minibars.

Reviews.Title: “in the middle of it all but not tacky”
Reviews.Author: loppo
Reviews.Content: secured a rate of $130 one night no breakfast. the hotel is a short walk from the station and right in the middle of all the action very friendly staff and clean rooms right on dam square where u can find madam taussauds,shops,the palace,and many restaurants would definateley recommend the hotel

Reviews.Title: “a very nice hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: mamielor
Reviews.Content: very nice hotel, exceptional location. Our room ( a junior suite) was quite big, the bathroom was huge, the view over the Dam was very pleasant. The staff was very kind and helpful. The only bad point is the noise, which in summer, must be unbearable. Thanks to Tripadvisor I had "boules Quies" with me, and we spent 2 wonderful nights without any noise from the street. very nice hotel in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Job, Very Consistent”
Reviews.Author: ArvinLee
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in this hotel before and totally enjoyed it. so when i booked the room again, i requested for the same room, and they did give me the same room. kudos! Check in was a breeze, the staffs were attentive and very knowledgeable about the area and good restaurants around. Room : spacious, big for European hotels. Nespresso coffee maker in the room was a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Beautifull Room, Great View and very clean”
Reviews.Author: tittch9
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Junior suite over looking Dam Square. Brilliant central location w hich is close to everything. The room was beautifull, very big, well equipped and clean. Nice place to lounge in and not just a hotel for sleeping in, like most are in Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “NEW YEAR's @ Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: Chrissy444
Reviews.Content: Hello, I stayed at the hotel for 7 nights total. I had a Suite overlooking Dam Sq. My friends had a classic room. I recommend to pay the extra money and get a suite. It was 3 times the size of the classic room. You had a living room area, very large bathroom, and so much more. It was well worth it. I travel every month and this hotel room was one of my favorites. This trip however was for leisure. Upside: I had huge windows overlooking Dam Sq. I could see everything going on outside. Great view. Center of everything. Downside: My room overlooked Dam Sqaure so it was very noisy. Once the tram starts in the AM you hear it all the time. And the people were noisy. On New Years Eve i heard all day sound checks, etc for the live music later on in the night. Good thing was though, that i had my restroom to use instead of paying in some restaurant. Food in hotel restaurant was suprisingly good and not overpriced. I would have eaten more in the hotel restaurant if i had more time.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Holidays212
Reviews.Content: When we arrived i didnt realise the hotel was so close to Dam Square, it was right on the corner and i was expecting lots of noise and no sleep. Our room was around the side of the hotel and we didnt hear hardly anything except the odd guest but nothing from outside which was surprising because of how busy the main road is. The hotel was very clean, the hotel reception staff and people who clean the rooms were very helpful and very polite, all could speak very good english which was very helpful. I would definately stay here again and recommend it to others, overall its the best hotel i have stayed at for a long time, the staff are very helpful, which is hard to find at some hotels. Very good : )

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shirbaz
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in an excellent location right in the centre of Amsterdam. The hotel is lovely and clean and the receptionist and concierge are very helpful. We stayed in a classic room, the room was very comfortable, the bed was huge, the room also had a TV, mini bar, coffee machine and safe. The bathroomm was excellent with fresh towels every day, a heated towel rack, loads of nice bath and hair products and a hairdryer. The room was really warm, so much that we had to use the air conditioning. We did not have breakfast, however there are plenty of places to eat nearby. I would recommed this clean and comfortable hotel to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Central location within walking distance of train station”
Reviews.Author: Denver_Mullican
Reviews.Content: Clean hotel in the heart of Amsterdam a ten-minute walk from the train station. The business center offers free Internet and printing. You have to use the key card to use most of the facilities, including the elevator. There are a number of restaurants on the same block as the hotel â€“ and many are open late. Denver Mullican, New Orleans

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel - Great Location”
Reviews.Author: OttoScotland
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swissotel during the weekend of the marathon. Booked the Junior suite and had a room on the 3rd floor overlooking Dam Square. All the staff were very nice and helpful with little touches like a complementary half bottle of wine and toblerone when we arrived in our room. Only downside was the Dam square fun fare which was quite noisy but we expected a little noise from the trams and being so close to the square. This was out of the hotels control and it did not spoil our visit. The room was very special, clean and modern with a huge bed so if you fall out with your partner there will still be plenty of room for you both to share the bed and create quite a large no mans area. Bathrobe and slippers were also provided but you had to leave the bathrobe on your departure the slipper although cheap you could keep. Usual mini bar, safe, LCD wide screen TV, DVD player and music centre. We ate in the hotel on our first evening and were quite happy with the meal, service and price. Breakfast is quite expensive but sometimes you get what you pay for. Just across from the hotel is de Bijenkorf store and its well worth a visit to the 5th floor food hall which is open till 7pm I think but it is very modern with a good choice of foods which are all freshly cooked and prepared while you wait. For me and my wife to eat a lovely meal with wine cost only 33 euros. Great if youâ€™re not sure what you fancy and you can eat outside on their terrace garden. Another gem we found was the new library between the central station and Nemo. Top floor has a wonderful eating place where again the food is freshly prepared and cooked as you order. You can eat out side with great views of Amsterdam. Overall had a great weekend and if going back again I would definitely have no problems staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, great location!”
Reviews.Author: Seattle98101
Reviews.Content: I was very happy with our stay at the Swissotel in Amsterdam. The location is great, right on Dam Square, so perfect for sightseeing. It's also an easy walk down the main street to the train station, so getting to/from the airport is quite simple and reliable - much better than going by bus or car. The room was clean, modern and well-appointed, with a comfortable bed, good closet space, coffeemaker, and a lovely bathroom. We faced a small alley, away from the front of the hotel, so no view but no problems with noise. I also much appreciated the free internet access in the business center. Breakfast was good, included with our package (I would not pay 20 pounds for it otherwise.) On previous trips I've stayed at the Crowne Plaza (nearer the train station, area and rooms weren't as nice) and the NH New Amsterdam (beautiful but a long way to the train station, better if you're traveling by car.) For leisure travel I would pick the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel good location for wkend trip”
Reviews.Author: IrishJen80
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel was ok. The location is excellent for a trip to Amsterdam only a short walk to everywhere you need to go. I think it was rated as a 4 star but i would have thought it's more like a 3 star hotel. The breakfast is very expensive 20 per person. The rooms are a decent size and were clean and comfy. The decor was just a bit outdated. Apparently hotels in amsterdam are quite expensive so I'd say this would be a standard 4 star over there. Dam square is lively and there is lots going on there during the day. You would be right next to shopping areas, canal tours, madamme tussauds, close to red light district and anne frank house. Van gogh museum is about 20 mins walk away. Also big tip for anyone don't get a taxi from the airport. It cost us 50 euro and was only about 15 mins in a taxi. I don't think they are regulated so they charge what they like. There is a train from central station that will take you straight to the airport for a few euro. Its a few hundred yards from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Solid, okay”
Reviews.Author: MrSoft
Reviews.Content: Smart and high standard (for Amsterdam) where good hotels are at a premium in the centre. Please note, that luscious building portrayed on the Swissotel website is Dam Palace, not the Swissotel :-) The actual property is a rather narrow but pleasing facade given a bit of extra presence by some big Swiss flags. The standard room was nice, smart, but really rather tight. Saying that it was laid out very intelligently and everything had its own little space. My room had a Nespresso machine which was not functioning. Rather smokey smell despite being a n-s room. Business facilities were good and quick internet connection. The concierge was a very helpful guy. He was needed because there was a lack of communication between the Swissotel website and the hotel's reservations. But he sorted it out nicely. The bar is rather dead and throws you out on the dot of midnight, which is a shame but good for business. Not cheap by any means but it's fine and if you're in this part of town I think it's the best option available.

Reviews.Title: “3rd Time in this hotel and will always return!”
Reviews.Author: clarelittle100
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here 3 times now. The first time was at Xmas 2006 where we were upgraded for free to a superior room. It was truly quite a big room and a huge comfy bed. We then returned in August 2007 for a week, again a great stay. A slightly smaller room this time, but didn't bother us because the bed was huge like the last time. We booked a superior room this time and paid for it because having the free upgrade the first time, we didn't want to be dissappointed. Although I'm sure the Classic Room is just as great. We returned in June 2008 for a long weekend. Because my partner smokes, they only had a few smoking rooms left due to the Smoking Ban that came in July 2008. They had redecorated 99% of the hotel rooms and cleaned them from smoke so they only had 2 available. We tried the Junior Suite, but found this too noisy because it overlooks Dam Square. It was a great big room, but no good because the trams were so loud. I would request a room either at the side of the hotel or in the inside of the hotel, you get a lovely peaceful sleep then. Never again would I have a room that overlooks the Square. It also had huge big windows with no Blackout curtains, this kept me awake too! We moved the next day to a different non smoking room, which was great. The Hotel Staff brought us up to look at rooms so we had the choice of the room we wanted. There is also a fire exit on each floor that allows you to smoke without having to leave the hotel, this was handy for my partner. So request a room near the fire exit if you want a smoke. Also, I was told theres 2/3 hotel rooms with balconys that you can smoke on. You will need to request these rooms, but they are on the front of the hotel, overlooking Dam Square. The Dam Plaza is part of the hotel but fairly expensive, the food is outstanding. I'm so fussy but there was not one thing I could fault with that food. Burgers, Chicken, Steak, Fish - all gorgeous. The Room Service is spot-on too. The Dam Burger is very srcummy! The bathroom is very nice, modern and clean. You can listen to the TV in the bathroom as it has speakers. Great Bath and shower. Sheets are changed every 2 days. Fresh towels when you want etc. The Dam Plaza also have a small Bar now, which was only put in this year, 2008! Because we are planning to go back this Xmas, the receptionist has given me her email address so we can book a room through her, she is going to save us a really nice quiet room with Blackout Curtains. I love my sleep. I wouldn't dare try any other hotel in Amsterdam. It's not cheap there to stay, but I'm sure you will have a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Paddy40
Reviews.Content: Just come back from a weekend in Amsterdam, I searched lots of website for hotels and this hotel was the best for its location and price. I booked direct with them for 166 euros per night. (Donâ€™t forget the 5% tax on top.) Me and the group of friends arrived on Friday afternoon but there was a mix up with the rooms. They couldn't have been more helpful, I booked 3 rooms originally but they only had 1 room left. So they booked my friends into another hotel for one night. They paid for the taxi's to get there and back in the morning, plus they upgraded us all for the rest of our stay. The rooms we stayed in were Business rooms which were ok, what you expect in any city business hotel. They are clean and have all you need for a weekend city break. The hotel is located on Dam sq and everything is minutes away !!! All in all, the hotel is clean, all the fancy toiletries in the bathroom, robes etc. The hotel staffs are very friendly and were always helpful to us. A very nice city hotel!!! I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Big rooms”
Reviews.Author: Irini_Alex
Reviews.Content: Great central location right on Damrak street, Dam square. Big rooms (no view the ones we stayed in), king size bed, clean bathroom, nice business center. Breakfast with extra charge of 20euro per person. Very firendly staff.

Reviews.Title: “Mind the noise!”
Reviews.Author: 4kingacehole
Reviews.Content: So, we arrived in Amsterdam via the train from the airport. Took us about 10-15 minutes Walking from the station to the hotel, But we didnâ€™t mind because it was an exciting walk. The front desk staff was friendly and recommended a few spots around town. The actual room was definitely small (But small is what you get in Europe). We were facing an alley on the side of the hotel. It got very noisy in the alley at night with people walking through the alley early in the morning, etc. Also, there was a street sweeper that went through the alley very early in the morning, so it was very hard to get a decent sleep each night. Also, the air flow in the room was non-existent so it got hot in the room. We are used to sleeping with a fan in our room back home, so it was either extremely quiet with the window closed, or very noisy with it open. Other than that though, the hotel was fine. If you donâ€™t like a lot of late night noise I wouldnâ€™t recommend staying in or around Dam Square. Itâ€™s literally ALWAYS busy with large crowds at all hours. Some recommendations for food: There is a pancake house a few blocks away in Jordan called â€œSaraâ€™s Pancake Houseâ€�. Awesome Waffles. We ate there twice. For Mexican, good drinks: Roseâ€™s Cantina. Amazing dinner experience. We also found a Indonesian restaurant with a beautiful outside terrace on the same street as Roseâ€™s Cantina. Highly recommended. Would stay at Swissotel again, but only if it was located in a quieter part of town!

Reviews.Title: “Location and Size”
Reviews.Author: PerthBouy
Reviews.Content: Located within walking distance of everthing, I was very surprised by the Swissotel. Being my first time to Europe, people had told me that the rooms were small and pokey. I found the room big even to Australian standards. The service was excellent, the staff very friendly and helpful. I would recommend this hotel to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel but needs some improvements”
Reviews.Author: TheRedSquirrel
Reviews.Content: Positives: Unbeatable location, good-sized room with plenty of storage and all the amenities you could want. The bed is large and comfortable. Bathroom with separate bath and shower, good water pressure, nice toiletries. The reception staff are friendly and helpful. Free internet access + printing in the business centre. Negatives: Old windows which let a lot of noise in. Not recommended if you're a light sleeper. Breakfast is expensive (20 euros), there are better alternatives nearby. I was disappointed by the randomness of the maid service. My room had turn-down service included but I didn't get it every evening. The staff also ignored "do not disturb" signs. I've stayed in other Swissotels and I've never experienced such poor service before. Summary: a good hotel, I will stay here again. Hopefully they'll have ugraded the windows and re-trained the housekeeping staff by then!

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: EurotravelerTO
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 4 nights in May. It is in an ideal location to enjoy the city. We debated between saying at the Marriott or the Pulitzer, and chose the Swissotel mainly because of its location right on Dam Square. We had a business room, and initially they tried to put us in a room with a little step out balcony on Dam Square. We complained about the noise, and were given a nicer room in the back of the hotel. Our view was of McDonaldâ€™s and Burger King. Both closed at 11:00 PM and the room was nice and quiet, and we thoroughly enjoyed our stay. We ate the hotel breakfast 3 of the 4 mornings, it was fine although not cheap. The bottom line for us was to be able to walk to lots of great restaurants, the train station, and all the other local sights. The room was nice, and the hotel staff accommodating. There was a flower in the room, a welcoming bottle of wine, and other surprise nice little touches. The hotel also saved a lot of money compared to the Marriott and Pulitzer. Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, fantastic location”
Reviews.Author: Willjd
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel from 22nd - 24th June and to be honest i dont think we could have chosen a better place. Not just because of the rooms but also because of the location. To be honest when you are away you only spend a few hours in teh hotel and to sleep there. The hotel is located right next to dam square on the main road (DAMRAK) to the centraal station. It is about a 10 minute walk (with luggage) from the station. To get to the station from teh airport is 7.60 euos (from a machine) or 8.60 from the counter and takes about 15/20 mins. So from the airport you can be in your hotel room in about 30 mins with no hassles at all. The hotel itself was clean and new and had everything that you would want from a stay there. We had a king sized bed, TV with uk channels and satelite channels, coffee machine and a nice bathroom. Our bedroom was on the side of the hotel (not facing the main road) however there was good double glazed windows and we didnt get any noise at all. If you had a road facing room you may get noise but couldnt say for sure. We didnt get breakfast included and for 20 euros there are cheaper places around. All in all a great place to stay and the location couldnt be better.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: VCG
Reviews.Content: Location is absolutely fantastic. Bang on Dam Square. Cannot get more central. I got a good deal from the hotel website for 125 euros. Which for this hotel in this location is amazing. Everything else was above 200. I booked a standard room and when I got in paid 40 euros extra to upgrade to a superior room. A tip: on the website the superior room was 225 but I paid 40 extra so got it for only 165. So if you want to upgrade do it at the counter. 2nd tip: the superior is not that much superior to the standard room so dont waste the extra money. Room was large size for european standards. For some reason there was not enough lighting in the room. Here is the strange thing. This was a superior room and the TV was a 14 inch small one. I wonder why they have not upgraded the TVs. The best part about the hotel is the location. It is on the main Dam square. There are bars, cafes and restaurants all around. You can walk to the hotel from the central station. Another place in Amsterdam to go for good bars and restaurants is Leidseplien. It about 5 tram stops away and tram costs 1.60 per trip. This is a great hotel to stay at the price. Check on the website. They always have good deals.

Reviews.Title: “Spot on!”
Reviews.Author: Montydog
Reviews.Content: If you have read any of my other reviews you will know I can be merciless about my opinions on bad hotels. This place gets top marks. It is a straight forward 3 star hotel in a central location. The staff are professional to a fault. Food good. Meeting room fine. Bedroom nice. Is it a 5 star world class, hot property? No - but I give it top marks because it is exactly what it says on the tin. I have already booked myself back in for next week - there was no point in trying anything else. I have stayed at the Ibis by Central Station - fine for a budget stay and good location - but no meeting room which I needed. Sofitel Amsterdam is great but over budget for this trip. Krasnapolski is lovely (opposite Swissotel)- but again too dear for this trip but I am staying there in October again as I like it. Well done Swissotel you get my vote!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Awesome Staff”
Reviews.Author: leemd1
Reviews.Content: As mentioned in other reviews you could not ask for a better location in Amsterdam than the Swissotel. It is close to everything from shopping to attractions and restaurants. The best thing about this hotel is their terrific staff. The staff is extremely knowable, courteous and helpful. They cater to their guests. There is nothing that they wont do to make your stay enjoyable. I emailed the hotel 2 days prior to my arrival and they were able to check me into my room by 11AM. The rooms look exactly as they appear on the website. They are extremely clean with nice furnishings. The window does open and when closed they are soundproof. I was in a premium room. The one flaw of the hotel is that the classic and premium rooms are very small. As noted on the website they are no more than 200 sq ft. However, they are nicely furnished and the small space is utilized very well. Housekeeping is excellent. The wireless internet connection was not working and you should bring your own ethernet cord for the wired connection which is 15 euros/24 hours. It worked great. The bathroom was small but very clean with the usual bath ammenities. Note that the bar of soap given is the size of a half dollar so you should pack your own. The water pressure was excellent with plenty of hot water. I used the well equipted gym facilities everyday and the business center offers free internet and printing for guests. There is a large supermarket 3 blocks away. I would definately stay here again for all the reasons mentioned. This is a very good 4 star hotel. The pictures on the Swissotel website are extremely accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: edinm
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for four nights just after new year. The hotel was very centrally located, with Amsterdam being very easy to get around, even by walking. The reception staff were very friendly and helpful. On checking in we were informed that we had been upgraded to the business suite. We had previously decided not to pay the extra for the upgrade as from what we could see, the only differences were room size and a coffee machine. We never saw the standard rooms on our trip. The room was fantastic, very big with an amazing bathroom. Great toiletries, very warm and powerful shower, quick to run bath and large space. Great views from our room of dam square, very easy to use heating system, complimentary half bottle of wine and toblerones, as well as mini toblerones on the pillow every night. We took a room service breakfast which was absolutely delicious, delivered on time and more than I could possibly manage. I do reccomend putting your do not disturb sign on the door untill you are ready to get up as the maid repeatedly rang our door until we did one morning. The downsides, overall it was all very clean but the cushions and throw which we found in a cupboard were definitely not and clearly are not cleaned for long periods of time, we just didn't use them. We were on the first floor right above the reception and this may have been the main downside, we heard a lot of noise at night untill the trams stopped and there was a busker on the saturday night. I still slept well, so assuming you are not bothered about early nights then this shouldn't be a problem. Alternatively, ask for a higher up room which may be quieter or one atthe back which will lack the nice views. Overall, its great value for money, great rooms, great location, great staff. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great quick trip”
Reviews.Author: tahiti0308
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel 2 nights, Mar 8-10. It was in a great location and we walked from the train station to the hotel for check in. The rooms were very well appointed and the service was good as well. It is a little pricey, but then again I noticed that most hotels were with similar amenities. Unfortunately for us the weather was terrible. It rained and was very windy! We we walked in the bad weather and got soaked, but I can see where this would be a fabulous city in the spring/summer! Despite all this we had a fabulous time and Swissotel was very accommodating and we certainly would stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Delightful stay... in heart of the city!”
Reviews.Author: Digbyzinho
Reviews.Content: The hotel LOCATION @ Dam Square is simple the best you can have ... in middle of Amsterdam (you can stroll freely even into red light district at night if you want, as it is walking distance far from the hotel), besides there are cable car stops just off the hotel entrance for all museums and parks.... What else? The Swiss Hotel certainly knows how to treat their customers making they feel very special! From checking-in to checking-out everything was perfect, and the customer service was very special, paying attention for every detail.... We like the most: * the unexpected room upgrade! * the Nespresso machine in the room, just for us! * the complimentary wine, chocolate and bathrobe... * the cleanliness of the room, spotless! * the roomservice was so quick that surprised us... * the hotel manager call us on the room just to welcome us and to check if everything was in order * two weeks after our stay the Swiss Hotel staff call us home (in Brazil) to make a survey (interview)... they would like to know where they can improve, and this is a HARD question, because I thinks they are very close to PERFECION!

Reviews.Title: “fantastic service, excellent hotl.”
Reviews.Author: laurieadams
Reviews.Content: A big thank you to Claudia and the staff at Swisshotel, who couldnâ€™t have made our stay more comfortable. My husband and I were on our honeymoon and travelled from Paris ( 5 night stay ) to Amsterdam ( 5 night stay ). In Paris my husband was really ill with bronchitis and I fell ill in Amsterdam - while at the Swissotel. Staff facilitated a doctor call out and we had an upgrade too. Nothing was too much! I would definitely stay at the swissotel again - although a little pricey of room only. It was well worth all our pennies we paid for it especially if you need to spend time in a hotel room. Suffice to say, our room bound stay in the novatel Paris was no match! Thanks again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with excellent service”
Reviews.Author: DMC_fr
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the Swiss the last WE of Feb (standard double room). Advantages: - excellent view onto the Dam Square even in a standard room - clean recently renovated room - perfect concierge and room service

Reviews.Title: “Recommended...”
Reviews.Author: SactoScuba
Reviews.Content: Overview: We loved the hotel, the room was comfortable and the location was very good. Pros; 1) Location was great. Just a five minute walk from the central station, tram stop just outside the front door. Easy to walk to all the major central amsterdam sites. 2) Its clean and comfortable. Cons: 1) No slippers and just one scratchy bathrobe in the room. 2) Crazy expensive for internet (it was 17 euros day?). Summary: Lots to do and see nearby. If you want to visit a coffeeshop I highly recommend Abraxis. It is like 1-2 blocks from the hotel. We did not try the restaurant - there were too many choices nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Another nice stay at the swissotel”
Reviews.Author: yariv1
Reviews.Content: Stayed a night at the middle of January, booked through website, and confirmed by phone to the hotel, to ensure I get the room I wanted (one of those that have a small balcony overlooking the dam square ). The room was decent sized, modern and very comfortable and, although on the 1st floor, I barely noticed the noise from the busy street. Hotel desk and concierge service was also extremley friendly and professional. Only downside was that the small balcony was partly blocked, so could not step out. Overall, a great hotel in an excellent location, and, as usual, great VFM. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mcgovemr
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel on the basis that it was very central. I found the staff to be helpful and friendly. The room was big with Super king size bed. Room service was excellant. Food was also great. Overall a great stay. One drawback would be the view from our room, but this is to be expected in a very central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Hotel, Fab Location, Fab Trip!”
Reviews.Author: traveller1821
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel from 1/1/08 until the 4/1/08. Flew from Liverpool with EasyJet who were great both ways and really good value. When we arrived in amsterdam, we got a train from the airport to central station which was 5 Euros - much cheaper than a taxi and completely idiot proof! From the station we walked straight down Damrak until we reached the Swissotel at the bottom (about a ten minute walk). When we got there the external look of the hotel was good and the reception was also well presented with welcoming staff. The room wasn't quite ready being new years day and the guests not really leaving promptly! However, they didn't hesitate to store our bags for us while we went for a walk in the meantime. When we went back an hour later the room was ready and because we had been so patient we got a free upgrade which was great! The room was huge with a mini dressing room, a lounge area, a huge bed and a bathroom with jacuzzi bath and big shower as well as dressing gowns and slippers! What could we say...fantastic! Breakfast was expensive at the hotel but there were loads of places to eat around as the location was so central. The tram and bus stops are right outside the front door and trams are cheap and take you everywhere. By the way, although the trams and buses ran outside the hotel and it is situated on the main high street... you can hardly hear a thing of the outside. The department store opposite the hotel is really good too... like a Danish Selfridges. Definately worth a visit if you like that sort of thing! If your going before the summer and want to visit the Heineken Experience... its shut until summer, wish someone had told us! Other places worth a visit are the red light district (an eye opener, how the other half live!), Anne Franks House, Artis Zoo, walking the canals, BoomChicago (Leidsplein - comedy show), outdoor ice skating, flower market, cafes :-) and loads more! All in all a fab city break recommended to anyone of any age!

Reviews.Title: “Great Christmas Break at Swissotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Visitor330
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas period for 5 nights in superior double room. Hotel staff from receptional desk to restaurant staff were all friendly and very helpful. Rooms were clean with excellent bathroom with separate shower cubicle. Lovely to receive complimentary wine, toblerone and water in room on arrival. Breakfast was also very good with everything you could really want. Room was located on top floor - was extremely warm even with window open. Not sure air-con was really working correctly in room. Very central location but no noise at night to disturb your sleep. Would definately stay here again and recommend this hotel when in amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: peterboxall
Reviews.Content: very good hotel,b/fast was of a very high standard the rooms were very clean.but one word of warning this is a smoking hotel,they do have to non smoking rooms which you must ask for we did not known this hense a very smelly room,the staff were very helpful, and its in a great location [right on dam square] and not far from the station

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: catsmom1
Reviews.Content: Great hotel...Had 2 connecting rooms. Rooms were clean and hotel was centrally located. One block from red light district. Hotel staff was very helpful with information. Would definitely stay at this hotel again and actually we are planning on it again next summer.

Reviews.Title: “The Balcony on Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: AgentJim
Reviews.Content: We decided to stay for five nights in Dam Square this our second trip to Amsterdam. We chose the Swissotel, and we upgraded from a Standard room to Superior. We took the Connexion shuttle from the Airport and a "hotel reserved taxi" back all went well. Room: #217 wasn't ready when we arrived at Noon ,but was soon after. is one of a few that's has a balcony (small enough for 2 to stand out on) that overlooks Dam Square and its a beautiful view, people everywhere.From where I could see there were no more hotels with this. Room was well appointed with Comfortable bed (not like the Marriott but good enough), good linens and a separate downstairs landing when you come in the and you could never hear any hallway noise. Good bathroom except little counter space, HOT steamy shower, safe, good closet space, desk. Room is actually on 3rd floor. Tips; I Amsterdam card. If you stay busy and like to tour its the way to go. Learn to use the trams, as they are easy quick. Rent a GPS (from City Navigators) while we watched numerous people trying to figure out maps we walked from place to destination w/out hardly ever a mis-step. Watching the kids Ice skate in Leidseplein Sq. .Get To Anne Frank House early and miss the crowds. The Good: Balcony overlooking Dam Sq, Balconies are few here in the Dam but almost unheard of overlooking Dam Sq. The Staff as wonderful as they will attend to your needs. We felt security to be excellent at this hotel. You need your card to enter the elevator and staff is always present. Very clean Hotel as well. Excellent e-mail communication with hotel staff before arrived and helped us with all of our needs. Not so Good; Its a Loud room and you have to be okay with that going in.Run the ac/heat on High and it cuts out most of the noise. Weather last time we went it was July and there is no comparison to Winter. Its costs a lot more to go in Summer and I can see why, its as much the long hours of daylight as it is the temperature. Like many shower only baths water runs out in to bathroom floor quickly , the shower is so good its hard to turn off. Room never did get warm above 65 degrees. After our second trip to Amsterdam I would say we easily prefer Leidseplein to Dam Square. I also have to compare the Swissotel to the Marriott. If we had to choose it would be Marriott due to wanting to be in Leidseplein and its generally a better area to us than Dam Sq. Bed was more comfortable at Marriott. We would still Highly recommend the Swissotel for people wanting to be in or near Dam Square. The Hotel is good for couples and Single travelers.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful chic hotel in the perfect location”
Reviews.Author: MissMolly40
Reviews.Content: We are just now getting around to writing this after spending a few days of our honeymoon in Amsterdam. The staff at the Swissotel was friendly and the hotel very modern and clean with comfortable rooms. The location is perfect as it sits next to Dam Square. Fantastic smoke shops, restaurants, bars, and shopping line the immediate area - you couldn't get a better location than this. We would stay here again if we have the chance. Check out the Cinema Paradiso restaurant while you're there, delicious!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Damkring”
Reviews.Author: Helzx
Reviews.Content: went and stayed at the swissotel last year and didnt have any complaints. However wasnt impressed this year. Staff werent as friendly and although rooms were clean, they were very dated. Will book somewere else next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: rooney10Belfast
Reviews.Content: Great hotel in a great location. I would reccomend the Swissotel to anyone travelling to Amsterdam. Staff were very friendly rooms were spotless and food was great. On the negative side Amsterdam is very expensive city to shop or drink in.

Reviews.Title: “Great location.”
Reviews.Author: freefly1
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Swissotel for a brief 2 night stay in Amsterdam (Sept. '07). I booked our room very last minute after deciding to switch hotels 2 days prior to our arrival most likely resulting in a rather high room rate. Amsterdam is a very expensive city when it comes to lodging however the Swissotel is worth it if you get a fairly reasonable rate. The location is perfect! It is a very easy walk from the train station to the hotel. It is right next to Dam square and a very close walk to the red light district. All of Amsterdam's tourist attractions are very close and we walked everywhere. The staff were friendly and spoke very good english. The rooms were a bit small (normal for european standards) but were clean. The Swissotel offers a nice place to relax after experiencing all of what Amsterdam has to offer. Bottom line: Location is great! Staff nice. Clean hotel. Decent but overpriced food. Quality bathroom. Safe provided. Internet access in hotel.... In all I would return to Swissotel but would not pay $517 US dollars a night (my fault for changing at last minute). If you are looking for pure luxury then do not stay here but if you just want a nice place to stay while you enjoy Amsterdam then this should work well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Superb Location”
Reviews.Author: Benjamin_S
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed in a standard double room here for 5 nights and we were pleased with The Swissotel. Transfer From the airport the train takes about 15 minutes to central station for 3.6 Euros. The hotel is about a 10-15 minute walk from central station or a 1 minute tram ride. Location Prime location, situated right on Dam Square, walking distance to all the main sights and areas. Cash machine just to the right of the main entrance. Bars, Cafes, Restaurants, Shops everywhere. Hotel Modern looking and very clean. Key cards for the lift and rooms. Room (226) Normal small sized European room but with a huge bed. Room kept fairly clean by maid service. The view was of the hotels central core so it was very quiet. Mini bar, Safe, TV, Hairdryer, extra linen in the room. Food / Drink Our breakfast was included in the style of a hot and cold Buffet. Not as much selection as other hotels we've stayed in, but what was there was very nice. It is quite expensive though and we probably would go elsewhere if it wasn't included. Staff The staff were great. On the few occassions we needed some advice and directions the staff behind the desk were extremely helpful. They always said hello and goodbye with a smile. Misc - Metro and Tram tickets can be bought from some bookshops - Be aware where the path ends and the bike lane starts. - Sights Prices: Madame Tussuads - 20Euros Van Gogh Museum - 10Euros Rijks Museum - 10Euros Anne Frank Huis - 15Euros Heineken Brewery - 11Euros Rembrandt Huis - 8Euros Overall Overall Amsterdam was a great place and we thoroughlly enjoyed exploring it. I highly recommend The Swissotel to anyone wanting a good base to to the same.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel Standard King Size room”
Reviews.Author: Wondering_Rogue
Reviews.Content: The hotel is located at Dam Square and is easy to find as is it is on the main drag from the train station. Booked this hotel last minute due to the internet discount and as last time I visited Amsterdam I was impressed by the appearance. The staff are very friendly and helpful. In my opinion the hotel is a little expensive for the room setup as its what you would expect in a travel lodge style hotel. The room was well furnished with a very large bed which is pitched as king size, but its huge. The room and bathroom is very clean and cleaned daily. Other facilities include a small but well equiped cardio gym and a "swissOffice" which gives you free access to the internet in a dedicated room with cd rom/writers and card reader drives. Good for uploading holiday snaps while away, or just emailing friends to rub it in. The hotels restuarant was excellent. expect to pay around 60 Euros for 2 main meals and a bottle of house wine, but its worth it. If I go to amsterdam again I would stay here, so if your going, book this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: benoit908
Reviews.Content: Looks are deceiving! From the outside it looks like a small thin Amsterdam building but behind and above at least 4 shop fronts the hotel becomes suprisingly big. Right opposite Dam Sq it is conveniently located and the tram stops outside taking you to the trainstation one way and Rembrandt Sq the other. The rooms are great and it is ultra modern inside with probably one of the best restaurants in the city centre on the ground floor. Would recommend it. I stayed at the Victoria Hotel the year previous and this one is the better of the two.

Reviews.Title: “Think Twice about booking this hotel.....”
Reviews.Author: dadof3boysinnj
Reviews.Content: Our family just came back from a 4 night stay at the Swiss Hotel in Amsterdam. We were booked via a travel agent. We travel with our children and our confirmation requested non smoking rooms. Upon arrival we were booked into smoking rooms on the first floor, overlooking the very busy square and McDonalds. We told the management that the rooms were unacceptable and we were told that there was "nothing else available". We told them we were going to get somthing to eat and to please try to help find a us some solution or book us into another hotel. When we arrived back from dinner they did find 2 rooms (non smoking), on the first floor, that we did check into. Soon after, we realized that the air conditioning did not properly work in our room. and was not fixed for the next 2 nights. The hotel location is good as long as you dont mind being in the middle of "The Times Square" of Amsterdam. Right ouside the door are: McDonalds, Burger King and KFC.... The staff was very nice and made some excellent restaurant and tourist choices for us. Amsterdam is small enough that I would suggest staying a few blocks further away from Dam Square, and have a bid more piece and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, convenient location”
Reviews.Author: georgiaguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights at this hotel on our first visit to Amsterdam. It turned out to be an excellent choice. We requested a quiet room on an upper floor to avoid the noise on the busy street the hotel is located on. We got a room on the top floor on the back. Fair size for a Europeon hotel. Clean and well appointed. Turn down service. Nice bath although we are not fans of the shower screens. It is just hard to keep the floor from getting all wet. Plenty of counter space in the bath. Hotel is about a easy 10 minute walk straight down the street from the train station. No need for a taxi. Located right at Dam Square. Area is a bit like Times Square in NYC. Breakfast was not included. We found the hotel breakfast too pricey and opted for crousaints, fruit and juice at a market just a few doors down from the hotel. Staff was friendly and helpful. We would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel: Few faults!”
Reviews.Author: ChrisBrighton_Hove
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Swiss Suite for 2 nights last week: The Room was excellent! The Bathroom is a joy! The bed MASSIVE! Front of House staff friendly and efficient! Two things to beware of though!: Don't purchase your breakfast from the hotel: Overpriced and every single addition, (including a cup of tea!) is charged for separately! Just walk a feww hundred metres and you'll find breakfast's of better quality at half the price! Don't smoke dope in your room: There's a 150 Euro fine! Don't even be tempted! (Those observant enough will see filters in the rooms which arelaced there to catch you out!). Chris (Hove: UK)

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: cyntul2no
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at this hotel. Joined the loyalty club and got some goodies in the room. the room was clean, average size for an european hotel. the location was good that it was central on Dam square, however we had a street facing room and sometimes the noise came in off the street. the front desk employees were very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: Captain Whalebelly
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam for six nights on a business trip. The location was fantastic - around the corner to Dam Square, and less than ten minutes on Damrak to the Central Station. Better yet, the tram stop was right outside the hotel, where frequent trams took me to all the major attractions within minutes. The RAI convention center in the suburbs was about twenty minutes away on the tram. There were dozens of shops and restaurants in easy walking distance. The hotel itself was fine. Staff were professional, knowledgable and courteous, room was a good size (for European hotels), spotlessly clean and with modern furnishings. A minor issue with the bathroom door not closing correctly was promptly fixed after I reported it. Internet connection worked well with my laptop but was pricey at 15 euros per day. Go for the wired connection - the hotel will lend you an ethernet cable if you need one. A colleague trired the wireless connection option and reported that the connection failed often. My only problem of note. The hotel lost one of my shirts from the laundry service. The hotel covered the replacement cost of the shirt as soon as I told them. Overall an enjoyable stay and a decent well run hotel in a great location for both tourists and business travellers. Would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Very average!”
Reviews.Author: drewyzacky
Reviews.Content: Nice staff. Breakfast lovely, a great selection. Small room with nothing special, quite basic but clean. Nothing much to say, just very average!

Reviews.Title: “Cheated at checkout”
Reviews.Author: Jerry44
Reviews.Content: At check-in we were told we could pay with US Dollars, for our convenience, and there would be no fee. I guess they think most people won't know to check their rate to see that they add a large exchange rate. They could care less that they lied at check-in and wouldn't change to charge me in Euros. The hotel is located on a busy street and the taxi can't let you off in front and you have to cross a busy street and with your bags, there is no doorman to help. We did have a nice room with a good view of Burger King across the alley. Also they don't seem to replenish the breakfast buffet so you have to get down early. They would be better served charging more for their rooms and being honest with their guests juma10@email.com

Reviews.Title: “great location good hotel”
Reviews.Author: doakie
Reviews.Content: booked two rooms at the swissotel dam square , had a great stay . staff were very nice and helpful , the rooms were both spacious and modern with good sound proofiing. only complaint would be although the breakfast was good the cost of 35 euro was a bit high.

Reviews.Title: “loved it”
Reviews.Author: sscMichigan_Usa
