Reviews.Content: We were so happy we stayed here. The suite we stayed in had a large sitting room, bedroom, and nice bathroom. The view was great and overall the suite was beautiful. Great location, comfortable beds, large & clean bathroom, attentive service, felt new and modern. I will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Worth a Stay”
Reviews.Author: Olos
Reviews.Content: We had a suite for 3 nights . Excellent location. Taxis however canâ€™t stop in front of the hotel, so you have to bring all your luggage over the road that have heavy traffic (tram, cars, cycles and of course lots of pedestrians). We were a party of 5 even then the check in was speedy, perhaps a bit too speedy. For Amsterdam the price and size of the rooms was as expected (small rooms big price), breakfast was not included. Well maintained everything was working properly. Narrow hallway with cupboards ending in the living room. The living room had a writing desk, small coffee table a couple of chairs and a sofa. The TV in the living room was surprisingly small. The bedroom was quite large, more cupboards, TV and radio. The bathroom was surprisingly large with separate toilette and shower stall. Wooden floors in the living room, carpeted floors in the bedroom and tiles (walls and floors) in the bathroom. Turndown service every night, with the little chocolate on the pillow and bed rugs (a very nice touch). Bathrobes and somewhat liberal choice of amenities. Big soft towels and real water pressure. Requests were promptly completed. An overall pleasant experience.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Yet In Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: I_Love_Amsterdam
Reviews.Content: I can only agree with all the other posts. The Swissotel is one awesome hotel. This being my 5th visit to Dam it is the best hotel yet. Check in as usual took some time but the staff were friendly and helpful. I had booked two superior non-smoking rooms and asked for king size beds with views of the Damrak. I wasn't disappointed. Both rooms 115 (mine) and 311 (family member) were overlooking the Damrak the National Monument. The rooms were a good size for Amsterdam and were spotless. They were cleaned promptly every day before 10am. My room was on the same floor of the Swiss Office which was very handy for the free PC and internet access. When 2 of the Pc' broke they were fixed in no time at all. I didn`t use the mini-bar,room service or the restaurant so can`t comment, but the room service menu was quite extensive for once ,beware phone calls to UK 0870 number are expensive. To summarise not the cheapest of hotels. I paid 205 Euro per night,per room booked via the trusted www.booking.com but worth every penny. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. Please feel free to contact me.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: BeaglePup
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Room 615 (junior suite) at the Swissotel for 4 nights in April 20-24, 2007. We initially requested an early check in if possible (12 pm), as our 26-hr flight from Australia arrived in Amsterdam at 10 am. However, as the hotel's check out policy was 12 pm, the receptionist informed us on our arrival at 12 pm that our room was not quite ready and kindly requested us to either have lunch at the hotel restaurant or stroll around the Dam Square till 2-3pm. While travel weary, we were all right with this given their check out policy, and walked around Damrak and then had lunch at the hotel restaurant. At 2 pm, the receptionist advised us that the room was ready and were shown into our room...Room 615. The wait was worth it! The entire room was clean and spacious: separate lounge/living area with Nespresso espresso machine which made beautiful coffee, separate bedroom with a king bed (always looked forward to the turndown service with the chocolates!), flat TV & DVD player, and a large bathroom with a separate shower and toilet. Bvulgari toiletries, hotel bathrobes & slippers were also provided. The soundproofed windows in the living and bedroom areas had nice views of the Dam Square below. The room is located in a quiet corner on the top level. We had booked via the hotel's website and the rate did not inclue breakfast (which cost around 18 EUR pp). We only had breakfast at the hotel once (the usual buffet breakfast offerings). There are many other restaurants nearby Swissotel which offer English Breakfast, etc for only about 5.95 EUR. Overall, the service was excellent, the room clean and pleasing and the location is right in the city centre! Also, internet access is complimentary in its business centre - unlike other 4-star hotels that we've stayed in recently in Europe (where you have to pay a measly 0.65 EUR per minute!). We will defiinitely be returning to Swissotel Amsterdam!

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: lordgrantly
Reviews.Content: Overpriced and noisy if you are facing the square. Location is good but surrounds are not attractive. Most staff were helpful. However, breakfast staff questioned us when we wanted a cup of water for our baby (we did not get breakfast included, even though I had ordered breakfast when I spoke to the reservations staff). We paid â‚¬260 a night. We usually spend this and get so much more for our money, even in London! Have low expectations and you will not leave disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: fishyUk
Reviews.Content: Me and my wife have just come back from a three night weekend break in Amsterdam. We stayed at the Swissotel and we were so happy with the choice. We had booked a standard room and when we arrived 1230 the room was not ready, it was sorted by 1500 and although we did not haggle or kick up a fuss we were upgraded to a junior suite. The room was huge with a great bathroom, a bed that must have been 7' square and five windows overlooking Dam Square. The standard of the room, the quality of the overall hotal and most of all the service were absolutely excellent. If you are going to Amsterdam for a holiday and are looking for a great hotel in a central location I could not recommend it highly enough.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Swissotel”
Reviews.Author: karenmargaret
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Swissotel for 3 nights in April. Excellent location at Dam square right in the centre of things. Excellent rooms and satff, would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chele80
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as others we had looked at were full up. I was very impressed with the service - we received 2 free canal tour tickets (whether they were for my birthday or not we didnt ask), and the computer also sang happy birthday to me on the actual day. Room service is excellent with a good choice and the mini bar has a good selection at not bad prices for a hotel. We had a direct phone number to the room. Housekeeping was excellent and a very quick turnaround and everything was spotless. There was also a good fan/air conditioning unit in the room. We stayed in 119 which faces the side street, but there is no noise at night. Excellent location and breakfast buffet service with eggs, bacon, sausage, beans, croissants, cereal, meats, breads and juices as well as tea and coffee.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and Outstanding service”
Reviews.Author: spunge411
Reviews.Content: We wanted a hotel with a Dam Square view. the NH Kranpolsky was booked...so we decided on the Swissotel. What a great choice!!! the Service was impecable, and the veiw was amazing. We could see the Obelisk and the trams passing by. The Beds were always turned down, and the room service was quick. The staff were friendly, welcoming and very helpful. From Centraal Station, the hotel is a 5 min walk, or a quick tram ride. If breakfast is not included in your rate, the price for the buffet is a bit steep..17euros a person. that was the ONLY drawback. Art the reservationist at the hotel will confirm and perfectly describe your room to you.

Reviews.Title: “Trouble in paradise Swiss Hotel was awful”
Reviews.Author: awful_swiss_hotel
Reviews.Content: The Swiss Hotel is very centrally located and hence the price. My wife and I stayed for three nights. The superior room was very small and would be comparable to a good three star hotel. Whilst it was generally clean there were the odd things that would put you off. - Food from someone's room service was lying in the corridor that must of fell off from the cleaning and was left all day. - The noise from the outside extraction fans for the buildings air conditioning was very loud. - My wife found a pubic hair in the freshly made bed. - I was expecting a queen sized bed (as advertised) and what we got was two single matresses pushed together with a big ridge down the middle of the bed. - The bathroom was so small that you very nearly bang your elbows moving around it. I also found the finishing around the bath was a little dirty/tatty. I made a complaint to the manager about the matress and the fact that I had paid for a superior room and was expecting a decent bed and they point blank refused to give me any discount. They apologised but it was still an awful hotel. Would not recommend this hotel, definately not worth the money, avoid like the plague.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Location, Don't Smoke Cannabis in Room”
Reviews.Author: Harry1956
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the Swissotel in January 2006 and smoked cannabis in the room with no problem. I again stayed for 10 days in January 2007. On the second day of my stay, the manager and a woman from the front desk banged on my door stating the smoke detector was stuck. They entered the room and discovered a joint. They said a 150 euros cleaning fee would be assessed and if any further infraction occurred that the police would be summoned. I later noticed a small sign on the front desk announcing their drug policy, but did not see it on check in. I would think a warning would have been more appropriate. By the time I checked out 8 days later, there was no smell whatsoever in the room, but the hotel refused to deduct the 150 euros cleaning fee. So be warned.

Reviews.AuthorLocation: San Juan, Puerto Rico, Miami, Florida or New York City, NY
Reviews.Title: “You wont find a better combination in Amsterdam - location, amenities and value”
Reviews.Author: DiegoEsq
Reviews.Content: I have been traveling to Amsterdam for many years and have stayed at what I thought were the best hotels (Krasnapolsky, Grand Demure, Amstel, Victoria, Jolly, Golden Tulip, l'Europe, etc.). This past week I decided to go celebrate my 33rd birthday with a group of 20 friends from Puerto Rico, the U.S. and London and wanted to try a different hotel. I was looking for a decent place, at least four starts and centrally located, but that it would not cost me 1200 euros per room for just three nights (the trip was on me and I knew we would rarely use the room). Thus, I booked rooms at the Swissotel through bookings.nl at a pretty good price (498 euros for a standard room for three nights and 689 euros for the suites). When more people wanted to come to the trip and the hotel appeared to be sold out using the online travel sites they contacted the hotel directly and they gave them the same rate I got. I must mention that the attention and service via email while doing the reservations directly with the hotel was outstanding (thanks Ms. Schutte). Even the concierge emailed me giving suggestions for restaurants and answered most of my follow up questions. It sounded too good to be true so I kept some cancellable reservations at five star hotel where I had stayed many times before across the square just in case that we did not like the hotel. However, upon arrival, the service was as expected, they had most rooms ready for early check-in. The hotel is perfectly located in Dam Square, five meters from the tram stop! and the best thing is that you cant hear any noise in the rooms despite the location!!! The rooms were comfortable and had all the amenities customary of a four star hotel (what we are accustomed in the U.S.). The service, its worth repeating, was impeccable. Everyone had an amazing time and the hotel was one of the highlights. To anyone traveling to Amsterdam; solo, couples or as a group I think you will be pleased with the Swissotel.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Viclou1980
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the hotel in February 2007. Overall i found the hotel to be excellent. Firstly the location of the hotel is ideal. It is next to Dam square and all the sights were in walking distance, I never used trams or taxis once. And i easily walked from Centraal station to the hotel and found it with minimal effort. Secondly the room (i stayed in a superior room) was very clean, tidy and massive. I'd ordered a double room but the bed had to be king size. The room was cleaned every day we were there and was spotless. The room i stayed in didn't have much of a view but that didn't bother me at all. There was no noise at all at night time from outside. The staff are very friendly and helpful, they supplied maps etc. Finally I never ate in the hotel so I can't comment on the food. I would return to this hotel if every returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: MosesGloucestershire
Reviews.Content: Well situated hotel - particularly in respect of access to public transport. Modern spacious rooms, attractively decorated - light and bright. Noisy square, but good double glazing makes this no problem. Nicely appointed small bathroom. The real plus is the reception staff - they smile all the time and are genuinely eager to please and help. Restaurants in the immediate vicinity are nothing special- but staff will advise on better ones a little further afield which is no problem with the excellent transport system. Well recommended

Reviews.Title: “Good location, average service/accommodation”
Reviews.Author: richardlondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is in a great location, near the central station, although there is major construction outside as they build the new metro in Amsterdam. I stayed in a 'business advantage room'. The room was quite large and spotlessly clean however it looked quite dated and was very average in terms of presentation. I felt the breakfast was poor value and badly presented. When I arrived breakfast still had an hour to run, but there was only a limited selection of items remaining.

Reviews.Title: “Great location by Dam Square”
Reviews.Author: GXresident
Reviews.Content: This hotel is so easy to get to, it is about a 5 minute walk from the Central Station. The reception is airy and light and the staff are very welcoming. Security is good - you can only get to the upper floors via your room key pad to access the lift. We had a room on the back of the building, the view was only of a flat roof but it was so quiet. The bed was one of the largest and most comfortable I have ever slept in (believe me, I'm really funny about strange beds - I have been known to sleep on a sheet on the floor rather than risk the bed!!) and the bathroom was spacious with a very invigorating shower. Good range of toileteries as well. The room was spotless, modern and comfortable - just how I like them. There is a small gym for the use of residents which is more than adequate and which provides masses of towels and a water dispenser, we only once had one other person in there A Nespresso machine in the room was great for my husband but hopeless for me as a tea drinker. I asked for a kettle and one was delivered to the room within 5 minutes, typical of the excellent 'can do' attitude of all the staff with whom we had dealings. There is a tram stop immediately outside the hotel, the No 4 tram took us straight to RAI, the exhibition centre, where we were based for 3 days. Get the tram ticket strip from reception before you board, good value at 6.70 Euros for 15 units - the RAI is 3 units each way. There is a wonderful department store opposite, couldn't cope with the name but it starts with Bj... a cross between John Lewis and Selfridges and had we not had a busy business diary I would have spent a serious amount of time in there! The location of the hotel is marvellous, very central and easy to get to anywhere, but you do need a good map when you are just wandering around and a good pair of shoes with thick soles would help as well, the cobbles are quite unforgiving on your feet. Also take great care when crossing the roads, the cyclists have all been brought up to believe that they are kings of the road and very few bikes seem to have brakes! We will definitely stay at the Swissotel again and I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Geniune Service!”
Reviews.Author: Zury
Reviews.Content: We arrived very early and was informed that our room was not ready. I've notified them twice that we were going to have an early arrival but still not acknowledged. The receptionist was very sincere and tried his best to get us a room and while we waited, he reassured us over and over again he was trying his best to get someone to clean up our room. The waiting was worth it! We were upgraded (having a swissotel member account helped I think), the room was superb, spacious (not the typical small room you'd expect) and clean. I've been to a lot of places and stayed in a lot of hotels, this is the first hotel I consider the top of the class in service! The first time I read the reviews on Swissotel Amsterdam and people were talking about their great service, I thought that well, it should be a standard that we expect from all high class hotels, but its different here, we really felt their genuine efforts to please and try their best to make us welcomed and comfortable. We were not dissapointed. The location was also a plus, since it was smack in the middle of the old town, no matter where we go its still near to the hotel. One advice though, its better to get breakfast outside where there's plenty of cafes which serves breakfast far more cheaper.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: Hillpudlian
Reviews.Content: We go to Amsterdam a couple of times a year and have stayed in different hotels almost every time. The Swissotel is probably the best one we have stayed in. The location is unbeatable being right in Dam Square. The hotel is nicely trendy without being austere and the rooms are a nice size. The showers are incredibly powerful and vey invigorating the morning after a heavy night out! The buffet breakfast was also very good and was good value as it was included in our rate. On the whole, I would highly recommend it and will be returning here at some point.

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel, an excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: pigeonpants
Reviews.Content: Great hotel, fabulous central location, staff very helpful and friendly. Excellent value for money. Was a brilliant choice for New Year and will definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: NJTravelerNj
Reviews.Content: Amsterdam, Netherlands - Swissotel Date: August 2006 Reviewer: A TripAdvisor Member from New Jersey Great location right in the heart of the city, and very close to the main train station. Only thing was that they did not have a breakfast included. I prefer hotels that offer a breakfast, this cuts down on time spent searching for food during my vacation. The rooms were very clean and tastefully decorated. Very comfortable bed. Well ventilated non-smoking room. Staff spoke perfect english, and they were very nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “What a great hotel!”
Reviews.Author: windvalley
Reviews.Content: The Swissotel was perfect for our stay. The central location in Dam Square was superb and the rooms were comfortable and even though ours was on the first floor facing Dam Sq, it was very quiet (thanks to sound-proofing). The front desk staff was very helpful. We had not made any Christmas Eve dinner reservations and a young Dutch lady at the front desk was very friendly and helpful in finding us a nice place to have dinner. She was very personable and chatty. The hotel had a free (in Europe you generally have to pay for Internet service, even at hotels) internet and even printing. My boyfriend used the gym once and said it wasnt anything to rave about but it definitely did not put a damper on our stay at the Swissotel. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!! loved it”
Reviews.Author: lauren1603
Reviews.Content: well what can i say?! after reading the reviews of the swissotel amsterdam, me and my boyfriend were really looking forward to going!!! and boy did it live up to our expecations!! we only had a standard room, but even that was great! so clean and well decorated! and the bathroom was black marble and just beautiful. the hotel was clean, modernly decorated and just fabulous, and the staff were more than helpful and very friendly. the ajoining resurant Dam plaza served great food for an excellent price..recommended!. room looked out on to dam square, excellent!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good choice !!!”
Reviews.Author: alicetye
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swisshotel in Aug 2006 and have no regrets at all. Excellent location near the station, good breakfast and clean room, although smaller than what we expected. Overall, i will recommend this hotel if your main purpose is tourism.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel Centrally located”
Reviews.Author: kayoticworld
Reviews.Content: Me and my fiancee stayed at this hotel in sept 2005. Our trip in Brussels was cut a day short over an error with the hotel we stayed at there. So I called the Swissotel and inquired about coming a day earlier. They were very understanding and let us have the current rate for the extra day that we already had(airline rate) The hotel staff were very courteous and helpful and always greated us when we came in. The room was very nice and modern. We felt that the room was an adequate size. The bathroom was also nice. The only complaint(not really a complaint) was that our room faced the brick wall of the neighboring building. The Hotel is as good as it gets as far as location(Dam Square, very heart of Amsterdam). I know Amsterdam has great public transportation, but we opted to walk everywhere. Amsterdam is very compact city and i mean we walked..... to the Van Gogh Mueseum,Anne Frank house, Red light District, Heineken Museum.... just to name a few. All of these places were no more than a 20min walk from this hotel. This also gave us the oppurtunity to see the city and get off the tourist track.The hotel also has free internet access(2nd floor I believe), expresso machines and a mini bars in each room. To save some money we walked to the market(cannot remember the name) its in the direction of the main train station, and bought meat, bread, chips etc. All and all we had a great experience at this hotel. The next time(believe me there will be a next time) we go back to Amsterdam I will definetely stay at the Swissotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AC15
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the swiss hotel for 3 nights in august and i can't say enough about it. Hotel was v clean, brill location and the staff went above and beyond to be helpful. highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice for Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: 24Hour
Reviews.Content: In a city of tiny hotel rooms at large prices, this hotel is a good bet. The rooms are not huge but they are Ok sized and comfortable and the have good sized bathrooms and the rooms have everything you need. This is part of the Raffles group and it is sad that their Asian hotels offer so much more for the same price.... But Swisshotel is a good choice in Amsterdam. The concierge is pleasant but not particularly knowledgeable.

Reviews.Title: “Very Central”
Reviews.Author: paty1
Reviews.Content: Me and husband and my 2 year old daughter stayed in this very central and friendly hotel. The rooms are modern and very confortable (I stayed in a superior room). The staff from Reception and Restaurant very friendly. In case I return to Amsterdam I will certanly stay there again, since it is very central and close to everything.

Reviews.Title: “more and less”
Reviews.Author: andrepma7
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good, however i was checked in with 2 hours of delay and they tried to charge me 60 euros of local phone calls that i never made. The staff was quite arrogant. I would think twice before booking there again. I had just came from Le Yaca St Tropez which was a very good hotel and great staff.

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Paulreedsmith
Reviews.Content: Can't praise this hotel enough. Easily the best i have stayed in for its price. Classed on here as 3 Star although i would give it somewhere between a 4 and 5. The location is excellent. Almost opposite the Royal palace and 3 minute walk from the red light district. Top Marks!

Reviews.Title: “Good location but a bit business like”
Reviews.Author: Lindaben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here from 6/28-7/8 and had a lovely time. The hotel is in a great location, tram is right out front and it was very quiet. The best thing is that they are one of the few hotels in Amsterdam to have air conditioning. It was in the mid 80's and we met other travelers who had uncomfortable nights in other hotels due to the heat. We paid around $200 for the room through Expedia. The staff is very friendly and helpful especially Luigi and Maudy

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a good location for a first visit to Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: AnnMudefordDorset
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to find that the poor reviews of this hotel were not true. We had a lovely superior room in a quite location at the back of the hotel (still a good veiw of the church from the window), The staff were friendly and helpful and the breakfast was good with plenty of choice. Given the location of the hotel in the central area the cost was realistic. I would not hesitate to reccomend the hotel if you want to be close to the main sights and the central station (you can walk to the hotel). The coffee maker is a very big bonus!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location”
Reviews.Author: AAway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in this hotel from 7/1 to 7/9. The staffs at the front desk are very nice and helpful. The hotel is at the great location, close to Dam square and Central station. The only thing I did not like was the maid service. The first five nights, they did not change the sheets even when they were not clean, then after that they changed the sheets every day, not sure what is the policy

Reviews.Title: “Think twice, read ALL the negative reviews!!”
Reviews.Author: Kennio
Reviews.Content: I arrived tired on the train from Paris and was happy to see the hotel was within walking distance from the station. When I waked into the hotel I knew immediately that the huge amount of money ($440 for a superior room) was not going to go very far based on the virtually non-existant lobby. I got to my room and shocked to see the shabbyness of everything. There had been some remodeling done in the last several years but everything was dinged and dented with tacky bedspread and curtains. The view was out a maybe 2 foot wide window of a ventilation stack, I really was horrified since this is the most I have ever paid in my life for a hotel. I had just paid to $295 to stay on the left bank in Paris! This is the first time I felt that Tripadvisor reviews let me down. I try to read between the lines on these things and I really can't understand how for the life of me how someone could give 4 or 5 stars to this hotel. I called Hotel(--) who had booked this for me and luckily was able to cancel the 3 remaining days without penalty. At least with me the staff was very aloof even after Hotels(--) called them to see what could be done for me...no upgrade offer or free breakfast offer..nothing. I ended up moving across the square to a large 4 star hotel for about 30% less money and the room was 30% larger.

Reviews.Title: “a perfect base for amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: moungay
Reviews.Content: We have just had 4 nights at the Swissotel and I can highly recommend it as the perfect base to explore amsterdam. The location is fantastic - trams stop outside , a short walk ( 250m) from the canal cruises and the city excursion companies pick up point, 400 m from central station. Room facilities excellent - safe , coffee machine , iron and ironing board , bath robe as well as all the usuals. Our bathroom was spotless and one of the cleanest we have ever had in a hotel. I must say that we were in a superior room and I cannot comment on the standard rooms . Our view was to the alley and hotel next door but the room was very quiet and we had no noise , which is good considering you are right in a central busy part. The staff were polite and really helpful and the concierge was really friendly . The breakfast was AMAZING. What a choice of everything and extremely high quailty. The restaurant and our room had obviously recently been refurbished. The restaurant had excellent decor and was really lovely. For a city break I think this hotel is spot on and our experience here was entirely positive.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: lpool
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Xmas 2005 and had a great time. This was my first visit to Amsterdam and I found this hotel to be in a good location. Come out of the train station and straight to the top of Damrak and you are there. The hotel is situated on Dam square and handy for all of the sights. There are so many restauarants nearby so we didn't eat in the hotel but it looked nice enough. Staff were very good and upgraded us to a superior room which was excellent and the coffee maker was very good (wanted to bring it home!). If you are looking for a good hotel in a central location, I would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Helena73
Reviews.Content: There is no denying that this hotel is in a great location. It's on Dam Square, a short walk from the main train station and canal boat terminus. A number of trams stop just opposite the hotel meaning that you are just steps away from a connection to all parts of the city. Damrak, the street on which the hotel is located, is home to lots of shops of varying quality. Just opposite the hotel is a large, high quality store and there are lots of souvenir shops a few doors away. The very impressive Magna Plaza shopping centre is just around the corner - it's worth a look just for the amazing interior. The hotel is not very impressive looking from the outside - it's quite unassuming - and the reception area is small and unremarkable. We were given a free upgrade from 'standard' rooms to 'superior' rooms. It seems there can be a great difference between the quality of superior rooms. My companion's room was lovely and big, with a large bathroom containing bath and separate shower, seating area for 2 people, and all in all it was a spacious room. My room was a lot smaller, no separate shower and the finish in the room was really poor - dents in the door and wardrobe door, 2 cigarette burns in the bed covers and net curtains. I wasn't very impressed - and probably less so because I'd already seen my companion's room! I was appalled to find that the bin in the room hadn't been emptied and peeping out at me was a porno DVD cover. When I checked the sink in the bathroom, there was a stain so I called reception to complain about the housekeeping service. One of the receptionists came up to see what was wrong, offered me a free drink for the oversight and sent housekeeping to empty the bin. It turned out the stain in the sink was a permanent fixture. I was convinced that this must be a standard rather than superior room, but on checking was assured this was of superior standard ... could have fooled me! I was suprirsed to read negative comments on this website about the soundproofing of the hotel because I found it to be excellent. I'm a very light sleeper and absolutely hate hearing noise from other hotel rooms. This is one of the few times that I can honestly say I didn't hear a sound from any other room. My companion who had the nice room, also had some kind of huge fan - presumably something to do with the air conditioning - just under her window and she had enormous problems getting to sleep, but in my lesser room, I had a great rest! I have to say the beds are very comfortable, there is a great range of channels on the TV - including BBC1 and 2 - and I LOVED the coffee machine in the room. It felt very decadent. The rooms also include a safe, ironing board and iron, mini-bar, 3 telephones (including one in the bathroom), a desk and nice leather chair. Another great feature was the guest office on the first floor which has 2 computers for guests' use and free internet access. As this was to be a relaxing break we decided to take breakfast in bed every morning at a cost of â‚¬20 per time. This was only â‚¬3 more than the restaurant price for breakfast so seemed worth it. We were very impressed with the lovely range of pastries and bread provided, along with eggs, bacon, coffee, juice and fresh fruit. I'd recommend it! We tried the restaurant for dinner on our first night and it was fine but nothing spectacular. The menu is unremarkable and doesn't change. I wouldn't really recommend it for dinner - you'd be better off finding somewhere out in the city. All in all, I enjoyed my stay at the Swissotel but there definitely are some problems there for the management to address. Staff at the hotel are helpful and courteous. The hotel has been rated 4* and I would say it deserves no more than 3*. However, you can't fault the location or the comfort of the beds and that's the main thing really!

Reviews.Title: “Mucho Appreciato!”
Reviews.Author: BudCaruso
Reviews.Content: Had an awesome time in Amsterdam as I always do. I had taken my Mother with me on this trip and she had arrived from Chicago a very weary traveler. Since no regular rooms were ready when we arrived at 10:00 Am the desk manager was kind enough to upgrade us to a granite covered two room suite for the duration of our trip. Of course as a gentleman I was sure to take good care of the person as I would suggest any courteous traveler who is looking for an upgrade might consider. Fabulous room complete with an endless supply of Lavazza expresso from an automatic machine. Very comfortabe beds. Spotless even in the public areas and located next door to the palace and walking distance to central station. You can catch a train to schipol every 10 or 20 minutes. Catch the local train right out front for a ten minute ride to the museums etc. Flower market is like two blocks away. Will be back here soon! I miss the staff already!

Reviews.Title: “Pack ear-plugs”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel a month before travelling, having been tempted by the fact that rooms are 'soundproofed' and location is central. The hotel only lived up to the latter of these claims. We arrived at 5pm on Friday 21st April to celebrate a birthday the following day and were allocated a room on the 4th floor, facing the side-street, just off Dam Square - good sized, with a nice bathroom and two single beds, one pillow each. I'd asked for a quiet room, with king sized bed and a view if possible - my priorities were in that order. We got lovely views of the rooftops. But what none of the reviews mention was the carnival/funfair on Dam Square. It's impossible to escape the noise until it stopped at 11:30pm on the Friday night and then again at midnight on Saturday. But below the hotel room is a sidestreet with a Burger King which opens late and must be used as a spot for night-revellers to get a feed. So there was lots of screaming and shouting all night - so on the Friday night we got little or no sleep - it's hard for the hotel to claim the rooms are soundproofed when streetnoise permeates the windows (they might as well have been open all night). The breakfast was not included, but we tried it on the final morning. Arriving 30 mintues before breakfast ceased there was no scambled egg left, the bacon and beans were dried and unappealing so we went for cereals, juice, tea and toast. â‚¬34 euros for two people was a rip off. Go out to the many cafÃ©s surrounding the hotel for a cheaper alternative (and a better selection). Having paid â‚¬500 for two nights, one of which we barely slept, put a dampener on the birthday celebrations - we were simply exhausted. Not recommended for any light sleepers, or those on trans-Atlantic flights. Unless you pack ear-plugs or sleeping tablets.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We are at last out after a 4-day unpleasant stay. The hotel is far below the level we expected for the amount of money we paid. The room was very modestely furnished and so was the old-fashioned bathroom. Internet connection was out of order and satelitte channels were limited. The hotel has no lobby and the breakfast was less than average with a very limited variety. The street is very noisy. we could hardly sleep day or night. My husband still suffers severe backache because of the unhealthy mattress. The only bright side was the kind and smiling staff. I wish them all the best, probably in a higher standard hotel where they will definely fit better. I do not recommend this hotel in spite of its central location. Trams and taxis are available.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly and very comfortable.”
Reviews.Author: crawshaw
Reviews.Content: we stayed at the Swissotel for 2 nights, and enjoyed the central location, friendly staff, and free up grade to a junior suite. The suite was large, tastefully decorated, and had every amenity that was needed for a pleasant stay. We would certainly reccommend this hotel to anyone visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Best Pick for Proximity to All”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam last week for 8 days for vacation. It was my first trip to Amsterdam and I wanted to be close to all of the attractions. This hotel is in the heart of Dam Square, 10 minutes from Centraal Station and everywhere else we wanted to go. The rooms were cleaned twice a day and the staff was so kind and helpful. I saw the other review that said this hotel was cold and unfeeling, but I am a frequent business traveler and I saw it as warm and inviting. The bathroom had a separate shower stall and bath. We didn't stay in a room overlooking the Square and the room was quiet. I definitely recommend the Swissotel for travelers looking for the true Amsterdam experience and I thank the staff for their wonderful service.

Reviews.Title: “Good experience with the lovely Swissotel Amsterdam”
Reviews.Author: jemnnc
Reviews.Content: I and my travel companions spent 5 nights at the Swissotel Amsterdam in March 2006. All in all, this was a good pick for us. The location could be no better, what with Dam Square and the city's trams at the hotel's front door. There are tons of shopping and dining options within a very short distance of the hotel. All major sites are within walking distance, or are accessed quickly via the city's tram network (which again stops in front of the hotel). Admittedly, this is a business class hotel, so despite that facility being very clean and modern, it nevertheless felt somewhat cold and generic. Rooms however were of a good size. Do note that should your room be at or near the front of the hotel, street noise (especially the trams) can be heard in the room with the window(s) closed. This is not a sound-proofed building. My travel party occupied 2 rooms during our visit. I was in a room near the front of the building, hence the noise previously described. My companions occupied a room near the rear of the building with a view on to an inner courtyard-type space. Their room was totally noise-free. I would like to make special mention of the hotel staff. Everyone employed by the hotel that we had contact with throughout our stay was very polite and very helpful. The front desk staff in particular were always knowledgable, helpful, and friendly. Also, the hotel's "Business Center" offered 2 computers with free internet access. This was a great feature that our travel party greatly appreciated. Should you stay at the Swissotel Amsterdam? Definite yes if traveling for business. As for the pleasure traveler, I would give the hotel an overall 8.5 out of 10.

Reviews.Title: “Very Happy”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a very nice stay at this hotel. Sprang for the junior suite which was enormous by Dutch standards. The glass bathroom is neat and the view onto Dam Square is outstanding. The staff really is wonderful. They let me check in many hours early which I greatly appreciated. The free internet access is a real boon. Unlike the other poster I was very happy with the quality of my room and felt it was very clean and exactly as depicted in the photos. My only caveats are first that it's really a business hotel and you can feel that in the atmosphere and the prices. Second, it really is loud with the trams and people right outside your window. It's nice to be right in the middle of everything - made stopping back to the room with packages or to use the bathroom very easy. But the noise is something to be considered before booking.

Reviews.Title: “Great Choice”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A three night midweek stay in Amsterdam led myself and fiance to the Swissotel. We were upgraded to the Executive suite which was absolutely amazing! Spotless clean and all the extra's you could ever want: 2 flatscreen TV's with sky TV, DVD player, fancy coffee making machine, mini-bar, slippers, robes, complimentary toiletries etc. View of Dam square amazing ! The staff were extremley friendly, and helpful. A wee bit on the pricey side, but I'd say totally worth every penny !!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Wow !! What a gem of a hotel. I spent 4 nights at the Swissotel in March in the Junior suite and can say it was the best quality hotel I have ever stayed in. First of all the location is perfect for centre of Amsterdam. Its on the corner of Dam square and the Damrak and our room overlooked Dam square. Basically this is the centre of the City and is filled with Bars, shops and is a short walk from Anne Franks house and the station. The suite was massive, the hotel was so clean you could eat your meals of the wooden floor (if thats your thing) and the service was first class. It was also cheap for a suite and we got it at a reduced price, do dev worth checking out. Bad Points - The only ones I can think of is the glass door in the suite which dosnt move and the shower door is unfrosted glass (ok if your not bashful), also you dont get breakfast included in price. But dont let this put you off one bit as everything else was perfect

Reviews.Title: “ideal hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the swissotel for 2 nights and would certainly stay there again. We booked a superior room overlooking dam square and although some reviews state that there is noise to be heard I have to say the only noise we heard were the trams ringing which did not bother us and soon got used to. Hotel was very high standard - very clean rooms. All staff we spoke to were couteous and very helpful. I don't think I could praise them enough. look out for deals as the room we stayed in was 350 euros per night if you walked in from of the street. We did have breakfast at the hotel which was good but could have been taken elsewhere for a little less but often tea and coffee was not included so that would have put price up.

Reviews.Title: “Didn't live up to trip advisor expectations”
Reviews.Author: Padstowe
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, the location was fantastic and we had a great view overlooking the square. What I wasn't prepared for was the constant loud noise of the trams. Although the windows were double glazed, the noise at time was awful. Friendly staff who couldn't do enough to help but it would have been nice if the rooms were as plush as the hotel lobby and the food was very expensive. The very large bed was great although the pillows were quite flat and the room was dissapointingly outdated, although clean. Majestics across the sq is ok to eat and Gauchos is a must for a very nice steak. I would avoid the tourist eateries like the plague. Louis bar or the smallest pub in town is great and I would recommend venturing off the beaten track for real Dutch pancakes!

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sabrina-Mitchell
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for our honeymoon and i was nervous about staying here as i had booked it online. It was delightful - very central to everywhere. The room we stayed in was large and airy and i loved coming back to the room each night to find the bed turned down and two mini toblerones on each pillow. Had breakfast in the restaurant on our first morning there but i didn't think it was worth the money but that was just us we didn't like the food there was and we were able to go to a juice bar or a bakery or grocers and get something far cheaper and much more to our taste. i would definately go back here again.

Reviews.Title: “100% understanding”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am writing to let all future Swissotel guests how grateful I am for the understanding of the staff at the Swissotel. My husband and I were meant to travel to Amsterdam last week but unfortunately had to cancel our vacation due to work committments. When I booked the hotel, I was informed of the cancellation fee, but when I came to cancelling, the staff did not charge me for the cancellation. Instead I was met by understanding and a kind voice who told me that they will be happy to have us when we can finally make it Amsterdam. We will make it to Amsterdam soon and I am more than certain that we will stay with Swissotel, especially after being treated like this. I stay in many hotels over the world and I can say, not many people are as understanding as this, they normally only care about the money. Clearly Swissotel aim to please and put your mind at ease that they are there to welcome you, not just take your money. Thankyou Swissotel Amsterdam

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, central to everywhere.”
Reviews.Author: Annie-and-Co
Reviews.Content: An okay hotel. The staff were very helpful and friendly. The hotel is located just off Dam Square. As you come out of the hotel, if you look to the right, Dam Square is no more than a minutes walk away. The hotel upgraded us free of charge as this trip was for my husband's 40th Bithday to a Superior Room. The rooms were compact, however it did have a super king size bed in it. The hotel provides all the facilities as listed by them on line. We did not have breakfast in the hotel as it was â‚¬20 per head per morning. You can get a substantial breakfast for â‚¬6-9 in many other little 'eateries'. I would stay here again, but having fathomed out the trams and bus boats, I wouldn't be against trying other hotels with-in a 1km distance, as you would still be fairly in the thich of it. A lovely city, felt very safe walking around here.

Reviews.Title: “A Suite Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just arrived home from Amsterdam, and the Swisshotel's Suite overlooking Dam Square, Room 407. Look out for deals on this if you can as the extra money spent is worth every cent. From entering your suite, down the stairs into the cloak space, past the open plan dining area with table for 6, into the enormous Living area with DVD, satellite tv, everything you'd need for a home-from-home, through the wooden slide doors into the bedroom with the biggest bed we've ever seen (including a fortuitously placed and very large leather footstool at the end - very nice), thro glass sliding doors into the biggest bathroom in the world complete with spa bath, shower, 2 sinks and the hardest water pressure in Europe, you'll be completely convinced that this is the pefect place to have a wicked time in a great city. Staff were unfailingly helpful, whether they were spotlessly and discreetly cleaning your rooms, answering questions at 2am, turning down your bed complete with chocolates and water, delivering a delicious room-service meal to eat on your HUGE dining table, or taking your credit card details at the end of a wonderful stay. If you want a relaxing stay, right at the heart of whatever you fancy in Amsterdam, come here!

Reviews.Title: “Swissotel to the rescue”
Reviews.Author: ROLLERS
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for a 2 night break to Amsterdam which started terrible. I booked a 3* hotel on the internet from a well known hotel website so we had no reason to expect to find a room which was the size of a box and the only view a brick wall where you couldn't open the window. No way could we spend 5 mins there never mind 2 nights so off we went to seek further accomadation. A friend had told me she had stayed in the Swissotel a few years ago so we headed there. The staff were so friendly on arrival and the only room available was a suite. The suite was beautiful, clean and the view was looking right over Dam Square. We had all our meals in the hotel restaurant which were delicious and great value. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone thinking of staying in Amsterdam. There is nothing I could fault, the staff were so friendly, the food excellent and everywhere in walking distance even the train station which brings you staight back to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Good choice”
Reviews.Author: magvictoria
Reviews.Content: The hotel is situated perfectly for those who is visiting Amsterdam for the first time. We took a KLM shuttle( there were only 3 passengers, 17 Eu return) from the airport and in 20 minutes we found us just in front of the hotel. Our standart room was rather tiny but clean and comfortable. We didn't tried breakfast there but found excellent places to eat in that area. The staff was helpful and friendly. But I would call it 3 stars though due to the size of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Jr Suite and Great Location !!”
Reviews.Author: rickki6
Reviews.Content: We stayed 4 nights, oct 9-12th 2005 and had the junior suite on the top floor. The suite, which was more like an apartment than a hotel room, had all hard wood floors, a big beautiful all glass bathroom with separate shower, toilet and bath, slippers and robes. Great flat screen tv, king bed, couch, desk, a perfect view over looking the Dam, down the block from Central Station so you can walk after taking the train from the airport & very nice staff. I would definately stay here again and take the same room. The hotel was very clean, all staff very attentive and worth every penny. Perfect location to boot. Tram stops outside the front door of the lobby.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: I-hate-ironing
Reviews.Content: We flew into Schipol. Train from Schipol into Centraal Station is a breeze. Walked from Centraal Station to Swissotel (straight down Damrak), which took about 10 minutes maximum. Arrived at hotel at 2pm approx, and were shown to room 386 (I think), which looked into a dark void or alleyway. I was pretty surprised, as we had booked a "superior" room. The room was pretty small, but pleasantly furnished. Before unpacking, I asked if we could be moved to a room with a better view. Two minutes later, we were shown to room 111, which looked right onto Dam Square. It was larger than the first room, with cream and blue decor, and very bright and sunny. I was slightly concerned that the noise from tram stops outside would be annoying, but although you were aware of them trundling around, they didn't affect us at all. The area around Dam Square is excellent, plenty of places to eat and drink, and we did lots of walking. We bought tickets for the Canalbus, which was a great way to see everything. You could hop on and off wherever you wanted, and the ticket was valid until 12pm the next day too. The price was 16 Euros pp. We ate out at Gauchos Argentinian Steak House (between Dam Square and RLD), which was excellent. Second night we ate out at Haesje Claes in Spuistaat, which is a traditional Dutch restaurant. It is surprisingly large, but very olde worlde. Unfortunately, our waitress got our starters and wine order wrong, which had a knock-on effect to our main courses, which were overcooked. We didn't complain, although we would normally, as we were in "happy holiday mode". We were a little disappointed, as we had been specifically recommended this restaurant by a friend. Third night we ate at Kantjil en de Tijger in Spuistaat, which is an Indonesian restaurant. We had a banquet for two, which comprised of about 12 different dishes with a large bowl of rice. Delicious food and nice clean restaurant. Total bill approx 74 Euros. I would definitely recommend this restaurant. We were really surprised at how beautiful Amsterdam is. I'm not sure what we were expecting, but Amsterdam exceeded all of our expectations. It has everything you could possibly want for a lovely city break. Lots of lovely buildings, friendly people, gorgeous eateries etc etc etc. The Red Light District is only a very small area over two canals, and can be avoided if so desired. We had to take a look (obviously), and found it to be a bit tacky and seedy. We were offered drugs, but this wasn't unexpected, so we just kept walking. Keep your hands on your wallet though, I didn't even take my handbag with me, just in case. There were lots of dodgy looking characters in the RLD waiting to take advantage of unsuspecting (or drunk or stoned) tourists. Be streetwise, if someone asks you what time it is, just ignore them - they want you to take your hands out of your pockets, so that they can put their hands in and take away your valuables. Anyway, in summary, Amsterdam is a beautiful place, well worth a visit. I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Not Great - Not bad either”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Started my europe trip here at the Swiss hotel. The location is unbeatable. The staff was nice and the hotel was clean. The air conditioning does not work that well. It was a bit noisy due to the location on dam square. The rooms were larger than most we staying in europe. The breakfast was a total rip off!! Do not eat there, they charged us 40 euro for two people and the food was average. So my rating is average, not the best hotel, but also not the worst. If I were to do it again I would stay in a quiet hotel in the canal somewhere. Most everything is walking distance. Amsterdam was a blast.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the location”
Reviews.Author: Manxtravellers
Reviews.Content: We booked the Swissotel direct online with the hotel (as recommended bya previous Trip Advisor report) for a 4 night weekend stay. My husband and I took his mother for a sightseeing trip to Amsterdam to celebrate her 85th birthday. We wanted a central hotel with good facilities. We obtained a business rate with breakfast and a guaranteed refurbished room, which were both excellent. Although the rooms had no views, they were spacious and comfortable with very acceptable extras such as a large bowl of fruit, bathrobes, tea/coffee making facilities and iron & ironing board. The staff in the hotel could not have been more helpful. For my mother-in-law's convenience due to her age, we took a taxi from the airport each way, which cost 45 euros and both drivers expected a 5 euro tip! A little excessive we thought. Had we been on our own, we would have taken the train to Central Station and walked to the Hotel, which was only about a 10/15 minute walk away. We were central to everything in Amsterdam - tram stop across the road - and the report which complained about the non-nearness of the canals had a different view to ours. There was only a 10 minute walk along Damrak either way to reach the canals and those by Central Station included all the canal boat excursions you could have wished. We had a evening meal in the hotel's adjoining Dam Plaza restaurant which was very good and we also dined in the restaurant of De Roode Leeuw two doors away and the Restaurant Reflet in the Grand Hotel Krasnapolsky across the square, both of which were excellent. We did the evening dinner canal cruise which was a little expensive at over 60 euros, but could not be faulted for the atmosphere and experience. The tour company offices for excursions, booked for us by the friendly Hotel staff, were just across Dam Square, which was also very convenient. The Panoramic City tour, which finished at the Diamond factory, was very disappointing and not worth the money but the trip to Volendam and Marken was very good in terms of value and content. We also enjoyed sitting outside in the warm evening temperatures in the bar of the Dam Plaza with the very friendly barmen and people watching all the activities in Dam Square. A most enjoyable experience and we would recommend the Swissotel as a very good hotel to stay at for a weekend break in Amsterdam - just insist on the refurbished rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Superb location and wonderful room”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 609 at Swissotel from 9th to 11th August to celebrate our 20th anniversary. The location is superb right by Dam square with many great bars and restuarants only a short walk. It only took about 15 mins to walk from central station. The staff were extremely helpful and friendly and our room was excellent with all amenities and a huge ensuite. Everything was extremely clean and tidy, would definately return again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: geordie1
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very clean and tidy and the staff very helpful. Myself and our two children had two rooms and I was pleased with the hotel. The only downside was that for a family it was to close to the red light district and at night the area outside was a scruffy. Overall I found Amsterdam intersting but four days was a sufficient stay. It would be unlikely that I would return.

Reviews.Title: “GUTTED!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: widgetpuppy
Reviews.Content: After staying at Swiss Hotel Berlin, i must admit, i had high expectations. On entering the lobby i was sure i'd made the rights choice, how wrong could i possible be?! As the door to my standard room swung open, my excitement disappeared, my eyes welled up & i couldn't stop the tears! The walls were dull & stained with peeling paper, bathroom was shabby/dirty to say the least, the bed covers were old & worn, the bed uncomfortable, the net curtains dirty, the lighting completely useless! Got a peak inside one of the Junior suits which looked as described in the reviews, maybe there's hope for this place yet???? 'Great Location' is the only good comment i can make with about this hotel. :O(

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great people-watching homebase”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The best hotels, to my way of thinking, are those that enhance your visit to a city. An impeccable hotel with comfortable beds, plush towels, nice art and a friendly staff is great, but if the hotel is isolated, disconnected from the heartbeat of the city and doesn't in any way accentuate your understanding and enjoyment of that city, then it has not really fulfilled its potential. That's why our enjoyment of the Swissotel went well beyond what we found behind its sliding glass lobby doors. Let me explain: 1) Swissotel is right on Dam Square, which is convenient and appropriate in more ways than one. First off, it's very close to most of the things you'll want to see, and the fact that the Amsterdam tram line stops just a few steps outside the hotel's door means that even those places that aren't as close as you'd like them to be (like the Van Gogh Museum) are still easy to get to. Second, Dam Square itself is the best place to hang out and watch Amsterdam life unfold. (That subject is worthy of an essay unto itself, but I'll spare you.) 2) The businesses that surround Swissotel add to the experience as well. For example, there is a world-class bakery just a couple of doors down, as well as a small grocery store. That opens up all kinds of options. Amsterdam is not particularly known as a culinary wonderland, and it can be an expensive city. Thanks to the proximity to these two establishments, for dinner one night we dined on prosciutto and cheese on fresh-baked ciabatta, chased down with a nice inexpensive bottle of Bordeaux, in our room at the Swissotel. There were shops that intrigued my wife, and a nice department store just across the street. Souvenirs? Right there. Nice gifts? Next door. People worth watching? Everywhere you look. 3) The hotel itself is great -- the staff is all very proficient in English (as are most everyone in Amsterdam) and are happy to give advice, directions, etc. We used them as a resource as we planned what to see and how to get there. The fact that you must have a hotel room key to access the elevator creates a much more secure feeling. The rooms are comfortable and well cooled, and the mini-bar is reasonable and also a great place to stash the goodies you buy at the afore-mentioned shops. 4) One final piece of advice: While close proximity to the train station has been mentioned, it's still a decently long walk, particularly if you are dragging as much luggage as my wife likes to bring along. Taxis are readily available outside the train station, and the quick ride won't cost you much. Swissotel would be a nice hotel if it were on a deserted island. But situated where it is, surrounded by complementary establishments, with the tram line outside its door, in easy walking distance of plenty of sights, it's even better.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Penel0pe_Pittst0p
Reviews.Content: We stayed in this hotel for 3 nights to celebrate my birthday in June 2005. The hotel is in a brilliant location, ideal for the shops, Dam Square, Red Light District, boat cruises, restaurants, and its a 10 minute walk from Central Station and about 30 minute walk to Van Gogh museum. We had a deluxe, recenty renovated room which faced out onto Dam Square - a lovely view to watch the world go by and to people spot. It was very clean and tidy, decent size and a really nice bathroom. The room had a safe, iron, ironing board, mini-bar, coffee making facitities and a good range of tv channels. We had a rate which included breakfast and there was wide selection of food available - good value for money. Also, free internet access with printing facities - handy if you want to check in online for your flight which we did. We tried the hotel restaurant and the food was lovely with a wide selection of dishes. We would definitely stay in this hotel again... no complaints at all.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but only give it 3 stars out of 5”
Reviews.Author: 52tripper
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Swisshotel for three nights in March 2005, over Easter weekend so maybe that is why I cannot give this hotel rave reviews. Everyone was extremely busy. We reserved a junior suite and although I'm not sure what I expected, it was below the standard I was expecting for the price we paid. My negative comments are as follows: we arrived early by train and were told that the room wasn't ready as a frequent guest had requested late checkout. We were able to leave our bags with the concierge, however. We returned to the hotel about 3:30PM and our room still wasn't ready so we were offered a complimentary beverage in the bar. We were finally able to check-in a little after 4PM. The floor was sort of a wooden parquet but very dull and didn't look clean. In fact, my husband had to call housekeeping to come up and clean something that had been spilled on the carpet. The bedding looked rumpled and not fresh and clean. There was some "debris" left in a cupboard by a previous occupant which again led me to believe that the room had not been properly cleaned. When we went to check out there was a major rain downpour. Granted the hotel is about a 10 minute walk from the train station but the point is that the concierge did not go out of his way to provide us assistance, i.e. no offer of a hotel umbrella, etc. The tram stopped just outside the door but there was no cover near the tracks where we would have to wait and impossible for taxis to come or so said the concierge. If I were still 20 years old this would have been a great adventure to trek through the rain but we are in our mid-50's and for the price we paid for a supposed 5 star hotel, we felt that they could have done better in assisting us. We didn't eat there so I cannot comment on the food. Probably the best thing about this hotel is its location, right on Dam Square. Our room had a view and given the activity on Easter weekend, it was fun to watch. The bathroom was nice enough, but again, after you've stayed at the Shangri-La Kowloon in Hong Kong for example, well this hotel just didn't measure up in terms of service or amenities. Overall, if you can get a good price for a room it's okay and safe but we won't be staying there again. Sorry.

Reviews.Title: “Great potential, unrealized”
Reviews.Author: DCFrequentFlier
Reviews.Content: I too arrived at the Sofitel with high expectations. The website photos looked great and the staff had responded to all of my email requests quickly and graciously. Traveling with friends, we booked a superior room at a rate of 185E and an executive suite at a rate of 295E. for a four night stay. I arrived around 10am, pleased to discover the hotel was honoring my request for an early check-in. The process was quick, the staff very friendly. Unfortunately, my happiness level decreased when I saw my suite. I was located on the 6th floor overlooking Dam Square. Decorated as you see in the web photos with blonde and dark woods, the tiny living area was about 7-8 feet with a small sofa, chair, desk and built in cabinet with an expresso maker, minibar and tv. The promised cd player was missing. There was a small doorway to the bedroom just barely holding a king-sized bed with another small doorway to a bathroom. Very small, almost like regular room but cut into two compartments. I called the front desk and commented that the suite seemed very different from the one shown on the website which contained a table and chairs. I was told that I'd been given one of the largest suites. This, I learned later, was not true. The second room wasn't ready until later in the day. We appreciated that the staff had provided a room right across the hall from the suite, facing the back of the hotel. It was a tad dark but otherwise fine with the same blonde/dark wood decor. The bathroom was spacious with a very large bathtub and very clean. It closely resembled the website photo. The hotel is located on Dam Square across from the Royal Palace and just a few blocks from Central Station, the center of tourist mecca. The Grand Krasnapolsky is across the square and the Hotel Amsterdam is next door. The tram stops right in front of the hotel with additional stops for other routes very close by. This makes the hotel very convenient. You can hop on a tram or you can walk to your destinations. We walked everywhere, had a fun dinner and walked back to the hotel with no problems. The suite was claustrophobic to sleep in and the noise of Dam Square made it impossible to keep the windows open. The tram bells proved to be the greatest challenge. A housekeeper showed us a junior suite the next morning and, at our request, the hotel allowed us to move into it, generously lowering our rate to 225E. A VAST IMPROVEMENT over the suite. The junior suite is about the same size but without the wall that creates the separate living area. The bathroom wall is made of glass, which adds to the feel of spaciousness. The junior suite is larger than the superior room and not as dark. Bottom line: skip the executive suite and get a junior suite. Request the "07" suites.. rooms 207-507. They are the best with a tiny set of stairs into a room with a beamed ceiling. We didn't land one of these junior suites but the housekeepers recommend them. They also recommend the suites on the opposite corner of the building. I think they are rooms 217-517 but I may be off. Apparently these are junior suites as well the larger one bedroom suites. They also have a tiny set of stairs into the room and come with tiny balconies overlooking Dam Square. If you book with Swissotel, email the hotel and request these corner rooms. Breakfast came with our rate but we only ate in the hotel a couple of times. The breakfast is good, with a variety of breads, pastries, cereals, cheeses, smoked fish, eggs, bacon, sausage, coffee and fresh juices. But there are so many other places you can go and if breakfast is not included, you have to pay 20E which is too much in comparison with all of the nearby cafes. I was also a bit outraged that the hotel charged my friend 20E for the 'breakfast' on the morning of our arrival when all she had was a cup of coffee and roll while she waited for me to put my things into my suite. Other observations: the rooms have AC but it does not always work very well. You cannot leave your windows open because of the noise so the rooms can get a bit stuffy. The decor is very pleasant and contemporary, Definitely a step above many of the other hotels in the area, but even recently renovated rooms have a bit of a 'worn' feel. The beautiful wood floor of the junior suite was badly stained in one area, truly a shame. The housekeeping staff is top knotch. The rooms are very clean and the bathrooms are spotless. The staff overall is very accommodating although one person left us cold. The internet access offered from the rooms is spotty. I could not get it to work and could not get someone from the staff to help me. I had to resort to the business center computers. Also, the crowds of tourists during the day wear you down quickly and the street toward Central Station is a bit seedy at night. I think it is because the hotel is very close to the Red Light District. The hotel has great potential. You really want to like it with its upscale room decor.. central location.. pleasant staff.. and clean enormous bathrooms. Hotels often grow on me after I get past the biasness of my expectations. Unfortunately, this one did not. I doubt I will stay there again. After walking around Amsterdam, I think I will sacrifice the 'great location' on Dam Square for the charm of the canals and more 'residential' areas. I am more likely to stay at a place like the Ambassade for less money, more charm and a bit of quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Location location but.....”
Reviews.Author: ajhaeh
Reviews.Content: Great location situated on Dam Square and within easy reach of all the museums and usual sights. The staff were very friendly, the rooms spacious and clean with an ample bathroom. We had a smoking room, not by choice, on the 2nd floor that looked out onto the Square and it was very noisy at night. The room wasn't soundproofed and when the drunks had stopped singing and arguing below the road sweepers and cleaners took over at 5am. Not much sleep! All in all, a great location in a great city, but just another hotel room. Nothing special for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My Husband and I stayed at the Swissotel for 3 nights and thought it one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure to stay in. Staff were very friendly and helpful, hotel was very clean - couldn't have asked for more. When we arrived there were no standard rooms left so we were upgraded! The restaurant served good food and it was great to be able to sit outside and watch the world go by! The location is perfect with Dam Square and the Royal Palace just outside and only a 5 minute walk from Central Station and the Canal Cruises. We will come back to Swissotel again - can't wait! 10 out of 10!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: turbo911
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 5 night stay at the Swissotel. We picked this hotel because other reviewers said it was in a convenient location, and it was. We stayed in a standard room because we knew we were going to be out most of the day anyway. The room was decent; just don't expect any views out the window. However, it was very quiet though, which was a plus. In addition, we were able to check in at 11am after a long flight from NY. Overall, we would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Excellent Excellent!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just arrived from a business trip to Amsterdam. We paid for a Superior Room but they gave us a Junior Suite because it was our first time to Amsterdam (at least that's what they said). The location was excellent and no taxi was needed since everything was in walking distance from the hotel. The room was luxury with oversized bathroom and a huge bed but very clean above all. Our bedroom was overlooking the Dam Square. Every single staff was friendly and always willing to help you. Swissotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in. I would definetely go again!

Reviews.Title: “Birthday weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sibbers
Reviews.Content: Hotel is in an excellent location, staff very helpful and friendly speak to them about any trips you may want to plan as they may have discount vouchers. we were upgraded to a superior room which was excellent, the only downside was the lack of view. the 1st floor has been recently renovated if you can get a room on that floor it would be a bonus. restaurant is clean friendly lacking in atmosphere and quite expensive but very tasty. i would definately return to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: Claire099
Reviews.Content: Swissotel is in the perfect location to explore amsterdam, right on dam square and just minutes away from all sights. rooms were great - both clean and spacious and staff were very pleasent. A great base to explore the city!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Swissotel on Dam Square in March, 2005. We booked it through a package deal w/Expedia so I'm not sure exactly how much we paid - but it couldn't have been much because the package itself was very inexpensive. Everything about this hotel is top notch. The location can't be beat. Having stayed there for a week, we interacted with a few people at the front desk. Every single staff person was always friendly and helpful. Our room was like new - very European hip. We found it plenty spacious (superior room). Probably the best shower ever in a hotel room! Heated towel rack! And the espresso machine was a godsend. I honestly can't think of anything negative to say. I recommend it highly to anyone looking for a clean, safe, friendly hotel in a superb, central location.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Junior Suite”
Reviews.Author: travelotta
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in 2003 in a junior suite and our room was bright and spatious. Lovely wood floors, comfy king bed, oversized bathroom with swiss bath products and a great view of dam square with large windows. We really loved everything about our room, but here is the however. On our last night when returning to our room in the afternoon while the room was being serviced, from outside the room I saw one of the maids cleaning our coffee cups in the bathroom sink. I witnessed her spitting in the cup to 'polish' it up. Not sure why I didn't bring this up to management at the time as I normally would (in a rage), but this is preventing me from staying here again. I also was able to see a standard room that a friend was staying in on the top floor and it was nice as well, though smaller. It had exposed beams in the ceiling and less windows so kind of dark. Though I'd stay in one of those rooms if needed. Especially liked that we were able to check in early (10am) and were brought a plate of fresh fruit on arrival. Overall I wish I could bring myself to stay here again if it weren't for the spit thing. ...And the Internet access was 25 Euros a day which was ridiculous, but needed.

Reviews.Title: “lovely hotel and staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: excellent hotel. have stayed here twice. the 1st time in a suite which overlooked Dam Square, the room was huge and so was the bed. Chocolates and fruit were delivered every evening, there was a stero and vcr in the room. The 2nd time i stayed which was March 05 I stayed in a standard room which was a lot smaller than the suite but again was very nice. Defo stay here again I love this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: CathBrad
Reviews.Content: Smashing hotel close to everything. Try and book direct with them as rates much cheaper. Treat yourself to the junior suite. I thought it was lovely! Will def go back.

Reviews.Title: “Super Swiss!”
Reviews.Author: JEMJAN
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a long weekend stay in Amsterdam, during which we stayed at the Swissotel. Everything about our stay was excellent. You couldn't have been in a better location, it was close to central station, red light district, public transport (right outside!), bars and restaurants and coffee shops! From the minute we arrived the staff went out of their way to be helpful, nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were comfortable and very well equiped, we were upgraded from a standard to a superior without even asking, and when we asked if we could upgrade to a junior suite the concierge managed to get us moved without delay. The junior suite was possibly the nicest room I have ever stayed in and even had a dvd player. Room service was also avaliable and the food we tried was very nice. We have already recommended this hotel to others and will certainly be staying at the Swissotel on our next visit to Dam.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I could stay forever”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I just spent 6 days at the Swissotel. This was my fourth trip to Amsterdam, and this hotel is by far the best I have stayed in. Situated right off Dam sqare, a couple of minutes walk in either direction to the Central station, red light district, shopping streets and coffeshops, this hotel has the best location available. Last time, I stayed at the Krasnopolski just across the square, but this hotel has a more charming and relaxed atmosphere. I booked a superior room, the only difference from a standard room being a state of the art coffe machine, a bathtub and a bathrobe. The diner on the ground floor looks fancy, but turned out quite average, both in terms of service and food. Prices, on the other hand, tend to be well above average. Bearing in mind the vast number of steakhouses and small restaurants just outside your doorstep, I suggest you spend your time and money elswere. At first I got a rom with view straight into next door brick wall, but when I complained and said I didn't fancy that view for a whole week, they swiftly found another room and moved our luggage over. The rooms are very nice with designer furniture, ironing bord, wireless internet access etc. The cleaners didn't miss a spot during my whole stay. Nothing more to say really.
