I finally found the perfect hotel in Amsterdam, and it was more sad than ever to leave this wonderful, wonderful city.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Canadianknowitall
Reviews.Content: A lovely little classy gem 8 minutes walk from the Centraal Train Station. The area around it is a tad seedy, however once inside the hotel it is heaven. My non-smoking room was hugely comfortable on the 6th floor, very quiet, with a great King size bed and bathroom and an expresso coffee maker that could also make tea. They also offer free internet access to their guests in a cute little business centre on the 1st floor (2nd in North America). The rate including taxes but excluding breakfast was Euros140 and well worth it. It is handy to everything and has a couple of excellent restaurants next to it. The Roode Leeuw (The Red Lion) is next door and is a classic of good cuisine and a few doors further down is a good Indonesian restaurant (The Sukasari) that does a good Rijsttafel (Rice Table) which is a dinner that consists of 21 varied little dishes. Swissotel is a real find for comfort and convenience.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Swisshotel”
Reviews.Author: xxxooo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spending 11 nights at the Swissotel over the holidays, including New Years Eve. We couldn't have picked a better place. After just a five minute walk from the train station, even though we arrived at 8:30 in the morning we were able to check into our room right then. The room was spotless and much larger than we expected, and very quiet. In addition, it had an espresso/cappucino machine which provided us with unlimited coffee/tea (just ask the maid for extra and they'll happily oblige). We weren't even in the room for 20 minutes and a guest services person knocked on our door to welcome us with a large Toblerone bar and to make sure everything was okay. The desk clerks were all very nice when we went down later on, and they gave us a map as well as a lot of good information about getting the Amsterdam pass and so on. The hotel also has an excellent business center on the first floor with free internet access as well as a printer and fax machine. Every single person who worked at the hotel always said hello, helped us locate places on the map, and even made suggestions about things to do. The restaurant food is fairly priced and pretty good. However, be careful about the tuna, as they tend to over cook it. Great veggies! The location couldn't be better, right in Dam Square. We are definitely planning to return to Amsterdam and we will definitely stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, Rated 4 Star but should be Rated a 5 Star.”
Reviews.Author: NYC_K_12
Reviews.Content: First off, I am a travel agent who only been on cruises and to countries all over the Caribbean. This was my first trip to Europe and I decided to make it a vacation trip to get the tourist experience. When I first arrived at the main Central Station and walked outside, I walked into a full blown CITY. I certainly didn't expect to see anything like that so you can imagine the culture shock for me. I am from NYC, but I only expected to see canals and historical buildings so I was pleasantly surprised. As we walked straight down the street to find our hotel, I was also pleased that Swissotel was right on the main strip and close to all the malls, souvenir stores and restaurants. It was approximately a 5-10 mins. walk to the hotel and it was VERY easy to find. When I walked in I was assisted by the concierge desk to be checked in immediately by just giving my name. I asked for the gentleman who did my reservations to thank him for everything and he was still there working late as usual. The hotel staff was very cordial and welcoming which I appreciated being that I did not speak the language and it was a new surrounding for me. I was given a map during my check in and the front desk guy pointed out the main points of the city and what trams (which are all right outside the hotel) will take me there which was very helpful. The Hotel: After checking in, you must have your card key at all times for this hotel because to prevent outside people from every getting into the hotel or elevator you need a key for that also. It is for security purposes because the hotel is right in busy time square so I was happy with that also. The hotel room is VERY modern and unlike any 4 star hotels I stayed in. When you enter with your key, you MUST leave it inside a slot by the door in order for the lights to come on. (Another security measure) The TV was on when I entered and my name was on the screen welcoming me, which gave the room a personal touch. I stayed in a superior room which is online and it was very spacious for my cousin and I since we are both females and need it. The bed was huge and can also be separated into twin beds; their is a huge coffee maker like the one in my office where you don't need to add water as it is permanently connected to a system, hidden fridge with a fully stocked bar (snacks, candy, liquor and other drinks) at a charge. The bathroom is VERY stylish and the cleanest I have ever seen, you can tell this hotel was recently remodeled. There is a phone in the bathroom as well as surround sound in the ceiling for anything being played on the TV in the bedroom. The hotel supplies the guest with a bathrobe, iron w/board and lots of storage with closet space which we utilized to the max. Service: The front desk, concierge and housekeeping are ALWAYS at your disposal and will assist by the touch of a button. I have NEVER had service that good that it was scary. On our first morning, I called to ask how to operate the coffee maker because as I said it was not a normal one. Instead of giving me instructions the concierge came upstairs personally in less that 1 minute and did it for us. I was shocked out of my wits when I called room service for extra sugar and cream and they came instantly. If you want better service than that, I think you need to hire a servant. LOL! Honestly readers, I don't need to give more detail of my experience at this hotel because it was all FIRST Class for me and I stayed at many name brand hotel chains all over the US and never got superb service like I did at Swissotel. I read a couple of the recent complaints and I believe some is exaggerated and not as critical as some other situations people could have received. For seriously PRIME location to EVERYTHING, excellent service and comfortable stay this is the place to be. ENJOY your stay at the Swissotel, where everything for me was done with a personal touch.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a weekend break at the Swissotel in Amsterdam. We stayed in a standard room (226) and had our reservations from reading previous message on here. We were however pleasantly surprised. The room was not big, but the bed was huge, I'm 6'1'' and could easily lay sideways on the bed!! The bathroom was clean with a full size bath and powerful shower. The rest of the hotel was ok, we were on the second floor and it did look a little shabby in the corridors. We didn't eat in the hotel's restaurant and only had a couple of drinks in the bar so can't comment on those too much. It is in a great location within easy walking of all main attractions and really near to tram stops that can take you pretty much anywhere else. We would definitely go back to Amsterdam and probably stay at the Swissotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Junior suites are wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: Kersti
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel in late September, and the junior suite was LOVELY! Bathroom to die for. HUGE, marble, separate bathtub, water closet. We did have to move to a standard room when we extended our stay and it was very small and faced a brick wall (literally could almost touch it if we put our arm out the window). I highly recommend the hotel if you can swing the junior suite prices...location was terrific too.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent !!! Been there 6 times already and going back”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in many hotels in Amsterdam before I found the Swissotel. I was never happy with any of the others and was thrilled to find the Swissotel. It is located right in Dam Square near everything. The staff is polite and very helpful. We are headed there again in a few days and they have reserved my same room as always and will have it ready with certain requests. You can not go wrong by staying here. Nobody is perfect and from time to time things happen but overall I rate them a solid A+. Don't sweat it, this is the place to stay. Rick Ft Lauderdale, Florida

Reviews.Title: “Dude, it was perfect”
Reviews.Author: Love2Travel20190
Reviews.Content: Stayed there for 4 nights at the end of Sep 04'. It was perfect. There is a tram stop right in front of the place. The location was perfect, tons of restaurants, bars, coffeeshops, etc. around the corner. Not only did you need a room key to get into the hotel, you also needed a room key to use the elevator (great security). The staff was great too. At 4am our mini-bar was empty and the front desk brought up a 12 pack of Heineken upon our request. Red Light District was about 4 blocks away yet the hotel is in a major square that was extremely safe. There is also an ATM machine right outside the door of the hotel. My buddy bought an $800 watch from the jewelry store inside the hotel. The whole place was classy and affordable. Just an FYI - you'll pay more for an Orange Juice than you will a beer in Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in a wonderful city”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Before booking my trip to Amsterdam, I read all the reviews of Swissotel here on this site and must admit I was a bit worried by some of the negativity. However, the establishment is usually highly recommended and, after e-mailing the hotel to confirm the building works have now been completed, I had no hesitation in booking my stay at the Swissotel. One of the greatest advantages of the hotel is its location on Dam Square. It is literally a 5 minute walk from Centraal Station, which has frequent trains to and from the airport (about one every 10 minutes). You just head out the main exit of the station and walk straight down the Damrak - a busy, vibrant street full of shops and restaurants. The hotel itself doesn't have a restaurant, but this is not a problem with so many other establishments nearby. As well as the Damrak, behind the hotel is a fabulous network of shopping streets, with restaraunts ranging from the usual McDonalds and Burger King to chinese, indonesian and dutch cafes and restaurants. The hotel itself is quite modern, with a welcoming reception desk, a small lobby and elevators that service all floors. We elected to stay in a Junior Suite on the 5th floor. We were originally going to book both the flights and hotel through Expedia, but found it was actually cheaper to book the hotel only through this site, and get cheaper flights through Easyjet (as we were flying from Britain). Indeed, for the same price Expedia quoted for a Superior Room plus flights, we found we could actually upgrade to a Junior Suite when we bought the flights separately! What attracted us to the Junior Suite was not only the larger room size and good location at the front of the building, but also that it was the only type of room that guaranteed a king size bed. It was my first holiday with my boyfriend, and so we decided we should definitely go with the Suite! The bed is huge - it could easily fit four people across. There is also a sofa with a large television, as well as a large desk and chair, spacious wardrobe and in room safe. One side of the room was made up of large floor-to-ceiling windows, which opened up and provided a fantastic view of the streets below. However, the highlight of the room was the huge bathroom that was separated from the rest of the room by glass doors. (Luckily, the toilet was behind a shaded door to maintain privacy!) There was also a bath, sink, and massive shower. Very nice. On the final day of our stay, we decided to order breakfast. We had gone for the cheap option of buying breakfast from McDonalds and various bakeries on previous mornings, but thought we would splash out on our final morning. At 20 Euros each, it's not cheap. The food provided was adequate, but I'm not sure it is worth 20 Euros. You get to choose from quite an extensive list, however not everything we selected was delivered to us. We ended up with coffee, two cups of juice, two bowls of cereal, two bowls of fresh fruit, one serve of bacon and one serve of eggs (in the hot food section on the menu, you can only choose one item each, which makes it a bit difficult to construct a fry up!) Like I say, it was adequate, but I would urge visitors to fill up at nearby eateries instead. Also, while staying in our room, the hotel provided bathrobes, which are free of charge for the duration of your stay. However, I was a little surprised when I could only find one bathrobe! And, upon ringing the front desk, I was told this was the standard! Upon my request, the desk kindly sent up a second bathrobe, so no complaints. Although I did find it strange that the standard practice is only one bathrobe is provided per room. The hotel also provided one bottle of water free of charge, rather than two, and when they turned down the beds, they only did one side. Not a real grumble, but it was a little confusing when there was clearly a couple sharing the room! The hotel is 4 stars and it does deserve that rating. It is clean, modern and efficient. European hotel standards are different to those elsewhere in the world, and 4 stars may give some visitors the impression it is going to be something more than it is. However, you just have to go with the flow, enjoy what you are provided with, and, most importantly, don't linger in your hotel room - get out there and enjoy all that this wonderful city has to offer! :-)

Reviews.Title: “excellent service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. specially Front Desk and Housekeeping staff are very nice and helpfull. Great location, in the hart of the city of Amsterdam. We stayed in one of the newly renovated superior rooms and we were very impressed. We have stayed at many hotels but the SwissÃ´tel is surely one of the best we've seen. We've read some negative reviews on this site but we feel that they are really not deserved.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable, but the rooms are small”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel Amsterdam in June 2004 and were disappointed when we first saw our hotel room. Well, it's not that the room was that bad, but for a reputable 4*+ international property, we had expected better than what we got. The room furnishings looked outdated, although the small lobby looked modern and newly renovated. We were surprised to find that the hotel room was rather small -- the small elevator and narrow corridor to the rooms were hints that the rooms weren't going to be spacious either...almost had a clastophobic feeling. The bathroom door had to be closed all the time or it would block the passage to the main door. On a brighter note, the room was clean and decent. The staff were friendly. The hotel is also conveniently located near the Dam Square and within walking distance to the train station. By the 3rd day of our stay, we'd readjusted our hotel expectations and focused instead on enjoying our tour of The Netherlands.

Reviews.Title: “French for 'Howard Johnson's'”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The SwissÃ´tel on Dam Square is the classic model for "don't judge a hotel by its lobby." The rooms are depressing and worn, which is maybe why the lighting is so frustratingly dim. Really, for a place that touts itself as a 4* property, a little post-eighties renovation is in order. Now, if only they could get the Burger King outside your window to turn off its blinding lights...

Reviews.Title: “Solid 4-Star Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smkr75
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 4 days here in early September. We had one of the "Superior" rooms on the 5th floor. Room overlooked the inner courtyard and was quiet even with the window open. During our stay, the outside construction was mostly finished, no scaffolding up just using a bucket truck for some brickwork. Front desk was efficient on checkin and checkout and provided good recommendations for restaurants etc. Didn't use the hotel breakfast, too many other cheaper alternatives nearby. If you don't mind the area, Dam Square/Damrak, Swissotel is an excellent choice.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel---THE place to stay in A'dam”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I travel to Amsterdam frequently and would not consider staying anywhere other than the SwissÃ´tel. This is one of the nicest hotels out there. The location in Amsterdam could not be better, here at the Dam you are right in the middle of everything you could possibly want in a visit to Amsterdam. Everything is within easy walking distance or a short tram ride away. The junior suites are spacious and refined, with great views of the Dam Square and the National Monument---the 5th floor in particular has wonderful high ceilings with exposed beams. The inlaid wood floors in the rooms, the marble-topped mini bar, the leather chairs, the giant wardrobe, the artwork---everything about this place exudes elegance. The spacious bathroom with separate shower and soaking tub, marble floors & countertops, fresh flowers, and complimentary bathrobe and slippers is beyond compare. As I said, I am a regular traveller to A'dam and after staying here I will never stay anywhere else. The breakfast, although not included in the room price, is more than worth the extra 20 euros. Also, all the staff members were friendly and helpful...including one HOT bellboy who I've got some stories about that aren't appropriate for sharing here!!! As to those reviewers whining about the renovations...I was there again in August, and yes there was some scaffolding, but I was NEVER awakened by the workmen or their noise. All hotels undergo some renovations at one time or another; this is not the first hotel I've ever stayed in while improvements were going on and I bet it won't be the last. The SwissÃ´tel is a very nice place to stay, and it is my hotel of choice when visiting Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent quality hotel”
Reviews.Author: SimonPDurham
Reviews.Content: I was understandably nervous when I booked this hotel, then read some of the reviews here, so much so I emailed the hotel with copies of the reviews and asked them to comment. I was assured that they were not an accurate reflection. I decided to trust the assurances and I am so glad I did. The hotel is very clean with excellent rooms and the staff were all polite and very friendly. Yes there was scaffolding outside (being taken down) but this did not affect our stay. Yes the restaurant was closed on an evening, but with an excellent one next door, and another 50 eating places within 100 yards to suit every taste again we did not find this a problem. Would I stay again or recommend it? Yes, without question.

Reviews.Title: “Great room shame about the builders”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a junior suite at the Swissotel for our wedding anniversary having read good reviews on line, including one which said the rooms were sound proofed. When we arrived I was surprised to see the scaffolding as no mention was made of any building work. The room was amazing, and was possibly an executive suite having looked at the photos in the hotel lift. We had a large living room with a dining table, sofa, chairs and tv as well as Espresso machine. The bedroom (behind sliding doors) and bathroom were together the same size as the living room. The bed was massive and very comfortable, and the bedroom had it's own tv. The bath was a spa bath and the separate shower excellent. A complementary toblerone topped off our delight as we settled in. In the evening there was some minor traffic noise and the odd tram could be heard. The view was obstructed by the scaffolding but wasn't what we'd booked the room for so we were not concerned. Unfortunately we were woken at 07.15 to the sound of builders. There was an initial roll call and then hammering for over half an hour. Not really what we'd hoped for on a romantic break. When we checked out I raised this with the staff who apologised stating that the builders were not supposed to start before 09.00. I accepted the apology as it seemed genuine and the rest of our stay had been so good, however reading these reviews it would seem that the 07.15 builders wake up call is a regular occurance. I'll be taking it up with the hotel. Once the building work is complete I would recommend the hotel as it was one of the best I've stayed in.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful room & helpful staff”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Swissotel for 3 nights. Our initial reaction to the outside of the building was disappointment because there was scaffolding, but the quality of the room and the friendliness and helpfulness of the staff more than compensated for a compromised view of the Dam Square, which frankly isn't the most beautiful thing to look at when you wake up anyway. The first room to which we were assigned had ineffective air conditioning, and the staff then reassigned us to another and better room. The room was very comfortable and a joy to come "home" to at the end of each day. Also, each member of the desk staff that we interacted with was courteous, pleasant and extremely helpful. They always had good and helpful answers to questions about restaurants, transportation, the local cinema, museums and anything else. Thanks to the staff's suggestions, we avoided waiting in line at the Van Gogh museum, we saved money on our rides on the tram, and we ate at good restaurants. I noted while there that there were no workers on the scaffolding. Had there been, I can imagine that their presence would have been a problem if they had started working early in the morning. I think this is a very good hotel that becomes an excellent one once the exterior work is done and the scaffolding comes down. I don't know when that will be.

Reviews.Title: “Disgusted”
Reviews.Author: SharonMcC
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2-night stay at the Swissotel. We were extremely disappointed with this hotel, after reading great reviews on this site and elsewhere. Our room, requested as non-smoking, smelled very smoky, and it was also very dirty--dirty carpet, dirty bathroom, etc. Scaffolding and plastic was our 'view' outside our window. Our bathtub did not drain properly and spewed sewage when we ran the faucet. After complaining to the condescending manager, our rate was reduced by 10 E a night. We were not at all happy with this hotel or its treatment of us. Also, it was very noisy at night, with noise coming from the carnival at the Dam square, and the tram which runs right outside the hotel, as well as from the generally very busy street outside. Pro: It is an easy walk from the train station and convenient to restaurants, shopping, sights, etc. That is the only reason I give this hotel two stars.

Reviews.Title: “Average...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked the hotel for a weekend's stay. It's very near to Centraal Station, which is great if coming from the airport. The Hotel itself is right near Dam Square, and 5 minutes from the Red Light District - so you're near the action! I had booked a Superior room and was given a single superior. The room was spacious, but the bed was a small double - no real issue there but I expected a standard hotel double (Queen) - there is a difference. The people next door were quite noisy, so I asked if I could be moved, and reception moved me to a superior double - good staff. The room (superior) - big, spacious room. Clean and furnished to general 4-star hotel standards. A large desk for business travellers with an excellent leather desk chair. An expresso coffee machine was a pleasant surprise. A clean and excellent (with above average pressure) shower. The bed was disappointing. Looking like a kingsize, it's actually two doubles thrown together - careful you don't fall through the gap! My room, as with most of the rooms had no view. And expect to hear noises from most of the rooms - unless you specifically ask for a quiet one! The Hotel doesn't have a lobby as such - just a reception area and a sofa round the side. The restauraunt is small but there's no excuse to be eating there, when there's a whole city to explore. Breakfast menu is restricted and expensive. In summary - the superior room is of good size but the two beds thrown together was disappointing. Having no view was also disappointing but as a tourist, one shouldn't be spending too much time inside. The staff seemed friendly and overall, whilst I wouldn't stay there again, I didn't wholly like or dislike my stay. Average is the only conclusion to give...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: BobMc
Reviews.Content: A great location and very comfortable. The staff were very helpful and polite. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel at 4 star prices”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The only thing nice is the Staff and the entry way which makes you think 4 star hotel...but when you get to room, you find no view, noise on street below, stained carpet, and twin beds pushed together... overall, you are better off at a nice B&B a few blocks away from the busy center

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were disappointed with the Swissotel in Amsterdam. We had reserved a smoking room with a king bed but were told they had only no smoking rooms available upon check in. They offered a smoking room with two twin beds but I refused and demanded a complete refund. Seems to me when a four star hotel takes your money in advance to hold a reservation - they ought to have a room you agreed to. Finally they decided to let us smoke in a non smoking room with a king bed as long as we keep the window open. To top it all off the room had NO view. The window literally opened directly to a large bank of airconditioning and heating equipment despite advertisements boasting all rooms had a view of either Dam Square or a side shopping street. All in all very disappointing. Next trip I will try the Krasnapolsky across the street.

Reviews.Title: “junior suit”
Reviews.Author: FrancesBedfordshire
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights here, originally meant to be staying in the superior double but then decided to go for the junior suit as it was only 40 euro extra a night. Lovely hotel, overlooking Dam Square. Shops, cafes and bars located outside hotel. Red light district 5-10 minute walk away. Small amount of noise can be heard from outside whilst in your hotel room but nothing to disturb you at night. Overall a very pleasent hotel in the heart of Amsterdam. I will definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Bouff
Reviews.Content: Booked this Hotel for us and some friends, for our first visit to Amsterdam, after looking at consumer reviews on this web site. Our room was not as large as I envisaged but was very clean and very comfortable. Fully equipped. Bathroom was very nice although we did struggle to get the shower set up so we didn't flood the bathroom!! On arrival, at check in staff heard mention that it was one of our freinds birthdays. A bottle of wine was sent to their room with the Hotels compliments. A very nice touch. Location of the Swissotel is superb. A gentle walk from Central Station and right on Dam Square so everywhere was easy to get to. Good security with key card required to access lifts and stairs to bedrooms. Would definitely book here again if returning to Amsterdam.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but . . . .”
Reviews.Author: JoeLeTaxii
Reviews.Content: We went to Amsterdam for the weekend and booked at the last minute. We had some difficulty finding a room where I'd stayed before (near Vondel Park), but found a "spring special" on the Swissotel - 270 euros/night for a standard room. It was very standard - two twin beds with the risky gap. Room 228 - staring at the brick wall. Carpet had lots of stains - due for a refresh. We didn't have any espresso machine, but the room did come with an electric kettle and Nescafe. Decent pillows, good water pressure, relatively quiet. Not bad, but not worth north of $300 after taxes and fees.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: You are right off the Dam at this hotel. All the major tram lines are right out the front door, and it's an easy hop to get to the train station. Lovely service. I liked the hotel restaurant - not your usual fare. Quick tram ride to the Van Gogh museum & Rijksmuseum. Oh - while you are that museums, at one end of the park there is a really nice subterranean grocery store. Stock up on snacks and pop as the mini bar is a rip off (as they are at all hotels). There is a mini-mart a couple doors down from the hotel, but it's more expensive and there's less selection.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay! In the center of all attractions!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: i really enjoyed my stay at the swissotel amsterdam. it is a very nice hotel with great service and friendly staff. Rooms-the rooms very nice and modernly designed. the bed was huge and very comfortable, and when we requested a rollaway bed, the staff gladly complied. the room has a variety of tourist magazines that are very helpful. we stayed in a junior suite and it was spacious and had good wood floors. one problem was that, late at night you can hear a lot of traffic through the window that might keep you up at night. Bathrooms-the set up of the bathrooms are quite odd. there is no privacy, but merely a glass door that leads from the room. this is quite inconvenient if you want privacy while bathing or showering. luckily, there is a separate door for the bathroom. there is a huge shower and a separate sunken bath, both very nice. there are adequate supplies such as nail filers and special vanity sets for your beauty needs. it is a large bathroom. Staff and Service-staff are very kind and will help you with directions or whatever you may need. Service is very good, and every morning you get a free nice buffet breakfast at their posh restaurant. For lunch and dinner although, their menus are quite unvarietized, i would suggest dining out. Cleanliness-this hotel is very clean!!! I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS HOTEL!!

HotelInfo.Name: Swissotel Amsterdam
HotelInfo.Address: Damrak 96, Amsterdam 1012 LP, The Netherlands
